loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund Q. is single and is taking care of one of his brother’s children. He has received an education through senior high school.

Since 2003, Edmund has sold lining, thread and other sewing materials in Cape Coast. He also works as a tailor, specializing in sewing men’s clothing. Edmund uses his income to take care of his brother’s child.

Edmund will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials for resale and to also buy equipment to improve his services. With the new profits from his expanded business, Edmund plans to reinvest back into his enterprise in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and to buy equipment to improve his services

loans.name: Taibatu

texts.en: Taibatu is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells medicines, jewelry and drinks.  She is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines and jewelry to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mary Serungoji Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 31 years old and married with one child aged 12 years. Her child goes to school. She resides and owns a three-roomed house where she is living with six people. She takes care of four additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets two meals a day.

Mary resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop selling clothing materials in Kiyembe, one of the Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of five people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week and uses public transport to work. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, feeding the family and rent for the business premises.

Mary has been in this business for the last fifteen years. Her main challenge is license fees. She has been with MCDT for over twelve years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials to sell. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning another shop.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Estrella De Mar Group

texts.es:
"Estrella de Mar es el Grupo constituido por don Tito y doña Dunia, los mismos que son primos y viven el la misma zona pero en casas distintas.
Doña Dunia, tiene por actividad la elaboración de joyas tanto de oro como de plata, a parte de esa actividad prepara chicharron de pollo y fricase los fines de semana. El crédito está dirigido a la compra de dos recipientes para preparar chicharron de pollo y ademas de comprar oro y piedaras preciosas para la elaboración de joyas.
Don tito es técnico en computación, su actividad esta relacionado con el arreglo de computadoras, la instalación de redes, la digityalización de videos, etc. El crédito está dirigido a la compra de una computadora personal."
texts.en:
The Estrella de Mar (Ocean Star) Loan Group consists of Don Tito and Doña Dunia, who are cousins living in the same neighborhood but in different houses. Doña Dunia works at producing gold and silver jewelry. Aside from this activity she prepares chicken, fried or fricasseed, on the weekends. The loan is intended for the purchase of two containers for preparing fried chicken and also to buy gold and precious stones for making jewelry. Don Tito is a computer technician who works at setting up computers, installing networks, digitalizing videos, etc. His loan is intended for the purchase of a personal computer.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, containers and a personal computer.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Señora Juana is 44 years old and is married with six children. She lives in the small town of Yarinacocha, a suburb of the city of Pucallpa.

Juana dedicates herself to selling home goods such as bedspreads and electronic appliances including radios, cassette players and other items. Her husband is also an independent businessman.

Juana has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about a year and a half and belongs to the communal bank, "Los Manguitos" (“The Little Mangoes”). She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in home goods, which she continues to sell in the rural towns along the long highway from Pucallpa to the capital, Lima. Juana works together with her husband.

Juana is currently requesting a loan of 1,200 soles which she plans to invest in more home accessories and electronics. She hopes to diversify the types of products she has available for her customers.

Juana is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their financial support and appreciates the confidence that the organization places in her. She is committed to making her loan payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: To buy more home goods and electronics for sale

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
In a crowd of people walking back and forth from one person to another in the market, in particular the place selling food such as fried meatballs, toasted sausage, and toasted meat – M. is one of the sellers and has run that kind of business for years.

Her husband, Pov, 39, works as a photographer and sometimes as a motor-driver in the city. Their marriage gave them four children, all of whom are still young and attend school.

With great deliberation, M. and Pov decide to take a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike to upgrade their living standard. They want all their children to finish university.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to upgrade their living standard

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She has a store where she sells books and has been in the business since 1999.  She hopes for the amount of N100, 000 to purchase more books to sell. she say thank you to all Kiva lender

loans.use: To purchase more book to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene manages a village store as an additional source of income. Irene is happily married to Jhonny, a construction worker in their village. Her family lives in General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. They are blessed with three children: Aileen Mae – 13 years old, Jhon Rhey – 11 years old, and Jhon Reyven – 9 years old. All of her children are enrolled in a public school in their village. She is hoping that with her business, she can provide the school allowance of her children.

Irene wants her business to grow and she would like to avail of a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She will wisely use the loan for the improvement of her store. Irene aims to send her children through school to have a degree in college, but she is worried about the financial resources. She just hopes that through her business, she can achieve all her dreams.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Ameenullah

texts.en: Ameenullah son of Shir Mohammad he is marred and has a video CD Shop in Jalalabad city and he have good experience in his business. He has already successfully completed his first cycle loan and expanded his stock. Still, he wants to further expand his business with full success, so now he has requested his second cycle loan to enlarge his shop so as to attract more customers and make good income to help his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buying necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Sameira Group

texts.en: Sameira is the leader of this Group, which has three members. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Sameira and Mah Jan want a loan to buy necessary materials for their tailoring businesses. Gull Tab wants to take a loan for her general store.  The members say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Women In Development Group

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata K., Fatu C., Kadiatu S. and Mariama S.. Together, they form the Women in Development loan group.

Fatmata is the group’s leader, and at 41 years of age she has been in business for over fifteen years selling bagged rice, tomatoes, palm oil, and other staple goods at a market stall about twenty miles from Freetown.

Fatmata is married to a police officer and, together, they have four children, three of whom attend school and one of whom is too young.

The Women in Development Group is seeking a loan of 1.8 million LE from SMT (a partner of Shine On Sierra Leone, Waterloo) and Kiva lenders. Fatmata plans to use her portion to buy additional supplies of palm oil and rice to sell from her stand.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of bagged rice and palm oil

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, y con sus tres hijos que son estudiantes.
Ella cuenta con un pequeño local frente a su casa donde todos los días se dedica a la venta de jugos, bebidas, sándwich y caldo de gallina, en un horario de 7 a 11 de la mañana. 
En esta actividad lleva un periodo de 2 años y le va muy bien; sin embargo, también trabaja los sábados y domingos en la producción de su chacra, tiene 9 hectáreas de palma. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse en actividad y sobre todo, se relaciona con personas de otros lugares, además le es muy rentable porque su negocio se encuentra en un buen lugar y sus ventas son satisfactorias
Para el futuro, Estela quiere llegar a tener su propio restaurante.

Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que son personas organizadas y muy responsables con su trabajo. Estela invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en su negocio de comida y en la compra de abono para sus palmas.
texts.en:
Estela, 35, lives with her husband, who is a teacher, and their three children, who are students. She has a small stand in front of her house where she sells juices, drinks, sandwiches and chicken soup every day from 7 to 11 in the morning. She's had this occupation for the past 2 years but she also works weekends on her farmlands; she farms 9 hectares of palm. What she likes about her work is keeping busy but, above all, being able to relate to people from other places. Besides, it is quite profitable because her stand is well located and her sales are satisfactory. For the future, Estela would love to have her own restaurant. This is her 8th loan with MFP and what she most likes about her communal bank is that the members are organized and very responsible with their work. Estela will use the money to buy more food and to buy natural fertilizer for her palms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Modinat

texts.en:
Modinat is 40 years old and married with four children. She is a member of Kiva partner, LAPO.
For the past five years Modinat has run a business selling body cream. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more body cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream to sell

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao H. owns and operates a small handicraft business, turning rattan into sets of furniture. She is 40 years old and married to Kean Pleu, 40, a local rattan maker. The couple has been married for many years and is blessed with six children, all of whom are no longer in school. She makes at least 10 or 20 sets of rattan furniture before selling out and almost all of her clients come directly to her house to order. Sao H. would like a loan to buy more raw materials to make rattan furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make rattan furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Arlin Yadira

texts.es: La señora Arlin Yadira R. I., de 29 años de edad vive en el reparto J.R. Padilla es casada y su esposo es agronomo, el Señor le apoya en los gastos familiares y juntos tienen 2 hijos entre las edades de 8 y 3 años el mayor aculamente cursa el 4to. grado de primaria, dentro de los principales anhelos de la familia esta el obtener una vivienda propia, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace 8 años y uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido a lo largo de su trabajo en este rubro ha sido la falta de financiamiento para la adquisisión de materia prima, ha futuro desearía construir una pequeña tienda en donde vender las prendas terminadas, pero para realizar este sueño lo primero sería elevar la producción y con esto buscar el aumento en los ingresos de tal manera que solicita un credito con el fin de comprar materia prima para la elaboración de ropa y venta del mismo. Esto les traería mejores condiciones de trabajo y la posibiliadad a largo plazo de abrir su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Arlin Yadira R. I. is 29 years old, married, and lives in the J.R. Padilla District. Her husband works as an agronomist and helps with the family expenses. They have two children, age 8 and 3, with the oldest child starting the fourth grade. One of their dreams is to have a home of their own.

Arlin has worked as a seamstress for eight years. One of her main problems has been a lack of funding needed to purchase materials. In the future, she hopes to build a small shop where she can sell her finished garments. To achieve this goal, she has to increase her production so that she can generate more income.

Arlin is requesting a loan in order to buy the materials needed to make clothing that she can sell. This will also provide her with better working conditions and the long-term possibility of opening her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Denny

texts.es:
La Sra. Denny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella. Denny presenta Estudios Superiores de Técnica en Enfermería, no lo ejerce por dedicarse al trabajo, desde muy joven.

Denny, ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su esposo, emprendieron su negocio de venta de ladrillos, iniciándose con un capital de 8,000.00 Nuevos Soles, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus ladrillos y la buena atención al cliente.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y lleva 22 años dedicándose a la venta de ladrillos, ubicada en un fundo que tienen lejos de la ciudad y sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones y clientes fijos.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Denny, se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante y ser grandes empresarias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Denny belongs to the community bank "Honesty and Work" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, and department of San Martín. She is a 49 year-old married mother of four, three of whom still depend on her. Denny shows superior studies in nursing technique. She does not practice because she has worked since she was very young. In light of the need to contribute to her household income, Denny was motivated by her husband to begin her own business selling bricks, which she started with 8000 nuevos soles. Little by little she obtained positive results for her work because of the quality of her bricks and her excellent customer service. Today, Denny continues with the same business, having dedicated 22 years to selling bricks. She sells from a country estate they have outside of the city and her principal customers are neighbors, institutions, and certain clients. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles, Denny will buy tins to bake her bricks. She will also invest part of her money into her monthly pay. Denny feels very happy in the work she does every day. She appreciates the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting people like her who want to work hard, get ahead in life, and become big businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tins to bake bricks

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
EL señor Juan Luis retorna desde el año 2007 para sacar un segundo credito pero actualmente trabajo como codeudor de la señora Nayda, el señor Juan se dedia a la compra (rescate) de antiguedades para luego restaurarlas o simplemente venderlas en su estado actual, para esto el señor va a la feria e El Alto, la feria de Oruro y tambien tienen contactos que le proveen de estos productos, el cliente tambien genera otros ingresos por venta de plateria ya sea como antiguedades o marcos de plata Peruanos que trae del vecino  Pais, es para esto que el cliente solicita este credito ya que tiene unas cuentas por pagar a sus proveedores de marcos para cuadros que le fueron entregados dias atras.

Esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion de credito.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Luis is returning from the year 2007 to take out a second loan. Now he works as a co-debtor with Señora Nayda. Señor Juan buys (rescues) antiquities to later restore them or simply sell them in their present condition. For this, he goes to the fair at El Alto, the fair at Oruro, and he also has contacts who provide him with these products. The client (Señor Juan) also generates income through the sale of silver such as antiquities or frames of Peruvian silver that he brings from the neighboring country. It is for this that he is applying for the loan, since he has some bills to pay to his suppliers of picture frames, which they delivered to him some days ago. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Karen Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Karen Yaneth S. vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica al negocio de produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, desde los 16 años realiza este tipo de actividad, vende de Lunes a Domingo. Ya tiene clientes fijos de su colonia y otros en colonias cercanas. Empieza desde las 12: 00 Mediodia hasta las 7:00 de la noche, manda a vender a una sobrina y le paga $ 4.00 diarios.
Su esposo el señor Juan Carlos labora para una empresa constructora, tienen cuatro hijos, tres estan estudiando y el ultimo es un bebe de cuatro meses. 
Gracias a su negocio ella puede pasar al cuidado de sus hijos ya que no tiene que salir de su casa, es una mujer muy trabajadora y necesita el credito para la compra de maiz y leña debido a que las ultimas semanas ha tenido problemas para encontrar la leña.
texts.en:
Sra. Karen Yaneth S. lives in the Flor del Campo subdivision and manages her business of making and selling corn tortillas. She has been in this line of work for 16 years and sells her products Monday to Sunday. Karen has regular customers from her neighborhood and others from the surrounding areas. She works from 12pm to 7pm. She also has a niece who she pays $4/day to sell her products. Her husband Juan Carlos works for a construction company. They have four children, three are in school and the youngest one is a four month old baby.

Thanks to her business, she has been able to care for her children without having to leave home. She is a hardworking woman and needs this loan to buy corn and firewood. Within the past few weeks, she has had problems obtaining firewood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & firewood

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es: Doña Juana, es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa, desde hace varios años administra su propio negocio, que inicio con fondos propios y ayuda de su familia,. Con los financiamientos que ha tenido ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa. Para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo cual ha ido haciendo. Con algunas dificultades que las ventas se ponen bajas, pero siempre se vende. Esta temporada de verano es buena el cual viajara a puerto cabezas al norte del país donde establecerá la fritanga es por eso con esta inversión hará compra de granos básicos, carne, pollo, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, golosinas para vender en variedad y a preferencia del cliente. El cual espera lograr el objetivo de mejorar las ventas como obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder  poner cerámica, comprar mesa, para una mejor comodidad en su negocio, y poder atraer clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Miss Juana is a very hardworking and active woman. For several years she has administered her own business, which she started with her own funds and with the help of her family. With the financing she has obtained she has managed to make improvements to her home to provide her customers with better service, which she been able to do. It has been difficult sometimes when sales are low, but there are always sales. This summer season is good to travel to Puerto Cabezas in the northern part of the country, where she will set up a place to sell food. This is why with this investment she will buy basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, vegetables, sodas, and candy to sell what her customers prefer. She hopes to increase her sales and obtain higher profits. Her plans are to install ceramic tiles and to buy a table for the comfort of her customers, and to attract new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, vegetables, sodas, and candy

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 54 year old married lady with two children. She has been selling curtains, table cloths, and table mats for 13 years. She also earns more income from farming which she does together with her husband.

Ann belongs to a group named Emmanuel where she saves her money and shares business ideas. She has also been a member of Faulu Kenya which has helped her business grow.

Ann has requested a loan of 80000 KES to buy curtains and table cloths to sell. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one. She sees herself having many business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy curtains and table cloths to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Dionicia M. C.  es comerciante desde hace cuatro años vende en el mercado de Santa Ana variedad de marisco su producto lo compra a las cinco de la mañana a la gente que trae a vender de tonala.
La Señora M. C. es madre de 4 niños tres de estos estudian por los cuales ella se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante ella tiene poco de trabajar con nosotros pero manifestó que le gusta la modalidad de los financiamientos por que así ella le da vuelta a su dinero rapido no siente los abonos y además de eso con la ganancia puede realizarles alguna mejora a su casita para ella y sus hijos
texts.en:
La señora Mercedes Dionicia M. C. es comerciante desde hace cuatro años vende en el mercado de Santa Ana variedad de marisco su producto lo compra a las cinco de la mañana a la gente que trae a vender de tonala. La Señora M. C. es madre de 4 niños tres de estos estudian por los cuales ella se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante ella tiene poco de trabajar con nosotros pero manifestó que le gusta la modalidad de los financiamientos por que así ella le da vuelta a su dinero rapido no siente los abonos y además de eso con la ganancia puede realizarles alguna mejora a su casita para ella y sus hijos

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar variedad de mariscos

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children.

To make a living Fely plants rice crops and raises pigs. She sells her harvested rice and and grown pigs. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 30 years now.

In 2008, Fely joined CEVI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI.

Fely is requesting her 6th loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: A. Marie est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHOUMENOU Romuald, Marie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs dix sept ans que Marie s'est installée au quartier Kowégbo à Cotonou, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Marie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Marie n'a jamais été à l'école. Marie vend des produits cosmétiques et des bijoux de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Marie vend des jus de bissap et des sucettes qu'elle conserve dans les glacières. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Marie achète ses produits. Marie exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Marie désire développer un peu plus son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Marie Aïhoue was born in 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Romuald Ahoumenou, Marie has four children, all in school. It has been about seventeen years since Marie moved to the Kowégbo area of Cotonou, where she lives with her husband and children. Marie helps her husband and, with him, provides for the family, thanks to the income from her business. Marie never attended school. She sells cosmetics and jewelry door-to-door. On the side, Marie sells roselle (hibiscus) juice and lollipops, which she keeps in ice boxes. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Marie has run this business for about seven years, and has already benefited from three loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which where repaid properly. Marie wants to develop her business a little more and satisfy her clientele better. This is the reason why she is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 41 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 4 and 17. All the children are currently attending school.

Kennedy is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 15 years and has employed 4 people from his community. His products are tea, milk, maize, beans and poultry, which he sells to the local market. He is also a certified veterinary officer employed by the government. His biggest challenge in farming is the limited market for his products since most people have their own farms.

Kennedy has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after he successfully completed a previous loan for KES 45,000. He has requested this loan for KES 70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him improve his productivity and enhance the marketability of his products.

Kennedy is happy with the services he receives and is willing to expand his farming business. He also plans to own a cooling plant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry N., 61 years old, is the village bank president selected by its sixteen members located in Voat Svay village, Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Ry N. is a rice farmer who works very hard to support her child. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farm. Thus, Mrs. Ry N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm to grow her rice. Mrs. Ry N. is a widow with a child, who attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta E. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mareta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and, daily use products in the local community. Mareta has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Mareta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mareta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mareta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mareta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santa Lucia New Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la  casa  de  Rosalina V. , integrante del grupo  Santa Lucía New, que está ubicado en el Estado de  Veracruz  en México. Se ve  al fondo de la foto el negocio de florería y bisutería de la señora Rosalina. Ella se dedica a  la venta de anturios y artículos de bisutería, papelería y regalos que inicio hace  6  años. Solicita el préstamo para  invertir en su negocio y meterle un poco de abarrotes para darle más variedad a su negocio. Sus clientes  la consideran una persona muy trabajadora. El negocio se ubica en la parte de enfrente de su casa. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente  muy contenta porque podrá hacerlo crecer un poco. Tiene  64 años, estudió hasta el  6to. año  de primaria, vive  unión libre  y tiene en total  3  hijos (  1  mujer y 2  varones). Quiere este crédito para  invertir en más mercancía y comprar abarrotes para tenerlo más surtido. También espera  mejorar sus ingresos para poder ampliar su casa y construir un techo más resistente ya que cuando hay suradas o viento fuerte, el techo que es de lámina actualmente se ha caído en varias ocasiones.
 Ana Laura L.  es la presidente del grupo. Tiene  29 años, estudió hasta el 3er. año de Secundaria, es   casada   y tiene en total  2  hijos  varones. Ella se dedica a  la venta de artículos de papelería que inició hace  7  años. Solicita el préstamo para  comprar papelería para seguir vendiendo.
El grupo esta conformado por  11  de integrantes quienes son:
Anselma H. (venta de calzado,) 
Eufrosina S. (venta de abarrotes), 
María Luisa H. (venta de abarrotes), 
Rocío M. (venta de calzado), 
Araceli P. (Venta de Comida),
Margarita N. (venta de abarrotes), 
Mónica D. (venta de ropa), 
Lourdes O. (venta de antojitos), 
María Guadalupe O. (venta de antojitos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Rosalina V., member of the SANTA LUCIA NEW Group which is located in Veracruz, Mexico. At the bottom of the photo, you can see Ms. Rosalina’s flower and costume jewelry shop. For the past 6 years, she has been selling anthuriums, costume jewelry, stationery, and gifts. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and plans to add some groceries to her inventory in order to offer more variety. Her customers regard her as a very hard-worker. The business is located in the front part of her home. When applying for this loan, she felt very happy because she knew she would be able to make her business grow a bit. She is 64 years old, studied up to the 6th year of primary school, lives in a common-law relationship and has 3 children (one daughter and two sons). She wants this loan to invest in more merchandise and buy groceries so that her shop will be better stocked. In addition, she hopes to increase her income in order to be able to expand her house and build a more weather resistant roof as the laminate roof she has at present has fallen on numerous occasions during the suradas (strong South winds). . Ana Laura L. is president of the group. She is 29 years old, studied up to the 3rd year of secondary school, is married and has 2 sons. She has been selling stationery for the past 7 years. She is requesting this loan to buy stationery in order to maintain sales. The group is made up of the following 11 members: Anselma H. (footwear sales) Eufrosina S. (grocery sales) María Luisa H. (grocery sales) Rocío M. (footwear sales) Araceli P. (food sales) Margarita N. (grocery sales) Mónica D. (clothing sales) Lourdes O. (snack sales) María Guadalupe O. (snack sales)

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stationery in order to maintain sales

loans.name: Cándido Eligio

texts.es:
El Sr Cándido  es casado,  tiene una pequeña despensa   en el km 8 Monday,  la venta del  mismo es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda de su esposa e hijas   están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable y lo ha demostrado con la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y con la honestidad en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario.
El señor Candido solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa, como fidoes, harina, aceite, azúcar y otros productos de consumo familiar.
texts.en:
Cándido is married. He has a small general store at Km. 8 Monday (near Ciudad del Este). The store´s sales are rewarding because he has a number of clients and his income is quite satisfactory. With help from his wife and daughters, they are moving forward with determination, hard work and dedication. He is a very hard worker and responsible, and has shown punctuality with his loan repayments and honesty with his commitments, for this reason we should give him all the support he needs. Cándido is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his store, such as pastas, flour, oil, sugar and other basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pastas, flour, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie D. is from the village of Pwerta, Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Margie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products aside from buying and selling of bags and shoes in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. is 45 years old . He is married to Racheal Nyambura and they have three children. His spouse contributes towards the income of the family. He has been farming for about 10 years with a profit of about 13,500 KES a month.

He wants to buy a chaff-cutter (to cut forage for his cattle) and with his profit he intends to buy another dairy cow. David hopes to buy a piece of land and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: buy a chaff-cutter

loans.name: Acosta Chero

texts.es:
P. tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Tumi de Oro del caserío Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, capital de la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos. Ella cría estos animales en unos corrales situados cerca de su vivienda y los engorda para luego ofrecerlos en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde viven. Con este negocio ella sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia a solventar sus gastos familiares.

P. desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente en el techo, ya que está construido de calaminas, el tiempo ha hecho que estas empiecen a sufrir deterioros y ahora ella ha creído conveniente techar de nuevo su vivienda pero con eternit (láminas mas fuertes y con mayor resistencia). Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

P. es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
P. is 40 years old. She is single and lives together with her family in the area of Tumi de Oro, near the small town of Yencala Boggiano, a rural area involved mostly in agriculture. It is located in the district of Lambayeque, the capital of the region of the same name, located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells pigs. She raises these animals in some corrals located near her home and fattens them for sale to businesses that regularly visit the area where she lives. With this business, she covers her own expenses and helps her family with household expenses. 

P. would like to make some improvements to her house, especially the roof because it is made of tin. Time has caused it to deteriorate and now she wants to re-roof her house, but with a product called Eternit (tin roofing that is stronger and more resistant). In order to achieve her goal, she has requested a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative for PEN 1000.00. 

P. is a hardworking woman. Those who know her have much respect for and trust in her.

loans.use: Improvements to her house, especially the roof

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: El Sr.Ovidio es un hombre muy luchador y humilde, actualmente el vende chicharrones para poder mantener a suhija ya que el Sr. es divorciado, y esta a su cargo su hija, y a el le interesa tener una mejor de vida, para poderle dar lo mejor a su hija y una vida mas comoda y poder superarse economicamente.
texts.en: Ovidio is a very hardworking and humble man.  He currently works selling ‘chicharrones’ (fried pork rinds) to be able to support his daughter since he is divorced and is responsible for her.  He wants to have a better life to be able to provide the best for daughter, as well as to have a more comfortable life and to move forward financially.

loans.use: To change the location of his business.

loans.name: Ashito Efua

texts.en: Ashito Efua D. is married and has four children. She is into the sale of charcoal at Asenadze near Abura. Her husband is a farmer. Ashito uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She will use the profit gained to build a house.

loans.use: expand her business to increase her profits

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. María  Nacida en Santa Cruz de la Sierra vive actualmente en el Barrio España. Hace 5 años se dedica al bordado en chinelas donde ya a sentado presencia en sus clientes y para incrementar sus ingresos comercializa también adornos de esa manera ayuda en los gastos del hogar. el crédito que se le otorgo a la Sra. Alejandra es para la compra de mas chinelas ya que  su demanda de pedidos de chinelas bordadas a incrementado por la época de fin de año.  La Sra. agradece a la institución por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en: María was born in Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  She currently lives in the España neighborhood.  For 5 years she has been embroidering thongs (flip flops).  She has built up a customer base and to increase her income she also sells jewelry.  In this way she helps with her household expenses.  The loan which Mrs Alejandra has been given is for buying more thongs since her orders for embroidered thongs have increased with the end-of-year season.  She is grateful to Emprender for the trust which they have placed in her.

loans.use: To buy thread, jewelry and thongs

loans.name: Nailan

texts.es: Nailan Fernández D. T.  D. 53 años D. edad vive en el barrio la Bajera del municipio D. San Jacinto en Departamento D. Bolívar se dedica elaborar con sus propias manos mochilas y bolsos y también  compra y venD.   cubre lechos, en su condición D. madre   soltera y con 3 hijos en las edades D. 26 a 37 años ha logrado sacarlos adelante mediante su trabajo  en su negocio con el que  sueña cada día hacerlo más prospero   trabajando mucho  para lograr unos buenos ahorros con el fin D.  tener su propia casa.  Aunque su mayor desafío ha sido  la educación D. sus hijos sin la pareja a su lado,  hoy es cosa del pasado porque ya ellos son mayores D. edad y están trabajando entre todos para lograr sacar a su familia adelante. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este su credikiva comprará materiales como hilos e insumos para la elaboración D. mochilas y bolsos que tiene encargados y comprar mercancía como cubrelechos , vestidos y sandalias artesanales; con esta   inversión   generará una utilidad bruta D. 48% y la solicita en esta temporada teniendo en cuenta que su mayor volumen D. ventas se reflejan  en los meses D. Diciembre a Febrero, por el importante numero D. turistas que llegan a esta población D. vacaciones o pasan por su carretera y se detienen a comprar. Su mayor potencial D. venta lo logra apoyada  por su hija,  que  viaja a las ciudades D. Barranquilla y Cartagena donD. tiene su mayor número D. clientes fijos , a los cuales les lleva mochilas tejidas por las manos D. su madre y otras artesanías que compra en el pueblo y venD. en estas dos ciudades.
texts.en:
Nailan Fernández D. T. is 53 years old and lives in the Bajera neighborhood of San Jacinto, in Bolívar department.  She makes backpacks and bags by hand and she also buys and sells bedspreads.  Nailan is a single mother and has 3 children aged 26 to 37.  She has managed to get her children ahead in life through the work she does in her business.  She hopes to make her business more prosperous every day, working hard to achieve good savings so that she can buy her own home.  Although her biggest challenge has been to educate her children without her partner by her siD., that is now a problem from the past because her children are all grown up and working themselves to get their own families ahead.

This is Nailan's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use this Kiva loan to buy materials and supplies for making her backpacks and bags which she already has orders for.  She will also buy merchandise such as bedspreads, dresses and hand-crafted sandals.  With this investment, she will make a gross profit of 48%.

Nailan is requesting her loan during this season because she makes her largest number of sales from December to February, owing to the large number of tourists who arrive in her town on vacation or who pass by on the road and stop to buy from her.  She accomplishes her large sales potential with the support of her daughter who travels to the cities of Barranquilla and Cartagena where she has her largest number of regular customers.  She takes them backpacks which her mother has maD. by hand together with other handicrafts which she buys in the town and then sells in these two cities.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for making backpacks and bags which she has orders for.  To buy merchandise such as bedspreads, dresses and hand-crafted sandals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Celia Benedicto

texts.es:
Celia Benedicto A. B. tiene 52 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos.  Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Celia Benedicto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta asistir a la iglesia universal.
texts.en:
Celia Benedicto A. B. is 52 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 6 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Celia Benedicto is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in the García and López shopping areas and sells her products in the Vaca shopping area.  She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy some land.

Celia Benedicto likes attending her universal church.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos, tiene 38 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa, ellos residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, él se dedica a sembrar frutas y verduras, también maíz, la siembra de frutas y verduras lo aprendió por un tío desde hace 10 años, la producción de estas actividades es la que genera ingresos para este hogar.
Actualmente está en proceso de sembrar una nueva porción de semilla, pero solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales agrícolas con este préstamo ayudara a sus cultivos para darle los cuidados necesarios y poder obtener buenos resultados en sus cosechas.
Su aspiración es que su trabajo le dé una buena y grande producción ya que es su anhelo realizar cada día el trabajo de la mejor manera en busca de resultados satisfactorios que le permita comercializarlo a buen precio y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 38, lives with his two children and his wife in Jiquilisco, in the Usulutan department. He plants fruits and vegetables, as well as corn. He learned to plant fruits and vegetables from an uncle 10 years ago. This is what generates his household's income.
He is currently in the process of sowing a new plot, but he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural materials. This loan will help his crops because he will be able to give them the necessary care, and thus be able to obtain better results from his harvests.
His goal is for his work to give him a good and large harvest, as it is his dream to do his work better every day in search of good results so that he can sell at a good price and make an income.

loans.use: the purchase of materials for planting (manure and fertilizers)

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia del Carmen V. tiene 62 años de edad, vive en el barrio los arcos de la ciudad de Danli, su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, las tortillas que elabora una parte las vende en su casa de habitación y la mayor parte son por encargo,  las vende a sus vecinos y a los trabajadores de diferentes fabricas de la Ciudad de Danlí tambien elabora tortillas grandes para la fabricacion de tacos que se las solicitan los fines de semana.
Doña Antonia es casada y con su esposo han procreado tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya son totalmente independientes y el ultimo de sus hijos esta cursando sus estudios secundarios y todo esto gracias al empeño que doña Antonia a puesto en su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
texts.en:
Antonia del Carmen V. is 62 years old.  She lives in the barrio of Los Arcos in the city of Danli.  Her principal business is making and selling tortillas.  She sells the major portion of her tortillas on order and sells the remainder at her home.  She sells them to neighbors and workers at the different factories in Danlí.  She also makes large tortillas for the creation of the tacos that they ask her for on the weekends.

Antonia is married and has three children. Two of them are totally independent and the third one is enrolled in secondary school.  All this is thanks to the efforts that Antonia puts into caring for her family.  The loan will be used to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime, and water.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two grown children. She sells bed linens and sheets as well as blankets in the central marketplace of her hometown of Novomoskovsk. Yelena owns a big vending facility in this market, which is located in a busy spot where hundreds of potential customers pass by every day. She has been in this business for three years. Her monthly gross income is 35,000 UAH; the profit amounts to 6,000 UAH per month.

Yelena is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase the assorted merchandise she offers for sale. She believes financial assistance will help her grow her business and generate additional income as a result. Yelena's grandson has leukemia and needs expensive medication. Yelena invests a portion of her profit in the medical treatment of her little grandson. She is a great optimist and tries to look on the bright side of life.

loans.use: to increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Angela de 33 años, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para mujeres y varones. Trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 17h00pm en su negocio. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años que aun estudian y quiere darles una mejor educación. Para seguir con su negocio quiere comprar mercadería variada con el préstamo como pantalones, blusas, vestidos. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su mercadería.
texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old. She has a business selling clothes for women and men. Angela works in her business from 9am to 5pm.

She has many aspirations for her business. Angela has two children, ages 10 and 8, attending school and wants to provide them a good education. To continue her business, she wants to use this loan to buy varied merchandise such as trousers, blouses, and dresses. In the future she wants to have a well-stocked inventory.

loans.use: Purchase  trousers, blouses, and dresses

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Evangeline is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables like cabbages, carrots, potatoes, eggplants & "pipino" in the local community. She is also selling food seasonings and vinegar & soy sauce in pouches. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like vegetables & food seasonings. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as vegetables & food seasonings.

location.town: St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province

loans.name: Ram Maya

texts.en:
In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.
 
This is 48-year-old Ram Maya M.. She is married and has three children aged 24, 18 and 16.  

In 2005, she established  her tailoring business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She will use her most recent loan to buy materials for her business.  

In the future, Ram Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Shareefan's Group

texts.en:
Shareefan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business selling animals. Using the loan, he will purchase goats and sheep for resale to earn good profit. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. 

Shareefan is confident that her husband’s eight years of experience in his business will help him getting better profits as a result of an investment.  She resides in a small city called Khanewal located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She has been living there in the area of Shanti Nagar with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 10 years. 
  
She herself is a housewife, prefering to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She is the mother of three sons. Only one of them is enrolled in a local school and getting his education.   

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shareefan.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for animal selling business.

loans.name: Huaraypata Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA ”; Este banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huaraypata,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Matilde: es casada y tiene 45 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la crianza de pollo, a la venta de flores, y a la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y nos comenta que ella trata de ocupar su tiempo en todo lo que le gusta hacer y desea sacar a sus hijos adelante, para ello ella bien trabajando en todo lo que se pueda y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más pollitos y de este modo aumentar su galpón, también desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la venta de comidas caceras; venta de flores, venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, agricultura.


La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Huaraypata". This bank is located in the community of Huaraypata, in the province of Quispicanchis, and the department of Cusco.
The member is called Matilde. She is married and 45 years old. She has 2 children. She works raising chickens and selling flowers, and also has a grocery store. The member is a very hardworking woman and she tells us that she trys to spend her time doing things that she enjoys and that she wants to help her children to be successful. For this reason, she tries to do her work well and improve the quality of life for her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more chicks and so to increase the flock in her coop. She also wants to implement her grocery store.
The other members of the community bank work selling homemade meals, selling flowers, selling vegetables, running a grocery store, selling vegetables, and in agriculture. 
The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: María Salvadora

texts.es:
La Sra. Salvadora Morales es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una madre de un hijo muy trabajadora y cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de ropa nueva para damas y caballeros donde tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este oficio y el que le ha permitido sacar adelante y preparar a su hijo.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido diversificarlo en productos y a bajos precios lo que atrae la atención de los mismos. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es contar con más capital para adquirir ropa de toda clase y a la moda, por tal razón decidió solicitar su quinto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salvadora Morales is from the town of El Sauce.  She is the very hard working mother or one son.  She has her own business consisting is new clothing sales for men and women.  She has many years in this line of work and it has made it possible for her to get ahead and educate her son.

Since its beginning the business has been noted for the good service given to her customers and thanks to her own efforts she’s been able to diversify her products and keep prices low which attracts customer attention.  One of her current needs is to have more capital to acquire all kinds of clothes that are up-to-date in styles.  Because of this she decided to ask for her fifth loan from Ceprodel to reach this goal and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, blouses and Capri pants.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 43-year-old widow who has eight children whom she is still taking care of. She has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last 26 years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of her friends and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and also to plough her farm during this planting season.
In the future, Grace hopes to practise advanced farming and be able to plant and harvest throughout the year.

loans.use: to prepare her farm for planting and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Alice operates a grocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a boutique business as a second source of income. Alice dreams of expanding and accessing more funds in the future. 

Alice plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes for her grocery business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Mujeres De La Cienaga Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta es casada, tiene 40 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 D. los cuales está estudiando la educación primaria, se dedica al bordado D. blusas y a la crianza D. animales, inicio este negocio D. bordado por iniciativa ropa y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitara un préstamo que le servirá para la compra D. materiales para bordado, es ese caso para la compra D. lustrina y así poder contar con mas capital para el bordad D. blusas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a diversas actividades: bordado D. blusas, venta D. ropa y a la crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Señora Marta is married. She is 40 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are attending primary school. She dedicates her time to embroidering blouses and to raising animals. She started her embroidery business on her own initiative and now has 5 years of experience.

She decided to organise a group to be able to seek a loan that will be used to purchase embroidery materials, in this case silk or satin fabrics, so as to have more capital for the blouse embroidery business.

The other members of the group dedicate their time to a range of activities: embroidering blouses, clothing sales, and raising animals.

loans.use: To buy silk fabrics.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo tiene 34 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para dar lo necesario a los hijos.

En los tiempos libre le gusta jugar villa con los amigos.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 34 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Juan is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Juan is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges such as pests attacking his crops.  His dream is to make more income so that he can provide for his children.

In his spare time, Juan enjoys playing pool with his friends.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Asuncion

texts.es:
José de 47 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia,la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura desde hace 6 años, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, producto que puede cosechar semanalmente, además de la gran demanda del mismo en los distintos mercados y en el consumo diario de los pobladores, con ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2600 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  José es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia tenga más comodidades como un mejor futuro académico sus hijos.
texts.en: José is 47 and lives with his family in Tambogrande, Piura.  This region is known for its agriculture, cattle and handcrafts.  Jose has been a farmer for 6 years, and grows lemons on his lands, harvesting them every week for sale in local markets with good profits.  He now seeks a credit of 2,600 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers to increase crop production and increase his profits.  Jose is dedicated to his family and hopes to provide his children with a prosperous academic future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase crop production

loans.name: Erling

texts.es: Erling, de 32 años, es un hombre luchador, pues hace 8 años falleció su padre. Dejándole la responsabilidad de la familia. Él vive junto a su mamá Dora y a sus 6 hermanos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Su principal sustento son sus estudios de Topografía; lo que le permite trabajar en las instituciones del estado peruano brindando estudios sobre el área. Pero la actividad que le apasiona es la “agricultura”, donde tiene 7 años de experiencia sembrando café en sus 15 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas; los cuales abona y cuida, los fines de semana con la ayuda de sus hermanos. “Ellos me apoyan en el cuidado de mis cultivos cuando estoy ausente”, afirma. Asimismo se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los socios de la cooperativa de Sanchirio, donde comercializa sus grano de café; porque le apoyan constantemente en las capacitaciones para que, el café que siembra sea de mejor calidad.  Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco para poder obtener más ganancias, y así apoyar en los estudios de sus hermanos. Pues es el único sustento de su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por reiterarle la confianza. Además se compromete en ser puntual con sus cuotas. Erling, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, los cuales esparcirá en la hectárea de cultivo de café que le falta por fortalecer.
texts.en:
Erling, 32, is a hard worker who lost his father eight years ago and has had to take over responsibility for the family.  He lives with his mother, Dora, and his six siblings in his own house in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian forest).  His main income comes as a result of Topography studies which allow him to work in the Peruvian state institutions as a teacher.  But the activity he is most passionate about is "agriculture" and his seven years of experience growing coffee on 15 hectares of farm land.  On weekends, with the help of his brothers, he fertilizes and cares for the land.  "When I am away they help by caring for the crop.", he claims.  

He is grateful for the support received from the members of the Sanchirio co-op where he sells his coffee beans.  They are constantly providing training so he can grow better quality coffee.  Now he wants to pay special attention to making more profit so he can help his siblings with their education, since this is their only source of income.  He belongs to the communal bank "Desarrollando para el futuro de Prisma", and this is his second loan through MFP, where he is is grateful for the continued confidence shown in him.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Erling plans to use your loan to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on the coffee crop so it can grow stronger.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 32 years old, She is married with two school-aged children. The family is residing in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Virginia is a retailer of various ready-made or RTW products. These include baby wear, blankets, pillowcases,and more. Every month she earns PHP 8,000.

Earlier this year, Virginia joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional RTW's to sell such as blankets, clothes, accessories, etc. She expects to gain more revenue from the additional products to sell and to improve the general living condition of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional RTW's to sell such as blankets, clothes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident and a farmer in Kitale Western Kenya. He is married with four children aged between 19 and 4 years old and all are schooling. He has been in farming for the last 15 years with his produce of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and milk going to the local market.

Moses has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo and he says it will make life much better for his family and help him improve his retail shop in the local market.

He notes that diseases are the worst challenge to farmers, especially the dairy ones since a lot of cost is incurred in managing the diseases. He is glad he joined Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been rearing pigs for sale for the last six years in Kiambu town. She is 38 years old and married to Martin. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase pig feed.

In future Beatrice hopes to increase the number of pigs, to cater for the high demand for pork.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Шарифа жительница города Вахдат. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Шарифа имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей более 16 лет. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает ткани и детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара. То есть для покупки осенней детской одежды и новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Sharifa lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 49 years old, married and has five children.  Sharifa has a secondary education.  She has been involved in sales for over 16 years.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics and children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise, i.e. fall children's clothing and new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Loida works hard to support her family. She is a dealer in a mineral water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of charcoal. Loida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional water containers for her mineral water dealership.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional water containers for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is 38 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is single. Antonia has a business selling food--local delicacies--and earns approximately 1,200 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her business. Antonia has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César un hombre fuerte y empeñoso de 39 años de edad convive hace 18 años con Irma, su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 6 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa rústica qu él mismo construyo propia en el anexo de Cochayoc. Sus tierras son ricas en minerales, por esa razón no vacila al momento de sembrar sus productos en cantidades considerables. La agricultura es su vida, la tierra le ha enseñado como sobresalir junto a su familia. En sus terrenos propios siembra arvejas de las distintas variedades, así también zanahorias, lechugas, espinacas, papas, habas, maíz etc. “he aprendido a distribuir mis terrenos, por que todas mis cosechas se venden bien, principalmente las arvejas”, comenta. Por otra parte también se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, ovejas y cuyes, los que engorda cada 4 meses y los vende para la ciudad de Huancayo, “los animales de Tarma son bien solicitados para distintas partes y eso nos conviene”, cuenta César orgulloso de su ciudad.
Las inclemencias del tiempo han sido sus peores adversarios, situaciones que ha sabido controlar con la experiencia de tantos años. Gracias a su ayuda, César obtendría su préstamo número 9 de MFP, entidad de la que se siente agradecido por haberle permitido conseguir una estabilidad económica y deseos de progreso, junto a su banco comunal. Con el dinero del crédito podrá adquirir 20 sacos de abonos que ascienden a la suma de 2400 soles, con lo restante comprará semillas para la siembra de papas, cuya cosecha estima estará lista para el mes de mayo.
texts.en:
César is a strong and earnest 39-year-old man who has lived with his partner Irma for 18 years and with whom he has 2 children aged 18 and 6. This family lives in a rustic house that he himself built in the annex of Cochayoc. His land is rich with minerals and for this reason he doesn't hesitate at planting his seeds in significant quantities. Farming is his life. The land has taught him how to excel together with his family. On his own land, he plants different varieties of peas, as well as carrots, lettices, spinach, potatoes, beans, corn, etc. "I have learned to distribute my crops on my land because all the crops sell well, especially the peas," he says. He also raises animals such as cows, sheep and guinea pigs, which he fattens at 4 months and sells to the city of Huancayo. "The animals from Tarma are well sought-after for different uses and this is good for us," says Caesar proud of his city. 

The weather has been his worst enemy, a situation he has been able to control with his many years of experience. Thanks to your help, Caesar will obtain his 9th loan with MFP, an institution he is grateful to for having allowed him to achieve economic stability and given him the desire to progress, together with his communal bank. With the money from the loan he will buy 20 sacks of manure which comes to a sum of S/. 2400 nuevos soles (PEN) and with the rest he will buy seed potatoes which will be ready for harvesting in May he estimates.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of manure and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, married and blessed with one child who is in school, describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years to support her family, and enjoys a good business reputation with her customers.

Lilian is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice for resale. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her in good customer care, and within the next five years plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier. Elle a trois enfants.  
Akou travaille comme vendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas difficulté. 
Akou a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit  prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akou is a 42-year-old woman. She is married to a carpenter and has three children.

Akou has been working as a saleswoman since 2000. She sells grains for all customers at her home and purchases her wares in Anié. She works alone; at the moment, she has no difficulty.

Akou has requested her second WAGES loan in order to purchase grains. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the next few years, Akou would like to enlarge her business - with the profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase grains.

loans.name: Mwenda Pole Group

texts.en:
