Benard  is the facilitator of the Mwenda Pole group. Benard  and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benard  takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benard  had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Benard was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benard will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mwenda Pole group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Benard is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Medardo Macario

texts.es:
Medardo Macario tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en las calles 6 de Octubre y Asad Bucaran Sector el hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
Medardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papa, maíz, arroz, cacao, además tiene gallinas y chanchos y trabaja en una finca. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, abonos, fertilizantes, urea. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar insumos y semillas para trabajar y ayudar a la familia.
El sueño es sembrar más cacao. Los desafíos que se le presenta es los precios porque aveces compra caro y vende barato.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir y jugar indor.
texts.en:
Medardo Macario is 24 years old and single, with no children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Las Brisas [The Breezes] communal bank, which is located on 6th October street and Asad Bucaran street, in the Hospital part of town, in the Ventanas canton. The members work in retail, in general.

Medardo works in agriculture growing potatoes, corn, rice, and cocoa.  He also has hens and pigs, and works a property.  He makes his purchases and his sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, and purchase manure, fertilizers and urea.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase supplies and seeds for his work, and to support his family.

His dream is to grow more cocoa.  The challenges that he faces are prices, because sometimes he ends up buying high and selling low.

In his free time, he likes to go out, and to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy manure, fertilizers, and urea.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 50 years old. She is divorced. She lives with her three daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years she has operated a food stall to sell noodles to people in their community.

Le would like a loan to purchase new furniture and good quality food in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and good quality food in bulk.

loans.name: G.s. Los Menudos Group

texts.es:
La señora Martha Maria,  su actividad económica  a la que se dedica  es a la venta de ropa usada de paca. Ella tiene 1hijo, que todavía se encuentra a su cargo.  \

Ella tiene competencia, sin embargo oferta a bajos precios piezas de ropa bien seleccionadas. Desea invertir en un futuro en la construcción de una caseta fuera de su casa para  vender sus productos. Pretende continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.  La señora Martha al igual que Carlos están solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en esta temporadas altas donde las ventas son las mejores.
texts.en:
Martha Maria works selling bundles of used clothing.  She has one child who is still under her care. 

She has competition, but she offers well selected pieces of clothing at low prices.  In the future, she wants to invest in the construction of a shed outside her house to sell her products.  She wants to continue investing in her business.  

Martha and Carlos are asking for this loan to invest in their businesses during the high season when sales are at their best.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Faalupega

texts.en:
Faalupega is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Lalo Nonu.  She is married and has 4 adult -age children.  To make a living, Faalupega owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faalupega has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 200 WST ( approximately 100USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Faalupega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faalupega has requested her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD which will be used to purchase chemicals such as gramoxome. Faalupega plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the  business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals such as gramoxome

loans.name: Shaga

texts.en:
Shanga is a 43-year-old woman who is married with four children. She is in the livestock trading business in Emali. She has been in the business for 14 years now and gets a monthly income of 4,000 shillings. 

This will be Shanga’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan  to buy a solar kit to use to provide light in the house. In the future, she desire to grow his business and be able to become self reliant and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a solar kit for lightening purpose

loans.name: Nagueze Group

texts.fr: NAGUEZE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akouavi Catherine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans. Akouavi Catherine est mariée à un photographe du nom de Sévérin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous  scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Akouavi Catherine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Akouavi Catherine vend des feuille des bissap, du sucre et du lait dans sa région depuis vingt cinq ans. parallèlement à son activité, Akouavi Catherine vend aussi du jus de bissap et du pain ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Akouavi Catherine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Akouavi Catherine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NAGUEZE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des feuilles de bissap, du lait et du sucre.

loans.name: Lispar

texts.en:
Lispar is a lively and resilient woman. She is from the Chuka area, an area that is very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict. She intends for her family to get ahead through her hard work and effort without complaint. Lispar has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Lispar is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life.

Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutritional value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named them, which makes Lispar very proud, and she feels fulfilled. Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Lispar wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows.

She is respectfully asking for a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used for cutting hay into smaller pieces before being mixed with other forages for easy digestion by the cow. The loan will assist the cow in producing more milk because they will have plenty of food to feed on. The profits from milk sales will allow Lispar to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a bio-gas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Lispar dreams of is a secure future for her family. Lispar awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Christella

texts.en:
Christella is working as telemarketer. She has her own business, too. She runs a small enterprise in which her team manufactures detergents and liquid soaps for consumers. The business idea came to her during a visit in DR.

Christella has four main markets: hotels, schools, restaurants and households. Christella has created part-time jobs for six people. She would like to create more, as well as making more profits.

Her obstacle for now is the lack of raw materials to produce in volume and to make scalable economy on costs. That's why she turns to Zafen to achieve that commercial objective.

From left to right, Christella (left) is pictured with Lory (her co-manager) and Emaneste (sales manager).

With this loan, she will also create three more jobs and buy aprons and bonnets for her employees.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to manufacture detergents for homes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase books for her bookstore business.

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is married and has three kids. Her husband retired seven years ago, and her family has been through very difficult times because the money from his pension is not enough to cover their expenses. She decided to open her small grocery store because of the need to have an extra income to support her family. Her children help her with the store. Evelia is requesting a loan in the amount of US$475 to stock up her store and continue to grow.

It has not been easy to overcome the obstacles; however, with the family’s closeness and efforts they have been able to do it. Now they need your support, and they thank you for your generosity. You can help, don’t hesitate any longer.

Evelia es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo se jubiló hace siete años y su familia pasó por momentos muy difíciles, pues el dinero de la pensión que recibe su esposo es muy poca para cubrir sus gastos, la necesidad de tener un ingreso extra para el sustento de su familia hizo que ella comenzará su negocio de abarrotes, en el cual le ayudan sus hijos. Evelia requiere de un préstamo de 475 dólares para poder surtir su negocio y continuar creciendo.

No ha sido fácil superar todos los obstáculos pero con la unión y esfuerzo de toda la familia han salido triunfantes de éstos. Ahora necesitan de tú apoyo, y agradecen tu generosidad, tú puedes ayudar, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Mr. Ramón G. wants to remodel his bathroom. Mr. G. tell us: “I need to refit the bathroom properly, to paint it on the outside, to buy all the bathroom fittings since when it rains the water gets all over the place". I’m requesting for $1000.00 to refit the bathroom and to buy a new toilet.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Ramón G. quiere remodelar su baño. El Sr. nos comenta “Necesito acondicionar bien el baño, pintarlo por fuera y comprar el sanitario completo ya que cuando llueve se mete mucho el agua”. Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para acondicionar el baño y comprar un sanitario.

loans.use: Remodel the bathroom, paint walls and buy all the bathroom fittings .

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Mayram A. is manufacturing and selling "massi" (national leather boots). Mayram is married and has three children. Her youngest daughter is in school, her son is working, and her middle daughter is married. Mayram has a post-secondary education and works as a nurse in a polyclinic. Mayram’s husband is a construction worker; he also helps Mayram with her business. Previously Mayram was ordering materials for producing boots from a distributor. After receiving a previous loan her husband began traveling to purchase materials himself. Mayram learned how to make “massi” from her husband. In the future, Mayram wants to open a shop to produce national boots “massi” with natural furskin and galoshes.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Акбарова Майрам занимается производством и продажей масси (это национальнные кожаные сапоги ). Замужем, имеет троих детей. Младшая дочь учится в школе. Старший сын работает. Средняя дочь замужем. Муж работает строителем, также помогает жене в её деятельности. Образование среднее специальное. Раньше заказывала материалы для производства поставщикам. После получения займа стал ездить за материалами её муж. Этим ремеслом она научилась у своего мужа. Она также работает медсестрой в поликлинике. В дальнейшем хочет открыть цех, производить национальные масси с натуральным мехом и галоши

loans.use: increasing goods

loans.name: Karen Lisbeth

texts.es:
My name is Karen R. and I teach computer courses. I have had my business for 4 years and it is very profitable because many people in my community like to use computers and want to learn more. I now need to buy new parts for my computers, for example ram memory, power sources and hard drives, because i have numerous computers that are useless because they are in bad shape. With the profits earned because of these improvements I will be able to support my household.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Karen R. me dedico a imparti cursos de computacion, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, actividad es muy rentable en nuestra comunidad ya que hay mucha gente que le gusta la computacion y tienen muchos deseos de aprender, en estos momentos necesito comprar repuestos para mis computadoras como ser memorias ram, fuentes de poder y discos duros ya que tengo varias maquinas sin uso porque estan en mal estado, con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: To purchase computer parts and accessories

loans.name: Suhartini

texts.en: Suhartini is 27 years old and married. She sells clothes and fabrics on credit. She goes from door to door to seek customers and collects payment at the end of each month. She can earn up to $10 per week doing this. Suhartini is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to expand her business and earn more income to support her children's education. She willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Marcelline Lewei

texts.en: Marcelline is 41 years old. She has been a widow since 2005 and has 3 children. She faced a very hard situation when she lost her husband. Her children are still very young, and she has to care for them alone in a very difficult and tight environment. Her elder daughter is in grammar school, and the two younger children are in primary school. Marcelline has demonstrated a fighting spirit to face the situation. AE&I microcredit program has been a crucial supporting resource for Marcelline, who has obtained different loans to relaunch her business. She sells various aromatic products and cereals in the Yopougon market, a suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. She will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.use: Marcelline Lewei Akpa will use the loan to purchase goods.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is in her early forties and has four children (two boys and two girls). She is separated from her husband and is supporting her family on her own. She is a teacher in a primary school in her community.

María also sells an assortment of underwear and fashionable shoes to women of Mulo, a neighborhood of Yamasá. She has to travel outside her community once a month to get the products at very low prices. Currently, she has a well established clientele.

She plans on using her loan to supplement her business with new brands of shoes and she wants to add some chic pants to the business, too.

María hopes her business can keep growing. She says that before long she will rent a locale to run her business out of.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and underwear to add to her inventory

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is married with 6 children. She is 46 years old and comes from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuff. She has been in business since 2000. She learnt her trade for a year. She needs the loan amountof $875 to buy foodstuff for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Osiris Mileydi

texts.es:
The corner store business is a very profitable one because people use these to meet their everyday needs. Well aware of this Miss Osiris L. has been running her corner store business for the past 8 years in the town of Somotillo. She has her small store near a busy street and many pedestrians.

Her 4 small children are very proud to have such a hardworking mom and they suppor her and help her sorting out goods and products whenever they have some spare time after school.

For Miss Osiris L. the first and most important need is the purchase of products from her suppliers and this is why she had engaged CEPRODEL to obtain a loan. She will be able to continue running her business, importantly because it is the only income she earns to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería es un negocio muy rentable debido a que las personas hacen uso de estas para suplir las necesidades que a diario atraviesan. Consiente de esto la señora Osirirs L. se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 8 años en el municipio de Somotillo teniendo su establecimiento en la cercanías de una carretera muy transitada por vehículos y peatones.

Sus 4 pequeños hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de tener una madre muy trabajadora y por esta razón le apoyan en su actividad ayudándole a despachar los productos siempre y cuando tengan tiempo libre cuando regresan de la escuela.

La necesidad primordial de la señora Osiris L. es la compra de sus productos a sus proveedores y es por esta razón que acude a CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito oportuno y así continuar con su actividad económica que es el único ingreso que posee para mantener a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ramiza

texts.en: Ramiza is a 39-year-old woman who lives near the town of Živinice. She is a widow and she lives together with her father-in-law and with her younger son who goes to secondary school. Ramiza has monthly pension in the amount of 700 KM (about US$ 550) and she gets 300 KM (about US$ 240) from her older son who lives in Switzerland. This is her first loan  through MCO WWI in the amount of  US$ 825. Ramiza is going to buy chickens  for fattening and 2 or 3 sheep. She needs some kind of commitment to make good use of her free time and to improve the material status of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens  for fattening

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes is a woman devoted to her family. When she married her faithful and enterprising husband Guillermo, they decided to open a workshop to make metal furniture. Thanks to the valuable knowledge ingrained in her children, they now make the perfect team to do this beautiful work. Their workshop has now been open for 10 years and during that time has stood out for the refined and innovative models of furniture they produce as they try to accommodate each one of their client’s requests.

At this time, seeing the strategic location of their home, she decided to foray into another business and opened a cellular telephone store. With these two businesses, she is striving to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Translator.

María Mercedes, es una dama consagrada a su familia, desde que contrajo matrimonio con su fiel y emprendedor esposo, Guillermo, decidieron abrir un taller de muebles de metal, gracias a los valiosos conocimientos que inculcaron en sus hijos ahora hacen el equipo perfecto para realizar este hermoso trabajo.Su taller ya tiene 10 años de funcionamiento, durante ese tiempo siempre se destacaron por los finos y novedosos modelos de muebles que realizan, así tratando de complacer cada uno de las solicitudes de sus clientes.En esta oportunidad viendo el lugar estratégico de la ubicación de su domicilio decidió incursionar en otra labor, y aperturó una tienda de venta de celulares. Con estos 2 oficios trata de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Increase capital to finance new cellular phone business

loans.name: Morn Yang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn Y. is a farmer in Ka Art Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the group leader of four members.

Mrs. Morn Y. always cultivates her rice twice a year. During the dry season, she grows vegetables. During the rainy season, Mrs. Morn Y. grows rice but she cannot cultivate it well because she has insufficient plow equipment. Consequently, she needs to ask for a loan to buy plow equipment in order to better plow her rice field.

Her husband, Mr. Phon Ev, rents a loudspeaker to people who have a party or wedding ceremony. Mrs. Morn Y. is married and without any children.

loans.use: To buy plow equipment in order to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie G. is 52 years old, married with three children, and a member of the Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar village bank. She would like to take out the loan in order to buy a freezer for her ice cream and juice business, which is doing very well. She also sells palm and lemon oil. Her revenues allow her to improve the living conditions for her family. She is taking out a loan that will be repaid in six months with one single payment.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Marie G., 52 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sud Grand Dakar. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter un congélateur pour son commerce de glace, de crèmes glaces et de jus qui marche bien. Elle s’active aussi dans la vente de l’huile de palme et du citron. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Buy a freezer, baobab, and roselle

loans.name: Dino

texts.es:
Dino (35 years old) is a single father and he has a 18 year old son who is in school. He lives with his parents who help him to support his son. Dino is a secondary school professor, but because he did not get a stable position he put a Study Center in his home where he provides enrichment classes to children, adolescents and the general public. Because of his good development in this field, Dino has a good number of students who he provides with his knowledge and experiences learned. He gives classes in two schedules: in the mornings and the afternoons. What he likes the most about his work is that the people who he teaches feel satisfied with what they have learned and they can apply to any university. For that to happen is not easy but there are techniques and strategies that Dino uses. Dino’s wish and motivation for why he is requesting this loan is to recent a location to be able to offer greater comfort to his students. Later he wants to form an association with his colleagues and establish an official Private Study Center with all of the required documents and corresponding benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Dino (35 años) es padre soltero, tiene un hijo de 18 años, quien estudia, vive junto a sus padres, quienes lo apoyan mucho en el sostenimiento de su hijo. Dino es de profesión Profesor de Educación Secundaria, a razón de no conseguir un trabajo estable, puso en su propio domicilio su Centro de Estudios, donde brinda clases de reforzamiento a jóvenes, adolescentes y público en general. Por su buen desenvolvimiento en este campo, Dino cuenta con buena cantidad de alumnos, a quienes brinda sus conocimientos y experiencia aprendida. Da clases en dos horarios: por las mañanas y por las tardes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que las personas a quien enseña se sientan satisfechas de lo aprendido y puedan concursar o aplicar a cualquier universidad. Para el no existe nada difícil, ya que para ello, existen técnicas y estrategias nos comenta Dino. El deseo de Dino y el motivo porque el que solicita este préstamo, es para alquilar un local para brindar mejor comodidad a sus alumnos, posteriormente quiere formar una asociación con sus colegas y poner un Centro de Estudios Particular con documentos en regla y sus benéficos correspondientes.

loans.use: To rent a space to be able to give classes to his students more comfortably.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es soltera, tiene 35 años, vive con sus hijos de 12 y 6 años. Ella es natural del distrito de Moho, es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera desde hace 20 años se dedica Palomitas de maíz de forma ambulante en su triciclo, esta actividad la realiza para poder mantenerse económicamente.A Martina le gusta su negocio, ya que comprando una bolsita de maíz puede multiplicar su inversión, trabajando desde la una de la tarde, hasta entrada la noche, lo difícil de su trabajo es tener que dejar el maiz en su punto; ni muy tostado, ni muy pequeño, para que sea de gusto de los compradores, los años le han enseñado que con mucha paciencia y alegría las cosas salen mejor, es así que hoy en día quiere y respeta su trabajo. 
Martina se esfuerza por brindarles a sus niños una buena educación y por ende un gran futuro.
Con el dinero facilitado comprará una cocinita a gas para preparar mucho más rápido el popcorn, y con el tiempo tener un negocio adicional.
texts.en:
Martina is single, 35 years of age and lives with her 12 and 6 year old children. She hails from Moho District and is a hard working single mom. Over the past 20 years she has been selling popcorn from her mobile popcorn stand. She has been doing this work to be able to sustain her family.

Martina enjoys her business as she can multiply her investment in a bag of corn working hard from 1 PM until late. The hardest part of her business is popping the kernels just right (not too toasted, nor too small) to ensure her clients get a quality product. Over the years she has learned that with a lot of patience and a lot of enthusiasm things work out a lot better in the long run. She enjoys and respects her work.

Martina is making an effort to provide her children with a good education to help them on the road to a great future.

With the microloan she will purchase a small gas cooker to speed up the popcorn preparation and in time hopes to have another business.


Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a small gas cooker to her mobile popcorn stand.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai F., 56, is married with six children. She has many years of experience in her business. She sells to the general public and villagers 6 days per week. Faafetai has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 520 Tala (~$216 USD). SPBD loans are Faafetai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She runs a small shop in her village, and there is some very tough competition for her but she tries to have good customer service to get her clients.

loans.use: Faafetai would like to improve her general store.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou D., 44 ans, veuve, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Ressortissantes Mpack depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer ses activités d’abattage de bœuf et de vente de crème glace fait à base  de pain de singe, bissap et sucre pour satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Bintou D., 44, a widow raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Ressortissantes Mpack for 5 and a half years. She wants to boost her businesses slaughtering cattle and selling ice cream made with monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), hibiscus flower syrup, and sugar to satisfy the demand of her clientele and improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of ice cream and slaughtering of cattle

loans.name: Wendy Janina

texts.es:
La señorita Wendy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Bolívar Nº 335, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad estudia en UNU la especialidad de Derechos Humanos y cuenta  con el mismo negocio. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará colonias, aretes, collares, perfumes, cremas de manos, etc.  

Wendy es una señorita que desea triunfar en la vida. Agradece al banco comunal por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Wendy belongs to the Community Bank "Las Tigresas" (meaning The Tigresses), located in Jr. Bolivar No. 335, in the district of Calleria, in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 21 years old and she is single. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest in the sales of beauty products. She has been with the Community Bank for the past 2 years.

She is currenty attending the United Nations University, completing a specialty in Human Rights, always depending on her business. This business provides her with enough earnings to pay off her loan on time.

With this loan of S/.1700, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase colognes, earrings, necklaces, perfumes, hand creams, etc.

Wendy is a young lady that longs to enjoy her life. She is very thankful to the Community Bank for believing in her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase colognes, earrings, necklaces, perfumes, hand creams etc.

loans.name: Cherifatou

texts.fr: Née le 21 Février 1974 à Cotonou dans le département du littoral au Sud du Bénin,Dame A. Chérifatou est mariée à IDOHOU Obalowou. Elle est mère de d'un enfant. Dame A. procède à la distribution des bijoux et dispose en plus d'une boutique sur le PARC à Sèkandji où elle vent des pièces détachées, Désireuse de renforcer d'avantage son activité, elle démande ce crédit.
texts.en:
Mrs Cherifatou Ajado was born on February 24th, 1974 at Cotonou in the South Coastal area of Benin, and is married to Obalowoa Idohou. She is the mother of one child. Mrs Ajado distributes and sells jewelery and jewelery repair items from a shop in the marketplace ( PARC) in the city of Sekandji. Chérifatou is requesting this loan to strengthen her business in this area.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies of jewelery and jewelery repair items

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 28  años, vive con su hijo de 9 años. Se dedica a trabajar cada día en su locutorio, el cual instaló en su casa hace 8 meses, negocio que surgió ante la necesidad de generarse recursos propios, aprovechando la facilidad que tiene de poseer el servicio de Internet, es así que ofrece diariamente este servicio de comunicación. Carmen ha visto la necesita de ampliar su negocio, y está planificando cómo lograrlo, y cuando se propone nuevas metas no las deja sin ejecutar. Por el momento desea mantenerse, ya que está buscando un mejor lugar para crecer. Su mayor motivación es su pequeño hijo de 9 años que vive con ella. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete nuevamente a trabajar por el desarrollo de su banco comunal. Carmen solicita este dinero para adquirir una cantidad considerable de tarjetas para celular prepago, de montos diversos, las cuales podrá ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old and lives with her nine-year-old son. Every day, she works in her call center, which has been located in her house for 8 months. This business, which she stared so that she could earn her own money, uses a facility where she can offer internet services. In this way, she offers communication services daily. Carmen knows that she needs to grow her business and is planning how to achieve this. When she makes new goals for herself, she doesn’t stop without reaching them. For the moment, she wants to maintain the business, since she is looking for a better location to grow. Her biggest motivation is her small, nine-year-old son, who lives with her. This is her second loan with MFP, and she commits herself again to work for the development of her community bank. Carmen requests this money so that she can acquire a large quantity of prepaid cellular cards, of different amounts, which she will offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid cellular cards

loans.name: Zaher Mohammad

texts.en:
Zaher M. is the son of M. A. and lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He needs money for his business to increase his inventory.

He requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. Zaher  wants buy necessary materials for his business which will increase his inventory and he wants to expand his business.

He is very happy with this process of obtaining a small loan in Afghanistan and wants to thank KIVA lenders around the world.

loans.use: he expand and progress for his business

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, adquirio una vivienda en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan donde desea realizar mejoras como son: anexo para la cocina, construccion de pantry y poner ceramica al piso que esta embaldozado, acutalmente esta habitando en casa de una hermana donde no tiene condiciones ni privacidad, su esposo trabaja en estados unidios y esta gestionando su jubilacion para trasladarse a su vivienda en Juigalpa, donde pasara su jubilacion con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, uno de 8 años estudiando el 3er grado de primaria y la otra actualmente en estados unidos estudiando la secundaria. Una vez que la vivienda preste las condiciones necesarias se trasladaran para Nicaragua a cumplir su sueño de vida, descansar junto a su esposa e hijos.  Doña Martha Lorena esta dispuesta a continuar mejorando su vivienda una vez que su esposo este en Nicaragua, ya que en estos momentos se les hace dificil estar atendiendo gastos familiares en 2 lugares.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is married, she is 48 years old and bought a house at Residencial Bosque in Juigalpan that she wants to improve. She wants to add to her kitchen, build a pantry and build a ceramic tile floor. She is currently living at a sister's house where she lacks privacy. Her husband works in USA and is trying to get his retirement to move to his house in Juigalpan, where he expects to retire with his wife and kids, one is eight years old and this daughter studies high school in USA. Once the house is on good conditions he will move to Nicaragua to fulfill his dream living with his wife and children. Ms. Martha Lorena will keep on improving her house once his husband is in Nicaragua, because right now is difficult to spend on family expenses in both places.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her kitchen, pantry and ceramic tile on the floors

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is a fish monger. Her husband is a carpenter and she has five dependents. She has received education through junior high school. Hannah goes to the shore to buy fish from the fishermen and sends it home for processing before selling it at the market, which is at Elmina. Hannah has been in this business since 1995. She would use the money she recieves to expand her business. She would then use the profit she gets to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: She would use the money she takes to expand her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac A. is 31 years old. He is married, and the father of three kids who are currently in school. He trades and resides at Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. He operates a clothing shop where he sells men's and women's clothing, including jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags and headscarves. Isaac has been in business for fifteen years now, but he is constrained by the need for funds to run the business. He needs the loan to enable him to inject more working capital into the business, in order to scale up its progress. He believes the loan will help him upgrade his inventory, by supplying the resources to purchase items of good quality in large quantity. With the loan, he wants to purchase jeans, shirts, ladies' wear, headscarves and slippers. It is his desire to provide a better education for his children, and believes he can fulfill that through your loan support. He belongs to the village bank called Great Commission.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, shirts, ladies' wear, headscarves and slippers

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SEÑOR D. H. D. CUSCO”, está conformado por 20 miembros, estos socios llevan en su mayoría más D. 15 años trabajando con la organización D. bancos comunales en la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios alternan sus actividades personales con labores comerciales diferentes, encontramos a socios que tiene sus tiendas D. barrotes, otros tienen tiendas D. venta D. ropas, para bebes y adultos, otros socios tienen carpintería, librería, y en particular una socia la más antigua del grupo la sra. Margarita tiene su pequeña tienda abarrotes y ahí mismo a apertura do un restaurante y en las tardes es un cafetín, ella misma prepara los menús y los ponches y sándwich y empanadas D. pollo, carne, los socios solicitan el préstamo en razón D. implementar sus diferentes negocios y la sra. Margarita quiere terminar D. construir su casita, que poco a poco con la ayuda D. este tipo D. préstamos lo está logrando.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el apoyo otorgado mediante este préstamo y así mismo se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total D. la deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The group "Senor D. H. D. Cusco" is formed by 20 members, most of these members have been working 15 years with the organization of community banks in the city of Cusco. The members work in different commercial activities, some have grocery stores, other sell clothes for babies and adults, other members work on carpentry, bookstores, and one of the oldest members of the group Mrs. Margarita has a small grocery store and a small restaurant on the same place, in the afternoons is a coffee shop, she prepares the menus, beverages, sandwiches, chicken and beef empanadas. The members request the loan in order to get working capital for their business and Mrs. Margarita wants to finish building her house. The members value and appreciate the loan and commit to pay the debt on the time determined.

Translated from Spanish by N. Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. is a hardware seller at Siwdo near Cape Coast. She has been in business for four years and sells such items as nails, paints, shovels and other building materials. Rose is married with two children and received no formal education. She is responsible for paying her family's various expenses. 

Rose is currently out of stock and hopes to use her loan to refill her shop with building materials. She will also purchase more building materials and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is thirty-five years old and married with three children. She sells provisions, medicines and clothing.  She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and clothes to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech A., 35, has sold vegetables and pork in the local market for years. She is a married mother blessed with four children who attend school.  Her husband is a domestic animal trader.  He buys mature pigs and oxen, slaughters them, and sells the meat to market sellers.  Pech is applying for a $1000 loan to buy a used-car so her husband can transport more meat.  With the remainder of the loan she will buy more mature pigs for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: Buy a used-car.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia A. is a mother of strong faith and determined to get her four children out of the spiral of poverty. She is 46 years old and married to Marino, also 46 years old, and her business partner. She lives in the island village of Malacaban, Binangonan, Rizal Province.

In 1995, Remegia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of hope to step out of poverty. She has maintained a very good performance during her entire membership. Now on her sixth loan, she wishes to borrow 27,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish cage business. She has been in this business for 15 years and acknowledges the proceeds the business had brought to them. This loan will be used to pay for the construction of two fish cages including materials, bamboo, fingerlings, fishnets and payment for human labor costs. Some money will be used for bamboo crafts as a secondary business.

Remegia is hopeful that with this loan she will be able to expand and have additional fish cages that will give her more fish to be sold in the market during harvest seasons. She also dreams of sending her children to school up to college and on to finding jobs. She wants to have a more spacious and durable house.

loans.use: To construct two fish cages and for bamboo crafts

loans.name: Tumurhuu

texts.en:
Tomorhuu S. is 61 and currently lives with two of his five children in the Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. The two oldest daughters have grown up and live with their own families. The next two children are 20 and 18, and both are students in local colleges. The youngest daughter is just 2 and stays home. 

Tomorhuu has a small business selling food. He runs a small convenience store where he sells various convenience-food products, including soft drinks, bread, candies, etc. As his convenience store is in a good location with a very limited number of stores around, his daily sales volume is quite good. From the start early this year, his business has been doing well. The business capital has increased from 800,000 MNT to 1,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He says that he would like to expand his business as the opportunity arises. He would like to make his store into a larger store. 

He requests a loan to purchase more inventory of food products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of food products for his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 51years old and married with 4 children. She lives at Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for over 3years. She has been with LAPO Micro finance for a year. Grace hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She has a salon store where she fixes and braids hair for her customers. She has been in business for the past 15 years. She hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Gimalyn

texts.en:
Managing a general store is quite difficult, says Gimalyn, due to the factors to consider such as credit, health, and calamities. However, she remains intent on doing the business because she wants to help her husband uplift their poor living situation. She is happily married to Isabelito, who manages their rice fields. The couple have been gifted with a girl whose name is Mae Kyla, 2 years old. They are happily living in the village of Burgos Ramon, Isabela.

With the poor business situation of her store, Gimalyn is requesting Kiva lenders to allow her to borrow loan capital amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount will mean a lot towards the growth of her store.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mohammad Yasof Group

texts.en:
M. Yasof is the group leader of M. Yasof group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive a loan for their business.

M. Yasof and Samea allah want to take a loan for the business of selling mobile. They want to make larger their business. Farhad wants to take a loan for his business of fresh fruit selling. They want to buy necessary materials for his shop. He completes his stock. And they thank they loan of 42000 Afghani. 

They want to say this loan is very useful. Because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Jesinta Kajau

texts.en:
Jesinta is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Her shoe sales business is located in Cheptiret.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan she is expecting from KADET, she intends to add more shoes to her inventory for both adults and children. Her dreams are to improve her business and educate her children.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more  shoes to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for a cafe

loans.name: Juana Danila

texts.es:
La señora  JUANA DANILA C. Y., tiene  51 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios técnicos de costura y  tiene 3 hijos  de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. La socia se dedica  a coser ropa para damas , caballeros y niños. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró telas, hilos, cierres, botones, elástico para hacer unos pedidos de faldas y pantalones.
Con este crédito de 300 soles comprará telas, hilos, lentejuelas, blondas, para hacer manteles y servilletas navideñas.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donde pueda confeccionar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Juana Danila C. Y. is 51 years old and lives in the district of Esperanza, province of Trujillo, region of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the community bank Mujeres Emprendedoras II. She has completed technical studies in sewign and has three children, two of whom depend on her for economic support because they are still in school. Juana has dedicated herself to sewing clothes for women, men and children. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she bought fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, elastic to fulfill orders for skirts and pants. With this loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she will buy fabric, thread, sequins and silk lace to make Christmas tablecloths and napkins. Juana dreams of renting a stand in a shopping center where she can make clothes for women, men and children with greater frequency.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy fabric, thread, sequins and sequins to make Christmas tablecloths and napkins.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en: Mouna is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 children, of whom 2 are still going to school. She has owned a shoe and bag shop since 2007 to earn income to raise  her family well. Today, Mouna is asking to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase additional merchandise to satisfy the needs of the market.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia T. is from the village of Casul in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 46 years old and married, and she has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelia owns and operates a general store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Cornelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Cornelia's 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: Additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.en:
The communal bank VIOLETAS is maD. up of a board of directors: The President is Sra. Juana who sells breakfast and soft drinks at a taxi stop on Trufi Route 101 (trufis are taxis that operate like buses, with fixed routes). She lives in her own house with her three children, in the basin region. She maintains the home herself.

The Secretary is Sr. Rene Que who has been in the taxi business (Route 101) for 5 years. He works every day of the week and lives in his father-in-law's house in the Sausalito region with his wife and two children.

The Treasurer is Sra. Dayana who has been running a neighborhood store for 10 years. Sra. Dayana sells every day, and lives in a house with her husband and daughter in the Colquiri region. The group is very dynamic and responsable, and they support each other and work together.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  AURELIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad. Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14,12, 7 años, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar que son el cuidado y  alimentación de sus hijos con el comercio, Nuestra socia vende artesanía en la plaza principal de Pisac en la feria artesanal, ella tiene un stand de artesanía y vende desde aretes, collares, adornos, chalinas de alpaca, floreros, ceniceros, llaveros y mucho más, nuestra socia desea el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, ella comprara materiales para la elaboración de la artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
AURELIA, 36, is a member of the "PRODESARROLLO" communal bank. She lives in Pisac, Calca province, Cusco department, which is 40 minutes from the city. It is a small village that houses some beautiful Inca ruins; a must stop for any tourist on her way to Cusco. She is married and has three children, 14, 12, and 7 years old, respectively. She juggles her domestic chores, such as caring for and feeding her children, with commerce. She sells crafts in Pisac's main square's crafts market. She has a crafts stand where she sells such items as: earrings, decorations, alpaca scarves, flower vases, ashtrays, keyrings, and many others. She requests funding to invest in her business; she will buy supplies to make crafts. She is grateful for and values the opportunity given her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafs-making supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Virgilio V., a traffic enforcer, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling assorted beverages and managing her own store for two years.

Teresita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than five years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed for added capital for her soft drink business.   Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 15,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 11,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying assorted soft drinks and snacks for her store.

She dreams that her business will grow so that she can put up another store in another location for her children to manage someday. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snacks for her store.

loans.name: Nancy Lucia

texts.es:
Nancy Lucia Vásquez O. es una persona responsable, trabajadora, emprendedora que en el tiempo que lleva de estar trabajando con Adim ha demostrado su ferviente deseo de autosuperarse y seguir adelante. Ella como muchas mujeres en Nicaragua se dedican a sacar adelante a sus familias con sus pequeños negocios.

La señora V. desde muy temprano sale a comercializar su negocio de ropa usada y por las tardes empieza a arreglar su pequeño local de fritanga con la parrilla en la acera de su casa y una modesta mesa con maten floreado donde coloca el chilero, la ensalada, los cubiertos, etc esta lista para comenzar otra dura jornada de trabajo. Ella invertirá el crédito en ambos negocios pero dándole prioridad al de fritanga ya que necesita de mayor cantidad de dinero.
texts.en:
Nancy Lucia Vásquez O. is a responsible, hard-working, and enterprising person. During the time that she has been working with Adim, she has demonstrated her fervent desire for self-improvement and to get ahead. She, like many women in Nicaragua, devotes herself to getting her family ahead with her small business. Mrs. Vásquez leaves very early to sell used clothes. In the afternoons she starts to arrange her small fried snack stand. The grill goes on the sidewalk to her house, and she places the cooler, the salad, and the cutlery, etc. on a modest table with a floral tablecloth. Then she is ready to start another hard day’s work. She will use the loan for both businesses, but she will give priority to the fried snack stand because it needs a greater amount of money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and ingredients to prepare fried snacks

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta tiene  45  años, está separada con dos hijos mayores , universitario.
Marta tiene su boutique en la cuidad de San Lorenzo  , ya hace mas de 20 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logro  mantener  una clientela formada. 
El crédito es  para la compra de ropas de invierno  como camperas, poleras, gorras. Medias de lana, busos, pantalones. 
 Ella sueña con tener un local mas amplio y ofrecer mas comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marta is 45 years old, is separated and has two adult, college student children. Marta has her boutique in the city of San Lorenzo, and, thanks to her effort and dedication in maintaining an established clientele, she has had the store for more than 20 years now. This credit is for buying winter clothes, such as jackets, warm shirts, hats, wool socks, sweaters and pants. She dreams of having a larger store and of offering more comfort and convenience to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes (for store)

loans.name: Jose Eulalio

texts.es: Don José Gutiérrez cuenta con 37 años de edad, es casado de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de gorras y sombreros” cuenta con un pequeño negocio, lleva 10 años de vender gorras y sombreros  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Choescuela, Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Don José Gutiérrez is 37 years old, married, and works as a merchant. He has been buying and selling caps and hats for ten years. His home is in Paraje Choescuela, Juchanep Canton, Department of Totonicapán in Guatemala. The demand from his customers is currently growing, but his financial condition is not sufficient and he is in need of additional capital. For this reason, he has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying more merchandise to increase his sales. He also hopes to succeed for his family and provide them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy caps & hats

loans.name: Sreimach's Group

texts.en:
This group loan from Preak Ta Nob village in Kandal province consists of 19 members. Mrs. Sreimach C., a 35-year-old married woman, was selected by the other members as the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sreimach C. and her husband, Mr. Chan Toem, have two children who are students in the local school.  The couple are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate vegetables. Mrs. Sreimach C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her cucumber crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman with one son and two daughters. Two of her children attend school but her third child suffers from epilepsy and does not attend school. Mariam rents her home and has no electricity or water and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mariam sells clothes and wants to purchase handbags, shoes and materials with the Ksh 40,000 loan. She sells her products door-to-door and her customers are mainly women. The main challenge to her business is transport and sources of capital to run the business. She has been in this business for almost ten years and was previously selling cosmetics.

Mariam aspires to expand her business and buy a home someday. She decided to work with Yehu in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy shoes, handbags and materials

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Хочаев Нуриддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Нуриддин имеет средне - специальное образование, "Механизатор". По профессии работал 9 лет. Сейчас он тракторист, работает на поле. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет на ремонт трактора.
texts.en:
Nuriddin H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Nuriddin has a secondary-specialized education as a mechanic. He spent 9 years working in that field. Now he is a tractor driver and works in the fields. He has been involved in this business for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan in order to repair his tractor.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tractor repairs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia O. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men P. is a 42-year-old resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she earns a living by selling flowers for ceremonies and other parties at the local busy market. She married years ago and is blessed with two children, one of whom is married and the other is still a dependent. She has a life partner in her husband who is a military policeman. This is the second loan she has requested. Men P. will use this loan to purchase an old motorcycle to provide the transportation for her family, as well as to order more and different kinds of flowers to better meet her valued customers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorcycle.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of about $2 per day. Her husband earns a living by working in the construction field. He is hired by people to build their new houses, a skill he learned from his grandparents. This couple has been married for years and has a single child who is employed. 

Nov S. sees that her husband travels to his work location by paying for a taxi at a high price. Nov S. hopes to reduce this expense by asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband's use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old and single. To make a living, he operates a service-based business,  providing transport services to local community members. Rex is just starting this business. His previous business was a sari-sari (variety) store. 

In 2009, Rex joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. 

Rex is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vitelio

texts.es:
Vitelio tiene 61 años de edad reside en el Municipio de San Rafael de Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con la compañera de vida y la hija, todos trabajan, el se dedica ala agricultura.
El aprendió a trabajar la tierra muy joven, ya que los padres le inculcaron el cultivo de la tierra, no tiene horario de trabajo, el necesita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivo de  maíz  de una gran extensión de tierra, el comprar fertilizantes que son necesarios para darle mantenimiento al cultivo. Uno de los riesgos es que el clima no se favorable.
La aspiraciones son convertirse en agricultor en grande y asi apoyar a a familia para darles un mejor sistema de vida.
texts.en:
Vitelio, age 61, lives in the San Rafael de Oriente municipality in the San Miguel department. He lives with his life partner and their daughter. All of them work in agriculture. He learned to work the land when he was very young. His parents initiated him in working the land. He does not have a work schedule. He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies to plant corn on a large piece of land. He will buy fertilizers, which are needed to give his crops good maintenance. One of the risks is that the climate is not favorable. His aspiration is to become a farmer on a large scale. That way he will help give his family a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, which are needed to give his crops good maintenance

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Ada tiene 43 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada. Casi toda su vida ha trabajado en la elaboración de pan, negocio el cual le fue heredado por su padre, desde entonces lo administra. Lleva 40 años de funcionamiento, teniendo como socios a sus propios hermanos, que juntos elaboran pan, pasteles y galletas, que luego son ofrecidos a los diversos establecimientos pasteleros. Disfruta de su trabajo porque le permite ser una empresaria, y eso le da satisfacción personal. En adelante esta viendo la manera de adquirir maquinaria nueva para incrementar la productividad que le permitirá tener más ganancias. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la adquisición de nueva maquinaria como su batidora de masa.
texts.en:
Ada is 43 years old. She lives with her 3 children in a rented house. She has worked almost her entire life making bread. She inherited the business from her father, and has run it ever since. It has been in operation for 40 years. Her partners are her own siblings and together they make bread, pastries and cookies which they later offer to various pastry establishments. She enjoys her job because it allows her to be a businesswoman and that giver her personal satisfaction. For the future, she is looking for a way to adquire new machinery to increase productivity which will allow her to have more earnings. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very happy knowing that she has financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her payments and she also likes being part of a community group because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to those people who will be lenders for the loan she is asking for and it will be very useful fo her business' progress. With the loan that she is asking for, she will invest in adquiring new machinery such as a dough mixer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine for kneading

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 41 years old. Corazon is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Jocelyn is married and has an adult-aged child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Raegil Kent

texts.en:
Raegil Kent T. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old and single. To make a living, he operates a transportation service. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raegil Kent joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Raegil Kent is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Kenia Julisa

texts.es: La Sra. Kenia Julisa G. C.  ella es Trabajadora activa del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como Auxiliar de Compras tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta empresa es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación estos créditos con Ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera porque de lo contrario es difícil hacer este tipo de mejora en el hogar.
texts.en: Senora Kenia Julisa G. C. is an active employee at the Hotel Barceló Montelimar, where she works as a Purchasing Assistant. She has been working for the company for two years, and she is married. She has had two loans with [field partner] CEPRODEL and each one has enabled her to buy construction materials and improve her home. These loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her enormously because otherwise it is very difficult to make this type of home improvements.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: sand, cement, quarried stone, etc.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es: Adelia, de 43 años, es una mujer con muchas ambiciones, hace 20 años que convive con Cancio, de 47 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos; en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaricolca. Ver a sus hijos profesionales y encaminarlos en la vida, es su meta. Por ello, hace ya 20 años que trabaja con ahínco en la siembra de papa, arveja y avena; que gracias a los constantes cuidados; le genera buenas ganancias. Pero consciente, que en temporadas donde hay  escasez de agua, no se puede sembrar; ella aprovecha para vender la leche que produce su 2 vacas de la raza “mantona”; con ello, asegura la estabilidad económica de su familia. Y como buena madre, siempre vela por la alimentación de sus hijos. Ella también cría animales menores; como cuyes, carneros, que enseba para utilizar la carne, para su alimentación, pero viendo su buena crianza, está planeando comercializarlos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y asegura de la responsabilidad de su banco comunal, augura que tendrá muchos éxitos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono para sus sembríos de papa, que en estos días, comenzará a sembrar.
texts.en: Adelia is 43 years old, and a woman with ambition.  She has lived with Cancio (47 years old) for 20 years, and they have 6 children.  They live with 5 of them in their own home located in Huaricolca.  Her goal is for her children to have a profession and be well set up for life.  For this reason she has been enthusiastic in her work, planting potatoes, peas, and oats.  Because of the way she constantly cares for her crops, this generates solid earnings.  Because there is a water shortage at times, she cannot plant, and she turns to selling the milk produced by her two "mantona" cows, thereby assuring her family’s financial wellbeing.  Good mother that she is, she always sees that her children are properly fed.  She also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs, sheep, which she fattens for their meat, for their feeding, but if they turn out well, she plans to market them.  This is her first loan with MFP, and confident in her communal bank’s reliability, she predicts that she will be very successful.  With the loan provided, she will buy fertilizer for her potato fields, where she will begin sowing very soon.

loans.use: Comprar abono

loans.name: María  Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en la comunidad de Huizhil que pertenece a la parroquia Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales contando con una gran cantidad de piscinas, tiene varios lugares turísticos para distraerse con la familia y cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
