Doña María tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de su mamá a quien cuida y hace compañía, siendo el sostén de la casa, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y granos, actividad que la realiza desde que tenia 12 años de edad ya que ayudaba a su mamá, su producto lo compra a los vendedores mayoristas, labora 4 días a la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiene un puesto propio el mismo que fue de su mamá.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio, siendo una de las socia fundadoras del mismo.  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, verduras y granos para su local. Su sueño es tener algún día su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María M., 48, is a member of the Mujeres de Combate (Women of Battle) communal bank.  She lives in Huizhil which is part of Baños parish.  This parish is known for its thermal waters and it has quite a few swimming pools and tourist destinations where families can go to relax; it also has quite a varied gastronomy.

María is single and lives in her mother’s house; she cares for and keeps her mother company.  She supports the home selling fruit, vegetables and grains, an activity she’s been doing since she was 12 years old because she used to help her mother.  She buys her products from wholesalers.  She works four days a week from 7am until 6pm.  She has the same stand that once belonged to her mother.

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and a half.  She is one of the founding members.  She will use the money from the loan to buy fruit, vegetables and grains for her stand.  Her dream is to someday have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and grains.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena, de 23 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos. En su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está valerosa joven, se dedica a estudiar obstetricia, su sueño es ser una excelente profesional. Todas las mañanas se dedica a la venta de papa al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, en un espacio que alquila hace 2 años. Los días de mayor venta, son los miércoles, viernes y domingo, donde la mayoría de los pobladores salen al mercado a hacer las compras de los alimentos para la semana. Ya por las tardes, estudia en un instituto reconocido de su ciudad. El trabajo según menciona la mantiene activa y la ayuda a pagar sus estudios, ahora logró mantener un capital de 3 mil nuevos soles, que invierte semanalmente en la compra de varios sacos de papa. Pero los meses donde gana más cantidad de dinero son las épocas de cosecha, ya que vende su propia producción de papa, que en sociedad con su hermano, siembran en los terrenos que tienen, en el pueblo de Huasahuasi. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, y según menciona está orgullosa de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues son personas que la encaminan a seguir desarrollándose. Es por ello que el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de papa que venderá los días de feria, y con el resto de dinero comprará 20 sacos de abono para su cultivo de papa que en el mes de Marzo cosechará.
texts.en:
Magdalena, age 23, lives with her parents and siblings, in their own house located in the city of Tarma. She is a brave young woman, dedicated to studying obstetric medicine, and her dream is to become an excellent professional. 

Every morning she sells potatoes, wholesale, in the largest market in Tarma, in a space she has been renting for 2 years. The biggest market days are Wednesday, Friday and Sunday, when most of the local people go to the market to do their weekly food shopping. In the afternoons, she studies at an institute that is well-known in the city. She says that the work keeps her active and helps to pay for her studies, and she has now managed to accrue working capital of 3,000 Soles, which she invests each week in buying sacks of potatoes. But the months when she earns most money are around harvest time, when she can sell her own crop of potatoes that she and her brother cultivate on their land in the village of Huasahuasi. 

This is her 6th loan from [field partner] MFP, and she goes on to say that she is very proud to belong to her communal bank, because they are motivated to continue their own development. For this reason, she will invest the loan she receives in the purchase of several sacks of potatoes that she will selll on market days, and with the rest of the money she will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer for her potato crop that she will harvest in March.

loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes and 20 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza nace hace de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es del Barrio San Miguel  de Guarambare, en estos dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son muy activas nunca se atrasaron y siempre cancelan por adelantado es un grupo muy unido con muchas creatividad y ganas de salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Emilia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas desde un puesto de venta quien  posee un puesto de venta.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y realiza varias actividades para ayudar a su comité.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas como remeras, shorts, vestidos, y otros.
texts.en: The La Esperanza ['Hope'] Committee was born two years ago from the action and support of another committee working in the same location. This Committee is from the San Miguel de Guarambare Neighbourhood. In these two years of intensive work it has grown socially and economically. They are very active-they are never late and always repay ahead of time. This is a very united group with much creativity and desire to succeed. One of the members is Mrs. Emilia, who sells clothing from a sales stall. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses and others.

loans.use: The purchase of clothing-t-shirts, shorts, dresses and others.

loans.name: Jorge  Raymundo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Raymundo; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales eléctricos, el socio realiza instalaciones eléctricas a domicilio ,el socio tiene su empresa eléctrica lleva años en este negocio ya que la profesión del socio es ingeniero eléctrico, el socio es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jorge Raymundo is a member of the “LOS HERALDOS” which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Jorge Raymundo is 48 years old, married and has one child.  His business is buying and selling electrical materials.  He installs electrical systems in peoples' homes.  He has his own electrical company and has been in this business for years as he is an electrical engineer by profession.  Jorge Raymundo is a very enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get himself and his family ahead in life through his business. 

Jorge Raymundo is requesting this loan to buy electrical materials for his business.  He is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for his business

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, posee una tienda, resiD. en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos nietos D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, Ella tiene 56 años D. edad, este negocio lo comenzó su madre cuando ella tenía 12 años D. edad y le ayudaba a atender a los clientes, cuando su madre falleció, ella decidió darle continuidad al negocio, hoy día tiene 21 años D. administrarlo atendiéndolo D. 6:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas, todo le ha salido bien con los clientes que le visitan.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar frijol, aceite, azúcar, arroz, galletas y más productos que ofrece a los clientes, esto contribuirá a su negocio fortaleciéndolo y generando más utilidades para su hogar.
Doña Sonia espera que a través del negocio pueda apoyar a sus nietos para que asistan a estudio superiores y puedan defenderse en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia has her own store and resides in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren, who are 18 and 22 years old. She is 56 years old. Her business was started by her mother when she was 12 years old. Sonia helped attend to the customers. When her mother died, she decided to continue with the business. She has now been running it for 21 years, serving customers from 6:00am til 4:00pm. She has never had any problems with it and she has done well with the clients that visit her store. 

Sonia is asking for a loan to buy beans, cooking oil, sugar, rice, cookies and other products she offers her clients. This will strengthen her business and generate more revenues for her home. She hopes that her business can support her grandchildren and allow them to get a higher education and proviD. a future for themselves.

loans.use: The purchase of rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and cookies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Wood, glue and nails.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old and sells spare parts for cars from her house. She also sells salchipapa (thinly sliced pan-fried sausage served with french fries). 

She will use her loan of 1,000 PEN to buy more spare parts in Lima to sell in Ayacucho. Her business is doing well and she expects next month to be even better. 

Roxana has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. Being a member provided her with the opportunity to study biology. With her earnings she is able to buy the books she needs. Saving money is what Roxana likes most about being a member, because she is not able to do that at home. From the training sessions provided, she said her self esteem has increased and she has also learned to be punctual. 

Her goal is to finish her studies and open a bigger store to sell the spare car parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare car parts to resell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la realización de nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y credo que se comercializa por lo general los fines de semana. Además realiza pinolillo bebida típica hecha con maíz y cacao.
Ella con el crédito comprara materia prima para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman who makes Nicaraguan tamales, a traditional dish made of corn and pork.  She usually sells on the weekends.  In addition, she produces “pinolillo”, a traditional beverage made of corn and cacao.

Patricia is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase pork, corn, potatoes, tomatoes, and other supplies

loans.name: Edeltrudes

texts.en:
Edeltrudes L. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Edeltrudes is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling firewood and charcoal in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edeltrudes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Edeltrudes is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood and charcoal to sell. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sdeng

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sdeng (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Eam, live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school. 

S. is now a rice farmer. Her husband is an electrician. She is requesting a loan of $300 to reinforce her house's foundation.

loans.use: to reinforce her house's foundation

loans.name: Dashdemberel

texts.en:
Dashdemberel, 31, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His older son goes to a local secondary school and the younger one attends kindergarten. He manages a public transportation service business between provinces and towns.

 He started his business in 1994. However, he is planning to operate a taxi service business in the future. He is a hard-working man who says, "I want to conduct a taxi service business instead of my current public transportation service. The reason is that public transportation service business is very difficult to operate during wintertime." He is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his taxi service business.

loans.use: To purchase a new car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Otilia Tomas

texts.pt:
Otilia Tomas da Conceição T. nasceu em Xinavane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de 27, 29 e 34 anos de  idade todos ja naõ vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 5ª classe não continuou porque foi ap lar muito cedo (casamento prematuro). Vive na casa propria com a sua família e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Xinavane para o Distrito de Boane com o seu marido. Tem uma propriedade de terra que usa para a produção de Horticulas ha mais de 18 anos e possui empregado que lhe ajuda na preparação da terra onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt a 4.000.00mt em media por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e as vezes consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

 Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colaboradores desta instituição. Este é o seu setimo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agricolas ( sementes, fertelizantes, adubos e outros) para aumentar as suas areas de produção. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para aumentar as areas agricolas e se tornar a maior produtora de Horticolas.
texts.en:
Otilia Tomas da Conceição T. was born in Xinavane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, ages 27, 29 and 34, all of whom are no longer in school. She only completed 5th grade and didn't continue her schooling due to an early marriage. She lives in her own home with her family and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

She left Xinavane for Boane District with her husband. She has land that she has been using to grow crops for over 18 years. She has one employee who helps her to prepare the land. She has monthly earnings of about 3,000 to 4,000 meticais on average, which she uses for household expenses and is sometimes able to save a portion in her bank account.

She has had loans at other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through partners of the institution. This is her seventh loan with Hluvuku, and is for 20,000 meticais. With the loan, she plans to purchase agricultural inputs (seeds, fertilizers, and other items) to increase the area of production. 

She is committed to paying on schedule in order to obtain future loans. She plans to request new loans to increase the agricultural area and to become the largest producer of crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs (seeds, fertilizers, and other items).

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de  44 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Lucila vive en la parte rural de este distrito, donde se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

Lucila se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja y  algarrobina (especie de miel extraída del algarrobo) a la cual le da un valor agregado al envasarlos. Se dedica a esto desde hace 5 años. Complementariamente Lucila vende joyas a los pobladores de su zona, que se sienten satisfechos con sus productos.
 
Con estas actividades Lucila contribuye a los aportes de su esposo, quien es agricultor y cuenta con parcela propia donde tiene mango en producción.

Lucila solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (miel, algarrobina y envases) para su negocio, pues sus pedidos aumentan periódicamente y así aumentarán sus ventas.

Lucila  ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y sus créditos los pagó puntual y responsablemente. Esta es una familia que goza de buenas referencias.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 44 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in Tambogrande district - Piura.  Lucila lives in the rural part of this district where people mainly farm and raise livestock.

Lucila sells bees' honey and 'algarrobina' (a type of syrup extracted from the black carob tree).  She provides her products with added value by putting them in containers.  She has been in this business for five years.  In addition, Lucila also sells jewelry to people in her area who feel happy with her products.

Through these business activities, Lucila contributes financially to her household alongside her husband who is a farmer and owns his own plot of land where he grows mangos.

Lucila is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise (honey, algarrobina and containers) for her business as her orders increase periodically and, therefore, so do her sales.

Lucila has worked with Edpyme Alternativa previously and she repaid her loans punctually and responsibly.  Hers is a family with good references.

loans.use: to buy honey, algarrobina (a type of syrup from the black carob tree) and containers

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 40 years old.  She has 9 children who are between the ages of 6 months and 20 years old.  Her eldest child has finished high school, 4 are in high school, and the other 4 are in primary school.  She owns a general store in which she sells rice, cooking oil and a few other food items. She has been operating this business for 18 months and it has enabled her to feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, rice and foodstuffs to sell. With the profits, she plans to feed her family and make some savings.

loans.use: buy food items to sell

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria tiene 21 años, es casada vive con el esposo y una hija. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luz Maria se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, es tradición en su familia dedicarse a este negocio. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para la familia.

Le gusta salir a pàsear por la ciudad con la familia.
texts.en:
Luz María is 21 years old, married and living with her husband and daughter.  She lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called Narcisa de Jesús and is located in San Temístocles which is in Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Luz María is a farmer, especially of corn.  It’s a family tradition to be in this business.  Her purchases take place in Ventanas and his sales at the market there.

She is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations and crop illnesses as well as weather variations.  Her dream is to buy a house for the family.  She enjoys going on family excursions in the city.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Victoriano tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos adolescentes, que se encuentran estudiando.
El Sr. Victoriano se dedica hace aproximadamente 25 años a la fabricación de muebles de todo tipo, se inició en las tareas de carpintería desde muy joven, gracias a que su padre lo había iniciado en esta hermosa profesión.
Actualmente realiza los trabajos a todas aquellas personas que le solicitan sus servicios, además realiza trabajos tercerizados para arquitectos e ingenieros. Esta muy orgulloso del trabajo que realiza y desea que sus hijos también se dediquen a una profesión similar a la suya.
Solicita el crédito para ampliar una parte de su galpón o taller de trabajo, ademas de aquellos materiales inherentes a su profesion, ya que se inicia la temporada de invierno y necesita resguardar sus productos terminados.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 45 years old.  He is single and has two teenage children who are in school.

Victoriano has been making all kinds of furniture for approximately 25 years.  He began doing carpentry work at a very young age thanks to his father who started him off in this beautiful profession.

Victoriano is currently doing work for everybody who requests his services.  He also does outsourced work for architects and engineers.  He is very proud of the work that he does and would like his children to carry out a profession similar to his.

Victoriano is requesting this loan to expand part of his workshop, as well as to buy materials that he needs for his profession.  The winter season is starting and he needs to protect his finished products.

loans.use: to expand his workshop and buy tools he needs for his carpentry business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena tiene 35 años, Es soltera vive con los padres y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta es cocinar para los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 35 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and children in the Ventanas canton of the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA [Fighting for the Same Cause] community bank are in the town of La Primavera, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural crops such as corn and rice. 

Maria Magdalena works farming corn, rice and beans. She buys her materials in Comercial Peña and sells her products in the wholesale market of  Ventanas.

She is asking for the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy materials and fertilizers for her crops. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to buy land to continue planting. 

She likes to cook for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura y ganadería.

Carlos desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Callayuc, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventará sus necesidades familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno de raza y su respectivo alimento para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Carlos es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old and lives with his family in their own house, where light is the only service they have. It is located in the rural zone of the district of Callayuc, which belongs to the department of Cajamarca. In this zone, the main economic activities are agriculture and raising cattle.

For several years, Carlos has worked raising and selling cattle. His corral is located outside his house and he feeds his cattle a balanced diet and natural grasses so that their milk production will be good. He offers the milk to others who live in his zone or he brings it to sell at the market in Callayuc. He has regular customers because of the good quality of his milk. He uses his income to take care of his family's needs.

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more well-bred cattle and their proper foods, so that he can increase his milk production and thereby sell it at a better price to cover his loan repayments.  He would also like to improve his family's quality of life. Carlos is a hard-working and very responsible person. The only things he wants are for his business to grow and for his children to have more educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy well-bred cattle and their proper food

loans.name: Delis Rosa

texts.es: Derlis de 37 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 14 años de edad, en Soledad, municipio de Colombia con el mayor crecimiento poblacional del país. Allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, negocio que nace por su empeño de obtener independencia económica y generar ingresos para aportar al desarrollo y el bienestar de su hogar. Ella inició hace 5 años, vendiendo pocos productos a crédito entre sus vecinas y amigas y hoy tiene una mayor clientela y ha agregado muchos más, es decir todo lo que el cliente necesita, Derlis lo consigue a un buen precio, para que lo paguen mediante plazos pactados; el 80% de sus ventas las hace a credito y un 20% de contado, igualmente sus compras las hace de contado en ventas de remates y tambien recibe mercancia desde la Guajira, al norte de Colombia. Así vende ropa, perfumes, bisutería, calzado; ella es una buena empresaria y por eso diariamente consigue nuevos clientes, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responderle oportunamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado especialmente, inversión que proyecta ser exitosa porque está basada en pedidos de sus clientes. Su meta más adelante es tener un local comercial, donde distribuya y organice su mercancía e impacte a sus clientes, exhibiendo una gama de productos, que ellos necesiten y puedan comprar. Mientras esto ocurre Derlis se siente entusiasmada, porque sus estados finacieros reflejan el buen momento por el cual pasa su negocio
texts.en: 37 year old Derlis lives with her partner and her 14 year old son in Soledad, a Colombian town with the fastest growing population in the country. She works there selling a variety of goods, a business that came out of her efforts to become economically independent and generate income so she can contribute to the development and well being of her household. She began this business 5 years ago, selling a few products on credit to her neighbors and friends, and today she has a large cliental and has added much more.  That is to say, everything that her customers want, Derlis gets for them at a good price and they pay her at agreed deadlines. 80% of her sales are for credit, and 20% are cash sales. She also sells for cash at auctions and receives merchandise from Guajira in the north of Colombia. In this way, she sells clothes, perfumes, costume jewelry, and shoes. She is a good businesswoman and so she gets new clients daily, but her working capital isn't enough to meet their orders immediately. This is the reason she has come to Kiva, and this is the first loan she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothes and especially shoes, an investment that she expects to be successful because it is based on the requests of her clients. Her most immediate goal is to have a commercial premisis where she can lay out and organize her merchandise and impress her customers by displaying a range of products that they need and can afford. Derlis is enthusiastic because her financial statements show that this is a good time for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and especially shoes.

loans.name: Julmar

texts.en:
Julmar is 26 years old. He is married with one school-aged child to attend to. The family settled to live in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He buys various snack items and sells them for a profit. He is selling these commodities along a crowded road. Where there are many people passing by, there is a bigger chance of selling more or of eventually selling out of stock for the day. For 2 years, Julmar has been enjoying his job. His regular earnings from this activity have reached a total of PHP 5,200.
Earlier this year, he joined GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. He is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from the organization to purchase several snack items to sell such as popcorn, crackers, and many others. By having these supplies to sell, Julmar hopes to increase his income and set aside a small amount to have adequate on-hand financing for the business. He plans to own a two-wheeled cart to ease selling by making his way through nearby communities.

loans.use: To purchase several snack items to sell such as popcorn, crackers, and many others.

loans.name: Knick

texts.en:
Knick, a 33-year-old married father of two, resides in Narok, Kenya, where he has been a maize farmer for the past eight years. Having learned of KADET through a registered client, Knick is a good client who is receiving his second loan for KES.30,000 with which he will prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

An assiduous man who can accomplish a great deal with the proper funding, Knick plans to reinvest in other businesses the profits arising from this loan.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs such as fertilzer and seeds.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children.

Haydar has owned a blacksmith workshop since 1990; he makes windows, doors, and covers for air conditioners. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field. He has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a portable electric power generator. He is trying to develop his work by adding modern machinery to his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer himself the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a portable electric power generator.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her children.

She has operated a tailoring shop business for the past five years; her potential customers are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of purchasing cloth materials from the neighboring country. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and embroidery. She decided to join Yehu to access various loan products.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and embroidery.

loans.name: Rodolfa

texts.es:
Rodolfa cuenta con 52 años es viuda tienes dos hijos que depende de ella ya no estudian le ayudan económicamente.

Ella dedica al comercio vende pescado y queso lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de pescado y mas queso, ella sale a vender su pescado y queso en el pueblo y al pueblo vecino.

Rodolfa dice que su préstamo le ayudado mucho ya que con la inversión de su préstamo se encuentra trabajando, ha ella  que le gustaría que incrementara un poco más.
texts.en:
Rodolfa is 52, a widow, and she has two dependent children who are no longer in school and who help her with expenses.

She sells fish and cheese and will use the loan to buy fish and more cheese.  She sells these in her town and in the neighboring one.

Rodolfa says that her loan has helped her a lot to keep her working.  
She would like  to expand her business a little more.

loans.use: to buy fish and more fish for when she goes out to sell these items

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is an honest and hardworking person. To make a living, she raises hogs.  She breeds and fattens them and then sells them to butchers who came into their village. She had been doing this for almost six years.  In this kind of business, she usually earns PHP 3,000 for each hog sold. She spends her leisure time cleaning the pigpen to ensure its cleanliness. Her spouse provides motorcycle services to the people in their village. The couple works very hard to acquire income to pay school fees on time.

Leonor is now 58 years old and has been blessed with five children. All are attending school and need daily allowances.

Leonor is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 to buy an additional pig to raise and also feed and medicine. She would like to strengthen her business to earn additional income to finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy a pig, feed and medicine

loans.name: Tlamanka Group

texts.es:
Grupo Tlamanka (palabra en Náhuatl que significa planicie).
Doña Amelia es ama de casa pero también se dedica a cuidar borregos, vive con sus hijos y su esposo quien se dedica al campo, ella recientemente inicio con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, pues así piensa ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella solicito el préstamo para comprar refresco, aceite, sal, azúcar y frijol.
La señora Amelia es la líder del grupo Tlamanka cuyos integrantes son:
•	Juana-artesanías de lana
•	Delfina-abarrotes
•	Josefina- artesanías de lana
El grupo Tlamanka está muy felizmente agradecido con KIVA y FRAC por el crédito que les fue acreditado y se esta invirtiendo en comercio tales como tiendas de abarrotes de la misma manera en algunos casos se está invirtiendo en productos artesanales de lana de borrego, el grupo está totalmente seguro que sus inversiones será prósperos.
texts.en:
The Tlamanka (a Náhuatl word meaning plain or prairie) Group.
Doña Amelia is a housewife but also takes care of sheep. She lives with her husband and children. Her husband is a farmer. She recently started a grocery store and with this she hopes to help her husband with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, oil, salt, sugar and beans.

Señora Amelia is the leader of the Tlamanka group the members of which are:
•	Juana- wool crafts
•	Delfina - groceries
•	Josefina- wool crafts

The Tlamanka group is very happy and grateful to Kiva and FRAC for the loan that was granted them and it is being invested in businesses such as grocery stores and in a similar way in some cases in handcrafted products made of sheep's wool. The group is absolutely sure that their investments will prosper.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, oil, salt, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 36-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, who are still attending school. He provides the only source of income for the family. He has owned a poultry shop since 2003 and he’s well known by his generosity and cleanliness. Today, Hussein is asking to borrow $800 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new equipment, such as a grilling machine and other baking tools. These purchases will help him increase his business productivity and his sales, also increasing his income. In the future, he looks forward to opening his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, such as a grilling machine and other baking tools.

loans.name: Progressive A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Progressive A Group in Western Kenya! Susan is the facilitator of the Progressive A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Susan takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because One Acre Fund has the best prices and to ensure food for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Susan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Susan was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Susan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Susan will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Progressive A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old, married to Robinson, and blessed with one 7-year-old child. She has run a chemist/pharmacy shop for the past six years. Her monthly income is 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), and she is servicing a first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. 

She intends to acquire additional stocks of drugs for her shop. She plans to use the additional profits to improve her family’s living standard and expand her business. Her future hope is to explore business opportunities enabled by KADET to meet her goals.

loans.use: to add to her stock of drugs for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. De estado civil conviviente, su edad es 39 años y tiene 03 hijos de 22, 20 y 08 años de los cuales sólo el último está a su cargo y está estudiando el nivel primario..
Con tres hijos a que mantener y con el sueldo de su esposo que no alcanzaba para solventar los gastos de su hogar, hace doce años decidió vender productos de belleza por catálogo con un capital de S/.600.00, le fue bien por el empeño que le puso, desde hace cuatro años que viene formando parte del Banquito que le ayuda a capitalizarse para iniciar con la venta de nuevos productos que sus clientes necesitan . También cuenta con una buena clientela pues les brinda un trato amable.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00,  comprará productos naturales, mercadería como ropa y productos de belleza para la campaña navideña. 
Julia, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,  su sueño es implementar un Spa, donde ella pueda aplicar los conocimientos que viene recibiendo, de los productos de belleza que comercializa, para seguir generando sus propios ingresos y así mismo está muy agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con los préstamos y orientaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” communal bank, in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the province of San Martín, in San Martín department. 

She is 39, and lives with her partner. She has three children, ages 22, 20, and 8, of whom only the youngest is in her care, and attends primary school. 

With three children to support, and with her husband's salary not being enough to pay the household expenses, she decided 12 years ago to sell beauty products by catalogue. She did this with 600 soles of capital. It went well, because of the effort she put into it. 

She has been part of the communal bank for four years, which helps her obtain working capital, so that she can start selling new products that her customers need. As well, she has a good clientele, as she provides them with friendly service. 

With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy natural products, as well as merchandise such as clothing and beauty products for the Christmas sales season.  

Julia is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to open a spa, where she can apply the knowledge she has been acquiring about the beauty products she sells. This will enable her to continue generating her own income. 

Thus she is very grateful for the support she has been receiving from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, through the loans and the orientation that she receives.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en: Oyunjargal is 41 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and her son is a college student. She started her business in 2009 by renting a counter in a market. Her business income and husband's salary are not quite enough to pay her son's college fee; therefore, she needs to expand her business to increase her income. She has already rented another counter in a market; however, she does not have enough supply to run the entire counter. Therefore, Oyunjargal is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es: Jennifer, de 23 años de edad, es una joven mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, además de ser alegre y extrovertida, es conviviente con Antony quien es empleado, vive en compañía de sus suegros, sus cuñadas y su pareja, habitando la casa de su suegra. Las actividades que realiza Jennifer son la compra y venta de motos de segundo uso, dedicándose a éste negocio desde hace 6 meses contado con el apoyo de su pareja , con quien comparte la sociedad de éste negocio. Paralelo a ese negocio también tiene otro negocio en sociedad con su suegra que es un cevicheria que está funcionando en un local en la casa de su suegra, teniendo ese negocio desde hace 01 años ayudándoles a atender al público consumidor sus cuñadas. Le gusta ambos negocios ya que le generan varios ingresos económicos y puede ver como crecer su capital invertido, además de sentirse una prospera empresaria. Tiene planes de invertir en otro negocio que seria abrir una tienda de venta de ropa y juguetes de niños en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad.  Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal pues considera que son personas amables y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y juguetes de niños a precio por mayor trayendo desde la capital.
texts.en:
Jennifer, age 23, is an enterprising and hardworking young woman. In addition, she is a cheerful extrovert. Jennifer is in a common-law relationship with Antony, who is employed, and they live in the home of her in-laws. Her activities include buying and selling secondhand motorcycles. She has been in this business for six months and has the support of her partner, who helps with managing the business. Jennifer also manages another business with her mother-in-law, a “cevicheria” (a restaurant that serves marinated seafood) that is located at her in-laws’ house. She has been in this business for one year and her sisters-in-law help attend to the customers. Jennifer likes the fact that both businesses generate income, so she is able to see her investment capital grow. In addition, she feels that she is a prosperous entrepreneur.

Jennifer has plans to invest in another business. She will open a store that sells clothing and children’s toys in a shopping center in the city. This will be her third loan with the MFP organization, so she hopes to receive cooperation so that she can continue with her goals. In addition, she feels comfortable working with her Communal Bank because she considers the members to be friendly and responsible people. The amount of 2000 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of clothing and children’s toys. This capital will enable her to get a wholesale price.

loans.use: to buy toys and children's clothing.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en:
Thang, 36, is married and has two children: a son and daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a driver. 

Thang supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business eleven years ago. She sells rices, soft drinks and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular rice and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular rice and beverages

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal La Fe está conformado por 10 emprendedores que se unieron para salir adelante, todo los emprendedores se brindan ideas para mejorar en sus negocios. Este grupo de emprendedores son de la misma localidad y se unieron para emprender juntos cambios en sus negocios y brindarles a sus clientes variedad de productos y un buen servicio. Telma Del Socorro es una emprendedora parte de este grupo su actividad económica a la que se dedica al destace de cerdos en cual ya tiene varios años de experiencia  ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que le compran su productos, el crédito que está solicitando es para comprar más cerdos y abastecerse.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Fe is made up of 10 entrepreneurs who joined together to progress. All the entrepreneurs offer ideas to improve their businesses. The entrepreneurs in the group are from the same town and they got together to launch joint changes in their businesses and to offer good service and a variety of products to their customers. 

Telma Del Socorro is an entrepreneur in the group and she makes a living by butchering pigs. She already has several years of experience and has both regular and occasional customers who buy her products. The loan she is requesting is to buy more pigs and stock up.

loans.use: to buy pigs and stock up

loans.name: Antonyna

texts.en:
Antonyna is married and has an 18 year-old daughter who is a college student. Antonyna is a Technical school graduate. She used to work as a crane operator. Then she changed her job and worked as a salesperson in a grocery store. Antonyna began selling clothing and shoes for women in the outdoor market in 2003. Her business has grown steadily and has been a stable source of income. Antonyna invests money in her daughter’s education; she believes it’s the best investment. Antonyna is dynamic, persevering and responsible. She has had several loans from Nadiya Ukraine and has maintained a perfect credit history. She believes the loans she has received have been very important in helping her build her small business and she tells her entrepreneur friends about Nadiya Ukraine’s lending services. Antonyna now needs a loan to add new clothing items to her inventory for the busy holiday season.

Антоніна - одружена. В неї є 18-річна донька, яка вчиться в університеті. Антоніна отримала середньо-технічну освіту. Працювала кранівницею. Потім змінила місце роботи, працювала продавщицею в магазині. Антоніна почала продавати одяг та взуття для жінок на ринку ще в 2003 році. Її бізнес поступово розвивався, почав приносити стабільний прибуток. Антоніна з радістю інвестує гроші в навчання своєї донечки; вона вважає, що це - найкраща інвестиція. Антоніна - дуже динамічна, наполеглива та відповідальна людина. Вона виплатила усі позики, які отримала в \\\"Надії України\\\", тому вона має чудову кредитну історію. Вона вірить, що отримані нею позики відіграли важливу роль у розвитку її малого бізнесу. Антоніна розповідає своїм друзям-підприємцям про кредитні послуги, які пропонує \\\"Надія України\\\". Антоніна просить про позику тому, що хоче вкласти гроші в купівлю нового одягу та взуття, які користуються особливим попитом напередодні Новорічних та Різдвяних свят.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the purchase of a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a married man with three children. He lives and runs his business in the town of Lokbatan.

His business came into existence in 1999. Just this year, he received a $1,000 loan from the Normicro Baku branch. With this money, he was able to purchase two ice cream refrigerators so that he could sell dairy products. Now, Elshan hopes to receive an additional loan amount of $1,100 from Normicro so that he can further increase the assortment of his food products. This will provide more choice and variety to his customers.

loans.use: To increase variety of food products

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He has a hairdresser shop in the middle of Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase new furniture and a mirror, hire one unemployed person, and do some advertising for the shop in order to increase his income and make a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new furniture and mirror

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 35 and single with 2 children of her own.  She also cares for 2 orphans.  She has a produce stand on the main rutted dirt road of her village Makindye.  Today she is selling tomatoes, cabbage, pumpkin, avocado, eggplant, lemons, g-nuts, dried fish and greens.  She has operated her business at this location for the past 5 years and has been a member of her lending group for the past year.

With her loan she hopes to add charcoal as one of her products.  Charcoal is inexpensive and very important for outside cooking.  It is her desire to expand her business by slowly adding new items to her inventory.

As an interesting side note, most of the people I meet are very welcoming.  In fact, when you arrive in their village the universal phrase is, “You are most welcome”.  They are also easy to laugh and smile, and they love to have their picture taken.  I always ask permission first, and they take the picture very seriously.  They often will brush their hair and tidy themselves.  When it’s time to take their picture, they will rarely smile.  Once the photo is taken they immediately go back to smiling and laughing.  Oh well, I’ll keep trying to capture their wonderful spirit!

loans.use: Gorret plans to use the loan to buy more charcoal & matooke for her retail business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam H.  has been one of the most active clients of Microinvest since2003. During this time she has showed herself to be an honest and responsible person.She is divorced and she alone supports 8 children. A daily living wage is low and it is really difficult to earn money for such big family,but Maryam is very strong and tolerant women. She has trained her children to be kind and helpful to each other.  Today some of them are old enough to help; her two elder sons help  with the  transportation of  her goods from Uzbekistan.and her daughter sells her goods at her trade place. For the coming holiday trade Maryam wants to increase her assortment and also she wants to include some Holiday goods such as New Year cards and other presents.She hopes to receive  extra capital from KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of next batch of perfumes and additional holiday cards and other presents.

loans.name: Liliu

texts.en: Liliu is a forty two year old mother from the village of Sagafili Mulifanua. She has seven children, three of them are attending the village primary school and the rest are at the Secondary level. Her business is selling vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She sells her produce six days a week including Saturdays and she manages to bring in about $120 a day. She is one of the new members of the programme and this is her first time ever to borrow money. Liliu’s husband works at Aggie’s Hotel and also contributes his income to the family.

loans.use: “Buy chemicals and equipment for her vegetable garden.”

loans.name: Enung

texts.en: Enung, 41, is married to S. and they both sell toys such as balls, cars, etc..  They do this door-to-door on his bicyle. Doing this, they can earn upto $7 a day. To add to their capital they are asking for a loan of $75 and as a member of MBK, Enung agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
In the region of Condega, in a humble home, Mrs. Maria V. dedicates herself to the baking of bread keeping an oven since she was more than 28 years old. Every day in the early hours of the morning Mrs. Maria V. prepares the dough to produce the bread and in this manner she sells it in her house where her clients come to purchase the product. To better her condition and business she has received credits from Ceprodel to acquire better quantities of bread and sell them with the proposal of obtaining an income to care for her 3 children that also need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega, en un humilde hogar de habitación, la señora Maria V. se dedica a la elaboración de pan teniendo un horno desde hace mas de 28 años que es el tiempo en el que ella se ha dedicado a esta ardua labor de elaboración y venta de pan.

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana la señora Maria V. prepara la materia prima para elaborar el pan y de esta manera lo vende en su casa de habitación donde sus clientes llegan a comprar el producto.

Para mejorar su condición en el negocio ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir mayores cantidades de pan y así comercializarlos con el propósito de obtener ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to produce bread

loans.name: Desmond

texts.en: Mr. Desmond A. is a young man of 20 years with a strong entrepreneurial spirit.  He is not yet married and does not have any children because he wants to first be able to provide for his future family.  Desmond sells parts and tires for motorcycles, cars and farm equipment and has done very well for himself. A very motivated individual, he started his business when he was just 17 years old and has already received and paid back the largest loan in FECECAV Adèta’s history.  With this loan from Kiva, Desmond would like to continue growing his business by buying more parts to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more parts and tires for motorcycles, cars and farm equipment

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde, is a very happy and enterprising mother who has always been hard working and diligent; she was not able to complete higher studies because her parents did not have the economic resources to take on such a responsibility.

Since she married her husband Jerson, who is a chauffeur for an urban transportation company, Matilde buys and sells American clothing. At the start her business did not seem profitable because she was constantly failing, but now with the experience gained in this business she is pleased to get good results. Matilde now purchases her merchandise by bales in the city of La Paz- Bolivia and sells her merchandise in the cities of Puno, Cuzco and her hometown of Juliaca.

Thanks to the benefits she has received, she is now able to cover all her needs and offer her 2 beloved sons a better quality of life. Matilde’s wish is to increase the amount of her investment and use those earnings to finally build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde, es una madre alegre emprendedora que siempre demostró ser muy trabajadora y diligente, no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores porque sus padres no tenían recursos económicos suficientes para sumir esta gran responsabilidad.

Desde que contrajo matrimonio con Jerson quien trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte urbano decidió dedicarse a la compra y venta de ropas americanas, en un inicio este negocio no parecía ser muy rentable porque constantemente salía fracasando, pero ahora ya con la experiencia ganada en este negocio tiene la satisfacción de obtener buenos resultados.

Matilde, adquiere su mercadería por fardos en la ciudad de la Paz- Bolivia y los vende en las ciudades de Puno, Cuzco y su ciudad natal Juliaca, gracias a los benéficos que obtiene está logrando cubrir todas sus necesidades y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 queridos hijos.El deseo de Matilde es aumentar su monto de inversión y con las ganancias que obtenga podrá finalmente construir su domicilio.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer more clothing options.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hiểu, from a traditional farming family, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She and her husband discuss about using funds from the loans to invest in raising livestock. The economy improves gradually and the facility is also expands. Children are well in their education. Her husband works as a laborer, brings home 2,000,000 VND a month. Income from her livestock is about 4,000,000 VND a year. She is applying for a loan of 9,000,000 VND to by breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, chị Phạm Thị Hiểu xuất phát từ gia đình nhà nông đến khi lấy chồng, gia đình chị thu nhập chủ yếu trông vào nông nghiệp. Thấy rằng việc tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn và phát triển kinh tế, anh chị đã bàn bạc tham gia Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà, cá, với việc chăn nuôi đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, trải qua từng vòng vốn mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày được mở rộng hơn, ngoài ra chồng chị thường đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000đ/ tháng. 2 con của anh chị vẫn được ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị bàn bạc và xin vay 9.000.000đ mua lợn giống . Thu nhập bình quân từ chăn nuôi lợn, gà, cá 4.000.000đ/ năm

loans.use: buy breeding pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is 28 years old, completed only the first year of high school, is the mother of 3 children (2 boys, 1girl), who are attending primary school and depend on her and her husband. The family lives in the populated center of Mulla Contiheuco, Juli disctrict, Chucuito province and Puno region.

She and her husband embroider rugs, an activity Elvira began when she was 12 years old, thanks to her father who taught her. Her husband learned to embroider from her. Because they did not have enough money to purchase material, she decided to join the community bank, Las Kantuta of Wilkauta. After receiving a loan of $115, with which she acquired wool material for 3 panoramas and 3 kilograms of colored wool, she was able to increase her capital and her income.

With this loan of $450, which will be returned in 4 months, she will purchase 10 kilograms of colored wool and 60 meters of material. She is very happy, now that she is increasing her production of embroidery, as well as her capital to cover the costs of feeding and educating her children. Her biggest dream is to have enough capital to be an industrial Artisan and that her children be professionals.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elvira tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta primero de secundaria es madre de 3 tres hijos (dos hijos y una hija), los cuales están cursando educación primaria que aun dependen de ella y de su esposo, viven en el Centro Poblado de Mulla Contihueco, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito y región de Puno. Ella y su esposo se dedican al Bordado de Bayetilla, esta actividad emprendió desde los 12 años de edad gracias a su padre quien la enseñó y su pareja aprendió de ella y por falta de dinero para comprar tela de Bayeta, ella decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta, con fin de acceder al préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con ella adquirió Bayeta de lanilla para 3 panoramas y tres kilos de lana de colores, con ello incremento su capital y ingreso económico. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 10 kilos de lanas de colores y 60 metros de bayeta. Ella esta muy contenta, ya que sigue incrementando su producción de Bordado y su capital para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Su sueño principal es tener mas capital para ser empresaria de artesanía y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of wool in bulk

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim S., 30, works in the local garment factory, while her husband, Nov Dout, works out of their home as a mechanic. They live in Phnom Penh and support their two children who are in the local school. Working at a garment factory, Sim S. makes US$3 each day, while her husband makes US$3.50 every day in his mechanic shop.

Sim S. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to make two investments. First, she would like to purchase some tools and materials for her husband to start an ice cream business. He already knows how to make ice cream and could earn extra income by selling ice cream after work. With any leftover money, the family would like to repair their home. There are some areas of their home that are in definite need of repair and the family lacks the capital necessary to complete some of these projects.

Sim S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Nov Dout, is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream-making materials; Repair home

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
Silvino tiene 33 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años. 
Es ganadero, desde pequeño aprendió a pastear a los animales y sobre todo cuidarlos, ahora de casado está pendiente de que su actividad como ganadero sea la mejor, ahora trata de invertir el mayor tiempo posible en su ganado, por ello, trata de bañar y vacunar a sus animales,  lo cual es muy tedioso, porque solo hay un lugar donde bañar a los carneros y no es fácil llegar, pero sin duda, el resultado le agrada, poder ver a sus animales limpios y sanos es una gran satisfacción.
Silvino tiene en su familia, su mayor motivador de progreso en su actividad como agricultor.
Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado invertir en la compra de ganado de raza para mejorar la calidad de sus animales, lo que generará el incremento de sus ingresos y con ello la mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvino is 33 and lives with his wife and 2 children, who are 9 and 6.

He is a livestock farmer, which he has done since he was young when he learned to graze and care for animals. Now he is married and is devoted to making his work the best that he can. He tries to invest as much time as possible in his livestock. He tries to bathe and vaccinate his animals, which is very tedious, because there is only one place to bathe the rams and it's not easy to reach. But without a doubt, the results please him: to be able to see clean and healthy animals is a big source of satisfaction.

Silvino's family is his main source of motivation and progress in his activity as a farmer. He plans to invest the money that he is requesting in the purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality of his animals. He will then generate more income, and with it, improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a good breed of livestock to improve the quality and selling price of his animals

loans.name: Oneone

texts.en: Oneone M., 42, is married with three children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation of taro taamu and  banana business. She sells to the village people and public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Oneone's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy farming equipment, chemicals, pesticides and seedlings for the plantation. Her husband and children will support her business.

loans.use: Oneone would like to purchase farming equipment, chemicals, pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Dezilanta's Group

texts.en: N. Dezilanta is a proud member of Kiwamirembe Women’s Group in Kigombya. She is married with 3 children and has a business selling maize and chicken mash for the poultry farmers in her locality. She also keeps around 300 egg-laying chicks and a few broilers at home to service her own customers. She is one of the founding members of her group and she started up this business after being a farmer. She is grateful for the loans from Pearl Microfinance because without them, her life and that of her family would be doomed. She is asking for another loan from Kiva through Pearl to enable her to buy and stock more maize, shells and mash for sale. In the photo, she is with N. Flo. During her free time, she makes some mats for sale and this brings in more income for her.

loans.use: Buy and stock more maize, shells and mash for her chicks and for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Mang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth M. is the Village Bank President of ten people who all live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province; all the members will use the loan for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Sareth M. is requesting the loan to buy rice seeds since she currently has an insufficient amount to cultivate rice, and she also hopes to increase her rice revenue to better support the family with this loan.

Sareth is the 53 year-old mother of five children, three of whom are employed in different business activities while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Keo Phal, is a village chief who makes a small salary that helps to support the household.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: dame H. Céline est née le 13 mars 1965 à sèmè podji, mariée à monsieur HOUSSA Simon, un retraité de l'armée béninoise. Elle est  mére de 04 enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Pour couvrir les dépenses de la famille elle a crée cet commerce de vente de poissons fumés. Les charges de la famille devenant de plus en plus lourdes à cause du niveau d'étude de ses enfants elle a associé à son commerce la vente  de mais et de farine de manioc puis la location de pousse pousse. Etant dans le manque de financement elle a fait reccours à notre institution.
texts.en:
Mr. Celine H. was born the 13th of March, 1965 at Seme Podji and is married to Mr. Simon Houssa who is retired from the Beninese army. She is the mother and responsible for 4 children, all of which attend school. To meet the family expenses she started a business selling smoked fish. As family expenses became heavier due to the children's higher education, she enlarged her business to include the sale of corn and manioc flour and the rental of push carts. Aware that she required additional financing, she has come to our institution (Alidé microfinance bank)

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 cartons of fish, 6 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of manioc flour

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desde hace 5 años, cultiva principalmente papa y alfalfa, la cual sirve para alimentar a los animales de granja, después de 6 meses de espera, cosecha y lleva sus productos al mercado principal de su ciudad para venderlos. Continuar trabajando en esta actividad que le permite atender a sus pequeños hijos, además, considera que este trabajo le ha dado buenos frutos, los que ayudaron a la economía de su hogar, aunque muchas veces los factores climáticos son un riesgo para una buena cosecha, pero Gladys continua tomando como mayor alternativa el cultivo de alfalfa para las próximas siembras. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad y mucha responsabilidad en los pagos y compromisos que requiere el trabajo en equipo de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de 5 sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra, valorizada la bolsa de 50 kilos en 200 soles.
texts.en:
Gladys is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has worked in agriculture for the past five years, primarily cultivating potatoes and alfalfa, which is used to feed farm animals. After a six-month wait, she brings in the harvest and takes her products to her town’s main market to sell. Continuing to work at this endeavor, which permits her to look after her two young children, Gladys also believes that this work has yielded good results for her, helping out with household expenses. However, many times the weather poses a risk to the harvest, so Gladys continues to plant alfalfa as a backup. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has been punctual and shown a lot of responsibility with regard to the payments and promises required when working as part of a bancomunal team. (A bancomunal or banco comunal is a business support group.) The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of five sacks of fertilizer for the next round of planting. Each 50-kilogram bag costs 200 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang P., 28, lives with his wife and his mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He married in 2007.

Samnang has been a farmer for 15 years. He grows many types of vegetables and other crops in his farmland near his village. His wife is a silk weaver. Beside farming, he also weaves silk at home. It’s a skill he learned from his wife. He sells his finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

Samnang is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving business

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
T. is 40 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. He has three children: two of them are single and under his care, and the other one is married and lives separately. He is married to Cheng Ieng, 37, who plants bananas and watermelons.

T. is a local farmer working with his wife in the field. He is a responsible father and neighbor. He has earned a better living by selling his products to customers who buy the bananas and watermelon in bulk. T. can plant four times a year and he can earn around US$ 200 each time. He has one small truck for his business. He wants to increase his business income with his available space of land. T. is looking for a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more banana and watermelon seeds for his field and to repair his truck. The loan will help improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy more banana and watermelon seeds for his field and to repair his truck

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva M. owns a small fishing boat. She is a 58 years old woman who fishes. Minerva has seven children who also help her fishing business. They are fishermen in their village. They spent their lives in the sea. Fish is what they use to feed and clothe their family.

Aside from fish selling, she grows seaweed. Her husband, Felix is the one who manages their farm. They work hard to provide for the needs and their children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. Minerva will use the loan to purchase a new pump boat. The loan will help them work as fishermen and seaweed farmers.

CEVI gives Minerva access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help her small business grow.

loans.use: Purchase a new pump boat.

loans.name: Safiou

texts.fr: Monsieur D. est soudeur, il a ouvert son atelier en 2003.  Les matériaux de travail dont il dispose actuellement sont vétustes et ne lui permettent pas d’exécuter correctement les commandes de ses clients. Il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 5 feuilles de tôle, 4 paquets de baguettes, 5 tubes, et autres matériels de soudure.  Monsieur D. habite a Agoe, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a welder who opened his workshop in 2003. The implements that he presently has at his disposal are worn out and do not allow him to prepare his customers' orders correctly. He is requesting his first loan to buy 5 sheets of corrugated iron, 4 packets of baguettes, 5 tubes, and other welding material. Mr. D. lives in Agoe, a district in the north of Lomé, the capital of Togo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of material for his welding business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
CONSUELO C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” vive en Asentamiento Humano 4 de junio. del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 53 años de edad y 1 hijo.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de desayunos, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para cocinar y vender, para poder mostrarlos, cuenta con clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos a los trabajadores de los aserraderos, dado que ellos madrugan.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos, también comprará gas y vasos.

“Si no fuese por Manuela Ramos no tendría el negocio dado que recurrí a muchas entidades financieras pero la cantidad de requisitos no me permitieron dar el crédito, por ello estoy muy agradecida por esta oportunidad
texts.en:
CONSUELO C. R. is a member of the “Las Estrellitas de Pucallpa” Microfinance Institute. She is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa and has one son.

She started her own breakfast sales business. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased goods to prepare and sell. She has a steady clientele, and her business has been growing.

She currently sells breakfast to the local sawmill workers, who have to get up very early in the morning.

She will invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing food to prepare her meals. She will also purchase gas and cups. “If it weren’t for Manuela Ramos, I would not have this business given that I went to many financial institutes but was not given a loan because of all the requirements. For this reason, I am very grateful for having been given this opportunity.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions, cups and natural gas

loans.name: John

texts.en: John M. sells lobsters in Cape Coast. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. John has been transporting and selling lobsters since 2004. He is also a taxi driver. He is responsible for paying for school fees, food, and utilities. He will use this loan to buy lobsters from Tema to fry and sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to provide quality education to his children.

loans.use: To buy lobsters from Tema to fry and sell.

loans.name: Irma Rogelia

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Irma es casada , tiene 59 años, 6 hijos , la ultima tiene 15 años y esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Irma   trabajo  25 años enseñando en el colegio fe y alegría, también se puso a vender fruta por saco en el mercado,  con el tiempo decidió poner una librería bazar en el mercado, puesto alquilado.    
Desde que esta en Finca, valora su trabajo, la mujer debe valorarse ganarse el pan diariamente con honradez.  
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de ropa interior, buzo, medias. Panty. 
 El sueño de Irma es Irma que su hija terminen sus estudios y surga.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano. She is married, is 59, and has 6 children. Her youngest daughter is 15 and goes to public school. Irma worked for 25 years teaching in a school called "Fe y alegría." She also sold fruit by the bag in a market. With time, she decided to start a book store and bazaar in the market in a rented stand. Since she has worked with Finca, she has valued her work.
