Women should value themselves to earn an income with honor. She needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase underwear, sweaters, and socks. Irma's dream is to see her daughter finish her education and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irma needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to buy underwear, sweaters, and socks.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida C. is from the village of Danao. She is 33 years old. Aida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Aida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Aida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: La señora Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.Su impulso  y empeño D. ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Con las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico D. su familia. Es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque; ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Yrmita, como le dicen D. cariño, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad D. salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Yrma belongs to the Communal Bank “Esmeralda”, in the District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 50 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her. Her desire and determination to see her children become professionals have motivated her to start her own business in the sale of groceries; this business is located in her own house, which provides a very well equipped environment in which to attend to her clients. The earnings that she generates help with her family’s income. She is very loved by her clients that daily seek her small store to do their shopping because she is stocked with all the products that a homemaker needs and she also attends to them with the charisma that she is known for. With this loan of 1,800 PEN she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, noodles in packages, milk, and fish preserves from a variety of brands in boxes, eggs, and personal hygiene products, to be able to continue offering great service to her clients. Yrmita, which is how she is referred to by her loved ones, feels very strong as she continues working. Day to day she is thankful for her life which has given her the great opportunity to get ahead as a women; she also thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her become an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase more groceries to increase her stock.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Mwande borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 41 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 26 and 16 years. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Joyce started her own business selling clothes 10 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian Shillings (about $150 US).

This is Joyce’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 350,000 shillings in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Villa Asención Group 6

texts.en:
Jaquelin P. is the group coordinator of Villa Asencion Group 6 and has been a valued associate of the Esperanza organization for over 5 loan cycles. She has over six years of experience in her business of selling clothing shoes and cosmetic products. Jaquelin lives in the Villa Asencion neighborhood outside of Puerto Plata with her three children and her husband. In this neighborhood electricity comes only several hours a week and water is gathered from the river.

Jaquelin intends to use this loan to buy more working capital for her business. Specifically she will purchase 5 pairs of pants, 12 pairs of shoes and $55 worth of cosmetics. This she believes will help her continue to grow her business in the future and improve the lives of herself and her children. Something which she feels working with Esperanza has helped her do in the past and that she expects will continue in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing, shoes and creams to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, a 23-year-old woman, is married and the mother of a 4-year-old child. She started her own clothing business selling used clothes two years ago. Rehema works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

Rehema is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. This is Rehema's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes to sell. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rehema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: A mother of 4 children, 30-year-old Marichu S. has been married for 12 years to Somy S.. She farms a hectare of rice field in Agusan Del Sur. She is about to harvest her farm but still needs additional farm inputs. She joined CEVI and applied for Php 6,000. The loan will be used to buy farm inputs. Marichu is satisfied with the low interest rate.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion C. is 68-year-old owner of a store that sells ready to wear goods such as T-shirts, pants, shorts, and other related items. This business was started through a loan she got through her membership in ASHI nine years ago. Asuncion has been through a lot of tribulations in sustaining her business and supporting her family needs. Loans she has availed through ASHI then until now became her means to overcome diversities in life including those of her business. Giving up was not the option she had in her mind instead she continuously requests for a much bigger amount of loan to be able to sustain the growth of her business. Presently she requests of a loan which she will going to use to pay for the inventory of good she will purchase for her business. 

Considering her age and her husband’s age that is 70, Asuncion hoped that as soon as her business is well established and sustainable, she will employ people to work with them so that she will have time for herself and her husband.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for the goods she will going to sell.

loans.name: Temitayo

texts.en: Temitayo is 29 years old and single. He sells shoes at the market and has been in business for the past five years. He is hoping for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more shoes to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata F. est une ancienne sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye .C’est une dame de 45 ans qui habite a Wakhinane a Guediawaye.Son mari est menuisier et elle est mère de six enfants dont l’âge varie entre huit et vingt sept ans. Concernant son activité, elle est orientée dans le domaine du commerce. Elle a commence a fréquenté  le marche DIOLA avec l’ancien bateau LE JOOLA ou elle achetait des poissons séchés  des balais et de l’huile de palme. Cependant  elle a opte pour la diversification de son commerce. Ainsi  selon la période  elle se lance aussi dans la vente de tissus de thiouraye ,de parfums pour homme, de déodorants  de chambre. Elle emprunte 100 000 frs. L’objet de son crédit est l’achat d’huile de palme, de balais et de thiouraye pour renouveler son stock. Les profits tires de son activité  lui permettent d’être  indépendante   de son mari et de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants. Elle est très  habituée a son commerce et sa deuxième  attente est de renforcer son épargne. Son souhait est de pouvoir voyager dans le futur pour acheter des marchandises maximiser ses  bénéfices  et parvenir a avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Aminata F. is a former associate of the Gapes Laye communal bank. she is a lady of 45 years that lives in Wakhinane a Guediawaye. Her husband is a carpenter. She is the mother of six children , whose ages vary between eight and twenty seven years. Concerning his activity, she is dedicated to sales. She began frequenting the DIOLA market with the old boat THE JOOLA, where she bought dried fish, straw and palm oil. Consequently she has choosen to diversify her business. Over time she has added the sale of thiouraye (a special perfume), perfumes for men, and room deodorizer. She would like to borrow 100,000 frs. The purpose of this loan is to buy palm oil, straw and thiouraye to renew her stock. The profits earned from this activity allow her to be independent of her husband and to satisfy the needs of her children. She is very experienced at her business and her second hope is to grow her savings. In the future, she hopes to be able to travel to buy the merchandise, maximize her profits and be able to have her own house.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy straw, palm oil and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Mercedes Ramona

texts.en: Mercedes is a teacher, but her business is the sale of gasoline and diesel fuel. The business began as a way to augment her income because she could not maintain her household on a teacher’s salary. Mercedes will use this loan to buy more fuel at a low price. Her loan will help her family to live a little more comfortably. She is married and has two children, ages 24 and 22. The 22-year-old is in her third year of university. Mercedes' hopes for the future include her daughter finishing her education and gaining more clients for her business. She reports that transportation is always a challenge.

loans.use: To buy more fuel

loans.name: Tchamélé

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 05 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé. Elle a ouvert un débit de boissons qu’elle a appelé « Ets ADAKA », elle a ouvert cet atelier depuis 2002. Son stock de boisson a connu une baisse, elle souhaiterai se réapprovisionner et demande à WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 30 casiers de bière et 20 casiers de sucrerie. Avec ce stock, elle compte réaliser un excellent chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
This is a lady who is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé district. She opened a beverages outlet that she called "Ets ADAKA". She opened this shop in 2002. Her stock of drinks has experience a drop. She would like to stock up again and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 cases of beer and 20 cases of soft drinks. With this loan, she expects to have excellent sales figures.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Madame K. is married, but has no children. In order to help her husband with their daily expenses, she began selling fabric in 2007. This year, she requested her first loan from WAGES in the hopes of benefiting from the holiday season and maximizing her returns. With this money she hopes to increase her profits by buying 20 PHOENIX brand and 35 HI-TARGET brand lengths of cloth.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric to sell

loans.name: Vine Group

texts.en:
James, who works as a trader, is 41, married, and the father of three. All his children are in school. He is a very resourceful father in caring for his children. He supports them through the sale of used shoes. Used shoes are a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Moreover, second-hand shoes are seen as having quality and durability compared to new ones found in stores. 

Therefore selling of used shoes has created market for many Ghanaians like James. He takes his stock from Greater Accra of Ghana and has been in business for four years now. He wants to use the loan to buy more shoes to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him to save more for his children’s education and also to rent a store to trade in.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Vine’. He is the only man in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders and food sellers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy used shoes in bulk

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de cigarros (al por mayor), los cuales reparte en las tiendas de las diferentes ciudades de su localidad. Diariamente se abastece de mercadería de una distribuidora muy grande en su región, de esa manera logra vender  su producto a un menor precio. 
Debido a la puntualidad de entrega tiene varios clientes estables, siendo su esposo quien se encarga de distribuir la mercadería y Leticia de administrar las ganancias.
Para el futuro, desea crecer hasta lograr ser una de las más grandes distribuidoras de su localidad.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, y lo que más aprecia de su banco comunal es que aprendió el valor del ahorro y el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra más de cajas de cigarro para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Leticia, 32, lives with her husband and their son in her parents’ house. She has been selling cigarettes (wholesale) for five years. She distributes them to stores in the different cities of her area. Everyday she stocks up on merchandise from a very large distributor in her region. This way she is able to sell her product at a lower price. She has several regular customers because of the punctuality of delivery. Her husband is in charge of distributing the merchandise, and Leticia administers the earnings. In the future she hopes to grow until she is one of the biggest distributors in her area. This is her seventh opportunity of having a loan with MFP. What she appreciates the most about her communal bank is that she learned the value of savings and working as a team. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy more cases of cigarettes to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
D. Chu Thị (20209050056) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


D. is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, D. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  D. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (20209050057) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Đệ (20209050058) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Chu Thị Thắm (20209050059) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Bé (20209050060) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Chu Thị Thủy (20209050061) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D.  Chu Thị (20209050056) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  D.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D.  kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, D.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng xây chuồng cho gia súc của người vay.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (20209050057) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Đệ (20209050058) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Chu Thị Thắm (20209050059) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Bé (20209050060) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Chu Thị Thủy (20209050061) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sew and for resale

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es:
El Señor Waldo esta casado y tiene 2 hijos,  se dedica a la venta de Sneakers y calzados desde hace tres años, tambien su esposa se dedica al comercio de ropa, ambos lograron construir su  casa propia. El señor esta en su segundo ciclo, y el credito que saco es para aumentar mercaderia a su tienda, el ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos con la Institucion. es una pareja que trabaja todos los dias en la actividad de venta de ropa y zapatos.

Uno de los deseos del Sr. Waldo es de ver a sus hijos profesionales esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la Cofianza brindada en otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Waldo is married and has two children. He has been selling sneakers and footwear for three years. His wife is also a clothing merchant and they both were able to build their own home.

Waldo is in his second loan cycle and this loan will be used to increase the merchandise in his store. He has demonstrated to our Institution that he is responsible with his payments. Waldo works every day at his business of selling clothing and shoes. One of his wishes is to see his children become professionals. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sports shoes (sneakers)

loans.name: Good Samaritan Group

texts.en:
Sia F. is the leader of a group five borrowers called Good Samaritan. She is 49 years old and married with four children aged 13 to 36 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 20 years, Sia has been selling building materials at the Johnson Compound in Paynesville, a town on the outskirts of Liberia's capital, Monrovia. She sells standard commodities and says she has a good relationship with customers, which keeps them returning. Sia started selling with 500 Liberian dollars (about $8 USD at today's exchange rate) as working capital, and her business at the time was selling peanuts.

She faces challenges in transporting goods to market and faces stiff competition from competitors.  She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 62,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase additional building materials for her business. Her goal is to grow, be prosperous and get a good standard of living. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sia is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Prepare and sell cornmeal mush

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa trajeamos en quechua.
Dina es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Dina junto a us esposo se dedican a la venta de materiales de construcción, sus ventas los realiza en su local y también reparte a domicilio.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de agregados.
Los sueños de Dina son ampliar su casa, comprar mas carros.
texts.en:
Dina is a memember of the Llamkasum Community Bank. Llamkasum means 'We Clothe' in Quechua. Dina is married, 32 years old, and has 2 children. Dina and her husband work selling construction materials from their store and they also deliver to homes. Dina needs a loan of 2,100 soles to buy aggregates. Dina's dreams are to add on to her house and to buy more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aggregates

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
António M. nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 10, 06 e 03 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Frequenta o 4° ano do ensino superior, a esposa também continua estudando. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane com a sua mãe ainda muito novo e acabaram fixando sua residência neste Distrito. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 10 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.886.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, blocos, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar uma actividade comercial e concluir a sua casa oferecendo melhores condições de habitabilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Antonio M. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children 10, 6 and 3 years old. The two older children attend school. Antonio is currently studying to finish the 4th year of college and his wife is finishing her studies as well. He lives with his family in their own house and doesn’t help support anyone else financially. He left Manhiça for the district of Boane with his mother when he was still a young child, and they ended up staying in that area. He has worked for more than 10 years for the Ministry of Education as a teacher. He doesn’t employ any help and has a monthly salary of 5886 Meticais. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some each month in his bank account. Antonio has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through colleagues who also work with the institution. This is his 2nd loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy construction materials (cement, bars, blocks, iron and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of his home. His earlier loan was for 10,000 Meticais and was used for the same purpose. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later.. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to start a business and finish his house, in order to offer his family better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, nails and other items)

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel A. is from the village of Sabacan, Panadtalan Mar. Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Jecel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jecel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jecel has been in business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jecel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jecel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jecel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jecel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jingo

texts.en:
Jingo A. is married and has six children, all of whom are currently in school. In addition, she takes care of two other family members. She rents and resides in a one-room house, though her family has no access to electricity and piped water.

To earn a living, she sells charcoal at her home in Nalukolongo, Lubaga Division, Kampala District. To do so, she uses public transportation to get to and from the villages of Luwero district, where she purchases her charcoal. She explains that she sells charcoal seven days a week to all kinds of customers (i.e., both retail and wholesale), and that her customers are all local people. She has been in this line of business for 15 years.

She is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her business challenges include transportation costs and the rainy season. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees and the rent for her home.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, sandwich ingredients, and snack foods

loans.name: Barot

texts.en:
Barot is 47 years old and married with 4 children. His business is a convenience store, which he has run for the past 12 years and which he started with his own money and with some loans. His two sons are independent and have their own business. This is his first loan and with this loan, Barot wants to buy foodstuff and a cooler so he can buy more meat and dairy products and offer fresh foods to his customers, and to be able to sell more and have better earnings. His future plans are to make improvements to the store and to improve his living conditions. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and cooler to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
La Señora María de Pilar S. es socia del banco comunal Prosperidad, vive por el Sector de la Ciudadela Católica en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es reconocida por los  4 ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico que fue nombrado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía, y su gente amable y cordial hacen que esta ciudad sea única.

Nuestra socia tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 25, 23 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son profesionales, la una es doctora en bioquímica y la otra es doctora en medicina general, su tercera hija estudia en la universidad y su último hijo en el colegio, su esposo es empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora María del Pilar es profesora en un colegio fiscal en donde dicta la materia de estudios sociales, es maestra hace 20 años, también tiene un bazar ( tienda en general) hace 6 años y ha iniciado este negocio con su primer crédito que  realizó en la fundación, es nuestra socia hace 6 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado tanto nivel personal como en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de bisutería y su meta es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María del Pilar S. is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) communal bank. She lives in the Ciudadela Católica section of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is known for the 4 rivers that run nearby, and its historic city center has been named a World Heritage site. Its gastronomy and friendly and kind people make the city unique. She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children - 26, 25, 23 and 11 years old. The first two daughters are professionals - one is a doctor in biochemistry and the other a doctor of general medicine. Her third daughter goes to univeristy and the last son is in school. Her husband is an employee. They do not have their own home but rent the one they live in. María del Pilar teaches social studies at a public school. She has been a teacher for 20 years and also has had a general store for 6 years. She started this business with the first loan she received and has been a member for 6 years. All of her loans have been for personal use as well as for her business. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of jewelry and her goal is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell in her store.

loans.name: Las Cazuelitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Cazuelitas esta ubicado en Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 7 integrantes que se conocen y se dedican a la alfarería realizan artículos de barro como san cazuelas, ollas, jarros, macetas, figuras de barro para ornatos.
Los integrantes del grupo son: Guadalupe Calixta M. C. y va a comprar con su préstamo ollas, macetas, para surtir su negocio, la señora Silvina Lilia C. Guzmán va a comprar ollas y figuras por bulto para surtir su negocio, la señorita Verónica Aragón C. va a comprar cazuelas, ollas, figuras por bulto para surtir su negocio, La señora Aurora Gómez Domínguez va a comprar barro, greta y leña para elaborar las cazuelas, la señora Escolástica M. M. va a comprar barro, leña, celite, greta y pintura para elaborar sus cazuelas, la señora Gabina T. M. va a comprar barro, greta, leña, para elaborar sus cazuelas, la señora Leonor C. Marín va a comprar barro, leña, greta, celite, pintura, tierra blanca para elaborar sus cazuelas.
La señora Guadalupe Calixta M. C. es la representante del grupo tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijas que estudian y trabajan en la alfarería con su mamá, ellas son Rosalía tiene 23 años y esta estudiando en la universidad de Puebla, Claudia tiene 15 años y estudia el bachillerato, Reyna tiene 12 años y estudia la secundaria, Elizabeth tiene 10 años y estudia la primaria, todas sus hijas le ayudan a trabajar elaborando sus productos de barro. La señora Guadalupe Calixta estudio la secundaria. Este es su primer préstamo con Fundación Realidad y lo solicito para invertir en las artesanías o alfarería, va a comprar ollas, macetas para surtir su negocio, también va a comprar barro, leña greta para elaborar sus cazuelas, ollas y jarros. Ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, sus papás le enseñaron a trabajar el barro desde niña, le llamaba la atención que su mama trabajaba y ahora la necesidad para el sostener a su familia la orillo a invirtir en el negocio que su mamá le habia enseñado; todo ésto para cubrir con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijas y de la casa. Los productos que ofrece a sus clientes son cazuelas, ollas, jarros, macetas, pedestales, jarrones, figuras de barro y todo tipo de productos de barro, los clientes que llegan a comprar las artesanías son de varias partes de la republica, del Estado de México, Puebla, Tampico, Veracruz, Morelos para ella es importante su negocio porque es el bienestar de la familia, y lo que mas le gusta de trabajar en la alfarería es cuando se vende y se recibe el dinero,  le da gran satisfacción cuando se sacan del horno los productos y están muy bonitas las cazuela, las ollas bien brillositas. Las ganancias las utiliza para seguir invirtiendo y para los gastos de su casa, para los estudios de sus hijas. Sus esperanzas es tener salud para seguir trabajando y que siga prosperando el negocio y Dios quiera que se gradúen sus hijas que logren su carrera.
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Que nos bajen la taza de interés, que nos sigan prestando y que tengan confianza en nosotros porque si cumplimos y si bajan la taza de interés les prometemos reunir más gente”. En el negocio de la alfarería se enfrenta el problema del clima se moja la leña y el horno hay veces que falla la orneada la greta se cae y salen las casuelas verdes y tienen que repetir el proceso le ponen mas greta para que salgan brillosas.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Cazuelitas (The Little Casseroles). It is located in Barrio San Pedro, Actopan in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The group is composed of 7 members that know each other and work in pottery creating articles of clay such as cooking pots, jars, flower pots, and decorative clay figures. The members of the group are going to use the loan in the following ways. Guadalupe Calixta M. C. is going to buy pots and flower pots to supply her business. Señora Silvina Lilia C. Guzmán is going to buy pots and figures in bulk go supply her business. Señorita Verónica Aragón C. is going to buy casserole dishes, pots, and figures in bulk to supply her business. Señora Aurora Gómez Domínguez is going to buy clay, glaze, and firewood to make various articles. Señora Escolástica M. M. is going to buy clay, firewood, glaze, and celite (a type of clay), and paint to make her items. Señora Leonor C. Marín is going to buy clay, firewood, glaze, celite, paint, and white earth to make her pots Señora Guadalupe Calixta M. C. is the representative of the group. She is 41 years old and has 4 daughters who study and work in pottery with their mother. They are Rosalia, 23, who studies at the university of Puebla; Claudia, 15, who studies in high school; Reyna, 12, who is in secondary school; and Elizabeth, 10, who is in primary school. All of her daughters help her work, creating the clay products. Señora Guadalupe Calixta studied in secondary school and got her certificate. This is her first loan with Fundación Realidad and she is seeking it to invest in crafts and pottery and plans to buy jars and flower pots to supply her business. She also plans to buy clay and firewood to create casseroles, pots, and jars. She began her business ten years ago. Her parents taught her to work the clay when she was a girl. She noticed that her mother worked and thought 'why not me?' Now she works from necessity for the support of her family, to continue investing, for the studies of her daughters, and the household expenses. The products she offers her clients are casseroles, pots, jars, flower pots, pedestals, large jars, clay figures, and all type of clay products. The clients that come to buy the crafts are from various parts of the country - the State of Mexico, Puebla, Tampico, Veracruz, and Morelos. For her the business is important because it insures the well being of her family. The favorite part of the work in pottery is when she sells and recieves the money. It gives her great satisfaction when she takes the products out of the oven and the very lovely casseroles and pots are quite brilliant. Her earnings are used to continue investing and for the houshold expenses, and the studies of her daughters. Her hopes are to have health to continue working and that the business continues to prosper, and that, god willing, her daughters graduate and achieve their careers. The members of the group wish to say to Kiva and to the Fundación Realidad "Reduce the interest rate so you can continue loaning to us and have confidence in us because if we make the payments and if you lower the rate of interest we promise you to get together more clients." In the pottery business we face the problem of the weather which may cause the firewood to get wet and the kiln to cause a batch to fail as the glaze falls and the pots come out green and they have to repeat the process, putting on more glaze so they come out shining.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pots and flower pots to supply the business. Buy firewood, clay, and glaze to create their products.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa S., from the village of Mibantang, Quezon, Bukidnon, is 27 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Teresa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is from the village of Salucong. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen G. was born in 1976. He lives in Gandzakar village in the Ijevan area with his parents, his wife and his newborn baby. Vazgen is a policeman and, simultaneously with his permanent work, Vazgen engages in land cultivation, cattle breeding and swine breeding. He says cattle breeding is more profitable than land cultivation and swine breeding, thus thanks to profit from cattle-breeding, Vazgen solves most parts of his family’s needs. 

Vazgen asks for an 800.000 Armenian Dram loan to buy some calves for his farm and fodder for his farm animals. Vazgen is on his fifth loan cycle as a client with Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy some calves for his farm and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Francisco tiene más de 29 año de laborar como chofer en el MINSA de esta localidad.
Cuenta con su propia casa de habitación  la que piensa mejorar con el financiamiento otorgado por la institución. 
Esto le permitirá al cliente mejorar su casa de habitación y ofrecerle a su familia un lugar mejor.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco has spent 29 years working as a driver for the local MINSA office (Ministry of Health).

He has his own home, which he plans to make improvements to, with the financing he receives through the institution.  This will allow him to improve his home and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Cruz Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

Para la señora Cruz este es su noveno ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos y por las oportunidades que brinda la institución para sacar sus negocios adelante. Además es la fiscal de reglamento del Banco. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos niñas de 15 y dos años, la mayor esta en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja cuatro días a la semana por las tardes ya que su hija estudia en las mañanas y no hay quien atienda a su pequeña hija, cuando llega su hija del colegio ella aprovecha para ir a recoger los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes mes a mes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente.

Este crédito es para pagar uno de los pedidos que realizo en este mes ya que tiene que pagar por adelantado para recibir la mercadería. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijas y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Picoaza cooperative bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as a commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history that its mountain ranges encircle.

This is Cruz’s ninth cycle with the bank, and she appreciates the loans and the opportunities the institution provides to help get her business ahead.  In addition, she oversees the regulations for the bank.  She is 31 years old, married, and has two daughters ages 15 and two; the oldest is in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She sells Avon products (beauty products, perfumes, women’s accessories).  She works four days per week in the afternoons, as her older daughter is in school in the morning and she doesn’t have anyone to watch her youngest daughter.  Once her daughter gets home from school, she goes out to collect the monthly orders her customers make.  She delivers her products on credit, and collects payments on a weekly basis.

This loan is to pay for one of the orders she made this month, as she has to pay for products up front to receive the merchandise.  Her dreams are to provide a good education for her daughters, and to open her own store.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, perfumes, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn N., 52, is a farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She earns about $1.30 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chea Lounh, is a 53-year-old farmer who also makes about $1.30 a day. They have two children, one of whom is single while the other one is married and living away from home. In the past, Phorn N. bought a piece of land from her neighbor on credit, and she always paid her creditor every month. She wants to pay it off presently, but she doesn't have enough money to make it possible. To solve this problem, Phorn N. would like to request a loan to pay for the cost of the land she bought on credit.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of land which she bought on credit

loans.name: Dios Es Mi Pastor 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Yolene is one of the members of the Group Dios es mi pastor 4 & 5 (God is my shepherd), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. This city, like many others in the Dominican Republic, has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and is populated by Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Yolene sells clothes, such as blue jean, skirts, shirts, shoes, and t-shirts. With this new loan, she is planning to invest in clothing.

Yolene is very excited to receive her fifth loan from Esperanza International, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and thus having taken a step towards expanding her business. Her challenges are raising and educating her four children. She lives with them and her long-term partner. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business, since there will be a lot of demand for her products. Yolene's dream is to improve business.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin es un hombre trabajador, padre de dos hijos, casado. Hoy en día labora a una empresa privada desempeñándose en servicios de seguridad. Atreves de los préstamo ha venido construyendo su casa toda de concreto. El cual todos sus financiamientos han sido con el fin de poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
Con este nuevo préstamo, seguirá con el levantamiento de pared en algunas partes de la vivienda que le falta, para luego poder repellarla toda que lo hará a largo plazo ya que este es un gran avance en su vida como meta personal.
Comprara materiales como: arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín, clavos,  entre otros para seguir la obra.
texts.en:
Marvin is a hard-working man.  He is married and has two children.  He currently works in a private company as a security guard.  Through a series of  loans, he has been able to build his house entirely from concrete.  All of his loans have been taken out with the goal of having a decent house for his family to live in.

Marvin will use this new loan to continue building walls in some parts of his home that still need them so that he can later plaster the whole house.  He will do that in the long term.  This is a great advance in his life and a personal goal.  He will buy materials such as sand, cement, iron, gravel, nails, etc. so that he can continue with the work.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish building his house from concrete.  He doesn't have much left to do which means he is very happy in his personal life.

loans.name: Mirla Lizeth

texts.es:
la señora Mirla Lizeth B. R. tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Martir R. Romero quien trabaja en una empacadora de San Lorenzo y juntos salen adelante con su hijo.
Mirla vive en la aldea El Comercio, en estos momentos esta montando una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tiene muy poco producto y es por esto que necesita el credito, va a comprar abarroteria para surtir un poco y empezar con su negocio, su meta es que para finales de este año tener bien establecida su pulperia en donde venda de todo y atender a los vecinos de su comunidad en todo lo ellos necesiten.
texts.en:
Mirla Lizeth B. R. is 25 years old and is married to Martir R. Romero, who works at a packing plant in San Lorenzo. Together, they get ahead with her son.

Mirla lives in the El Comercio village and at this time, she is setting up a grocery store in her house. She has few products and this is why she needs the loan. She will purchase groceries to start and stock her store a little. Her goal is at the end of this year, to have her grocery store well-established where she sells everything and tends to her neighbors in the community for whatever they need.

loans.use: Purchase of beans, rice, sugar, salt, coffee, bread, soap, cookies, drinks, churros

loans.name: Fanor Efren

texts.es:
El Senor Fanor Z., habita en la Comarca El Coyolito, esta casado, tien 6 hijos, con mas de 20 anos de expieriencia en las actividades agricolas.
Inicio con su Papa a muy corta edad, el recuerda que tenia aproximadamente unos 5 anos de edad cuando comenzo a trabajar con el, en todas las labores de la Finca. Al mismo tiempo estudiaba, algo que no fue nada facil, pues el colegio mas cercano estaba a unos 3 kms de su casa, pero no pudo terminar como el hubiese deseado, pues a penas llego a 6to grado de primaria.
Recuerda que a los 12 anos, sembro su primer manzana de Repollo
Luego con lo que fue recogiendo de sus cosechas, se caso y se independizo de sus padres, y compro un pequeno terreno, poco apoco fue haciendo su casita.
Se dedica actualmente un poco a la ganaderia y a la agricultura, con siembra de Granos Basicos y Hortalizas.
Su meta es lograr que sus hijos se preparen para que ellos puedan tener un nivel de vida mucho mejo que el.
Realizo este credito para la siembra de Repollo.
texts.en:
Fanor Z. lives in the El Coyolito region. He is married with six children and has more than 20 years of experience working in agriculture. He began working alongside his father at a vey young age. He remembers being around 5 years old when he began to help him with all the farm activities. At the same time Fanor was studying, which was not easy for him since his school was around three kilometeres from his home. He could not finish his schooling like he wanted to, leaving after Grade 6 of primary school.

Fanor remembers that at the age of 12 he sowed his first block of land with cabbage. Later, when he was able to support himself with his harvests, he married and moved out of his parents' home. He bought a small block of land and bit by bit he built a home. 

Fanor is currently breeding cattle and working in agriculture, sowing legumes and vegetables. His goal is to bring up his children to have a much better quality of life than his own. He will use this loan to sow cabbage.

loans.use: Sow vegetables and cabbage

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe es una persona seria, responsable, y sobre todo muy trabajadora ella esta separada de su esposo, tiene a su cargo a una niña para la que quiere  la mejor educación, la señora María necesita el dinero para poder arreglar un poco su casa ya que ella va a poner una barda y quiere mayor seguridad para su familia y para ella ya que se encuentra sola.
texts.en: María Guadalupe is a responsible and above all hardworking person. She and her husband are separated. She looks after their daughter, for whom she wants the best education. María needs the loan for home improvements, for example, to build a surrounding wall to provide greater security for her and her family.

loans.use: Construccion de  una  barda

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman who lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Salvador, Jr., who is 47 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 20 and 24 years old. Helen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Helen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,500 to purchase more stock for her sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for her children’s education and for better living conditions. Helen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida D. S. is from the town of District 1, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Florida is married and has nine school-aged children. 

To make a living, Florida owns and operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Florida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Наботова Мехринисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Мехринисо занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кроме того она занимается вышивкой разных рисунков и цветочек. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mehriniso N. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is in Russia. Mehriniso works sewing traditional dresses. She also embroiders different patterns and flowers. She has been doing this work for two years. She is taking out a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with four children living in her own semi permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband who is a herbalist and their goal is to work hard and build a permanent house to live in. Agnes sells clothes and has been in business for three year. Her initial capital was 300,000 shillings but she currently has working capital of 2,000,000 shillings and the business is still growing despite challenges in high tax and transport costs. Agnes wants the money to buy clothes as the easter season is fast approaching.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe PIMA ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles avec les frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux et résident dans la ville de BOUGOUNI, au quartier MASSABLACOURA dans la 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de mariages et de commerce. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs ressources financières afin de satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et les précédents ont été correctement soldés. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la petite restauration avec les fritures de patate douce, de farine de blé, de banane plantain et l’achat vente de céréales. Avec ce prêt Fatoumata M. compte acheter, 6 tonnes de maïs, 500 kg de fonio et 3 tonnes de petit mil. Les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI pour les revendre ensuite au comptant et en gros sur le marché de Bamako à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
All married, the woman of the PIMA group have an average age of 38, and 5 children. They live in traditional married families with brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands, and they live in the city of Bougouni, in the Massablacoura district in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 
They know each other through familial and business ties. In order to increase their financial resources to satisfy customer demand, they have decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan and their previous loans were all repaid in full. This group of women sells fried sweet potatoes, wheat flour, plantains, and buys and sells grain. 
With this loan, Fatoumata M. plans on buying 6 tons of corn, 500 kg of fonio, and 3 tons of millet. These products will be bought from suppliers in neighboring villages and then sold for cash and wholesale at the Bamako market to a client base made up of both men and women. With this loan, the women hope to each earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in their business.

loans.use: to buy grain.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto Antonio Gómez L. , tiene la edad de 29 años , habita en el comunidad loma Negras , en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar y se encarga de vender el producto cuanto este ya está en su estado de corte , don Roberto desde hace diez años trabaja al campo , durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que afectan al cultivo de mandarina , el crédito lo quiere para comprar exfoliantes e insumos necesarios para realizar aplicación  en todas las plantas y poder salvar la producción ya que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para realizar la comprar de fertilizantes .
texts.en: Roberto Antonio Gómez L. is 29 years old.  He lives in the Loma Negras community in the town of La Concepción with his wife, who supports him by taking care of the house and selling the produce once it is harvested. Don Roberto has been working in the fields for ten years.  During this time, his greatest difficulty has been the problem of infestations and illnesses that affect the cultivation of tangerines.  He wants the loan to buy fertilizer sprays and the supplies necessary to apply them to all the plants in order to be able to save the harvest, since he doesn't have sufficient capital to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Lhagvajargal

texts.en:
Lhagvajargal is a 49-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 10, goes to a secondary school. 

Lhagvajargal manages a grocery business at a local market. She started her business in 2007 and is planning to continue it in the future. She must work hard in order to stabilize her business because it is only source of income for her family.  Lhagvajargal is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Franklin Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 39 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo menor. La vida que lleva Lucio es muy tranquila debido a que la comunidad donde vive es una zona pequeña y rural. Esta comunidad pertenece al distrito de Picsi  en Chiclayo.

Lucio es un hombre trabajador y desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos y adobes. Es muy perfeccionista en su trabajo y esto contribuye a que cuente con clientes fijos que se inclinen por sus productos más que por los de la competencia.
 
Lucio le dedica bastante tiempo a su trabajo para obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida, la cual se vio  afectada con el “fenómeno del niño”. La vivienda de Lucio sufrió varios daños debido a las lluvias torrenciales ocasionadas por este fenómeno natural y es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitirá arreglar su vivienda.

Lucio planea reconstruir algunas paredes y arreglar el techo de su casa. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el préstamo pues estos arreglos le son sumamente necesarios.
texts.en:
Lucio is 39 years old, married and has a minor son.  The life Lucio leads is very calm because the community he lives in is a small, rural zone.  This community belongs to Picsi District in Chiclayo.

Lucio is a hard working man who has been manufacturing bricks and adobe blocks for five years.  He is quite the perfectionist in his work and this contributes to his having a regular base of customers who are inclined to his products over those of the competition.

Lucio puts a lot of time into his work to obtain profits that will allow him to improve his quality of life which was affected by the phenomenon of “El Niño.”  Lucio’s dwelling suffered much damage due to the torrential rains caused by this natural phenomenon and this is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to repair his house.

Lucio plans to rebuild some of the walls and to repair the roof.  He would be very grateful if the loan were granted because these repairs are extremely necessary.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married, with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional dependents. Grace owns a retail shop in Ndeeba. She has been in business for the last eight years and sells both retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Grace has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more stock for her retail shop and build her own shop. Grace lives in a house that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerry cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Vanessa es madre soltera, tiene 24 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres vanessa no tiene el apoyo del padre de si hija es por ello que decidió dedicarse a vender ropa, viene realizando esta labor por mas de 3 años, los desafios que enfrenta vanessa es tener que trabajar y estudiar para tener un mejor futuro para ella y su hija, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar mas mercadería ya que estamos en temporada de invierno, vanessa desea comprar chompas pantalones busos polares frasadas entre otros  para incrementar su negocio, vanessa como toda joven emprendedora tiene sueño uno de ellos es tener su casa propia y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, vanessa esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Vanessa is a single mother, 24 years old, who lives in her parents' house. Vanessa does not receive support from the father of her daughter, and thus she decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing. She has been doing this work for more than 3 years. The challenges Vanessa faces include having to work and study so that she can build a better future for herself and her daughter. The loan she is requesting is to buy more merchandise, since it is now the winter season. Vanessa wants to buy sweaters, pants, fleece jackets, and blankets, among other things, to expand her business. Like all young entrepreneurs, Vanessa has dreams, and one of them is to have her own house and provide a better quality of life for her daughter. Vanessa is very grateful for the support that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, such as sweaters, pants, coats, fleece jackets, and others.

loans.name: Margoin Yackeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margoin, ella tiene  40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y dos de 14 y 1 años de edad, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de productos lácteos tales como la deliciosa leche, queso, yogurt y mantequilla, productos que son muy consumidos por las familias manabitas, ellos venden por separado ya que  mientras él sale a entregar en su carro ella vende en su casa  a los clientes que dia a dia se acercan hasta su local, allí mismo  ella también vende bidones de agua lo cual lo realiza al mismo tiempo que vende sus otros productos, trabajan todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Los productos los compran en Portoviejo a comerciantes que entregan al por mayor, llevan seis años que se dedican a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar leche, queso, yogurt, mantequilla y bidones de agua. Lleva en el Grupo De Crédito ya más de tres años y le gusta porque los créditos sirven para impulsar los negocios.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local más grande en el centro de la  ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantities of tamarind fruit that are produced this time of year.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Margoin.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of her children are grown and the other two are aged 14 and 1.  They all live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.  

Together with her husband, Margoin sells delicious dairy products such as milk, cheese, yogurt, and butter.  These products are widely consumed by families in Manabí.  Margoin and her husband work separately.  While he is out making deliveries by car, she sells products at home to customers who come to her shop on a daily basis.  There she also sells barrels of water along with her other products.  Margoin works every day from 7am to 6pm.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo from wholesale merchants.  Margoin has been in business for six years.

This loan will be used to buy milk, cheese, yogurt, butter, and barrels of water.  She has been with the Communal Bank for more than three years and likes the fact that the loans were used to start her business.  Her dream is to have a larger shop in the central part of the city.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, yogurt, butter, and barrels of water.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. María eso socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia es muy visita por ser el balcón de la ciudad de donde se puede admirar gran parte de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora María tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 10, 8, 6, 3, 1 año y un bebé de 8 meses de edad, sus tres primeros hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María trabaja en un comedor desde 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y labora de lunes a sábados. En su casa se dedica a la cría pollos y cuyes que es para su consumo y para la venta.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de pollos y en su alimento para continuar con este negocio. 

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank named "Mujer y Fortaleza", meaning "Woman and Strength". She lives near the Parish of Turi. This Parrish is highly visited for being the lookout of the city. From here you can admire a large part of Cuenca. The people are dedicated to commerce, raising livestock, and to agriculture. They also carry out various businesses in the city. 

Maria is 30 years old, married, and the fruit of her relationship has been her 5 children, aged 10, 8, 6, 3, 1, and an 8-month old baby. Her three eldest children attend primary school in the city. Her husband works in the field of construction as a construction worker. The house in which they live is their own property.

Maria is employed at a restaurant from 8am until 5pm, working from Monday to Saturday. At home she raises poultry and guinea pigs for their own consumption and to sell. 

She has been with her communal bank for 3 years and her new loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry and their feed, to keep up this business.

Her goal is to finish building her house, as some finishes are still required.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: Aliya's Group

texts.en: Women entrepreneurs make a significant contribution in the development of the business sphere, both on a local and country level. Since the opening of the large retail and wholesale market Dordoy, thousands of entrepreneurs rushed for new opportunities to make money. Aliya, 27, is a leader of this group. For more than six years, she has been one of the 20,000 entrepreneurs who were employed in Dordoy. She sold clothing apparel and shoes. This experience has helped her obtain knowledge and skills about trade and communication with various types of clients. Recently, Aliya moved to her hometown Balykchi, where she bought a spot in a newly built market. The total start-up capital resulted in 10,000 soms. Aliya is divorced and has a 7-year-old daughter. Currently, she needs to buy necessary electronics for her home. For this purpose, she requests a loan from Kiva lenders. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Galamhuseyn
