texts.ru: Galamhuseyn 50 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Galamhuseyn uje 12 let kak rabotayet stroitelem. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya uludsheniya svoyey raboti. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek.
texts.en: Galamhuseyn is 50 years old.  He is married and has four children.  He lives in the Baku region together with his family.  Galamhuseyn has been working as a construction worker for 12 years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy necessary tools for improving his work.  He is a very hard-working person.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction tools

loans.name: Akouavi Jeanne

texts.fr:
Akouavi Jeanne est une femme  âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un électricien bâtiment. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Akouavi Jeanne travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2001. Elle vend à ses clients au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits au même lieu. 
Akouavi Jeanne a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
texts.en: Akouavi Jeanne is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a construction electrician and has two children. Akouavi Jeanne has worked as a retailer of traditional pagne cloth since 2001. She sells to her customers at the marketplace in Lomé, where she also purchases her wares. Akouavi Jeanne has requested her second WAGES loan in order to purchase traditional pagne cloth.

loans.use: to purchase traditional pagne cloth (Hitarget and Phoenix brands).

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Prossy is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Prossy has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells food and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food and charcoal for resale, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Prossy's future prospects by helping her to work hard at building her business.

loans.use: to buy food and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a focused businessman aged 45. He is married and blessed with six children. He has been welding to make a living. He is also employed. He has managed to improve his business with the business management skills he gained from the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine for his business.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en: Marialyn is 39 years old and lives in Conat Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Marialyn has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Marialyn has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Marialyn hopes to have a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es: Marciano tiene 42 años, es viudo pero tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Jose Olaya, Pangoa. Marciano, es un hombre con mucha visión de por medio. Desde que empezó y hasta ahora continúa ejerciendo la agrícultura, cultivando y comercialización cacao, y hasta el momento su margen de ventas va aumentando. Esto debido a la calidad de su producto y más cuando lo ofrece a un precio competitivo. Entonces para tener un productos de calidad, trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos, pero cuando es temporada de cosecha tiene que contratar peones, para que lo ayuden en la extracción de su producto. Siendo estos vendidos en el mercado de su propia localidad. Para el futuro, anhela tener su propio tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera percibiriá más ingresos y a la vez brindarle a sus hijos una calida de vida estable. Este será su primer credito con MFP por lo que Marciano se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles Marciano comprará abono para fertilizar su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Marciano, 42, is a widower and has two children.  They live together in his own house located in the community of José Olaya, Pangoa.  Marciano is a man with a clear vision.  Since starting in agriculture to date he’s been growing and selling cocoa beans and his profit margin has been increasing due to the quality of his product and even more so because of his competitive prices. 

In order to have quality products his children help him work but when it’s harvest time he has to hire day laborers to help him pick the beans which is then sold in his local market.  For the future, he hopes to have his own grocery store to earn higher income and at the same time provide his children with a stable quality of life.

This will be his first MFP loan and Marciano commits to make all his installment payments punctually.  Marciano will use the 2000 new soles to buy manure to fertilize his field.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra tiene una empresa de turismo y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para la ampliación y remodelación de los ambientes de su oficina. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Alto Sopocachi  de la ciudad de La Paz; Sandra es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su préstamo va vía Kiva y la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO.
texts.en: Sandra has a tourist agency and her husband is employed at a private firm.  She needs the loan to enlarge and remodel her office.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Sopocachi zone.  Sandra is married and has two children.  This is the first time that her loan is via Kiva and the fourth time she’s requested an IMPRO loan.

loans.use: to enlarge and remodel her tourist agency.

loans.name: Baljinyam

texts.en:
Mr. Baljinnyam is 31. He is a driver of minivan which he uses for transportation services in the different districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing this business since 2007. 

Before starting this business, he used to drive a taxi. He changed his work as it gave him less income. He lives with his family in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent which is located in the ger district. 

Lately his business income has dropped, mainly because his minivan has damage to its cabin and its parts. The satisfaction of his customers is at the core of his business, and it depends on the quality of his service. Therefore he has decided to make some changes to the cabin of his minivan and to its spare parts.

According his calculations, his earnings and the frequency of his service will increase after the renovation. 

The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing new spare parts and to renovating the cabin of his minivan to improve his service.

loans.use: to have a better transportation service by purchasing spare parts and renovating the cabin of his minivan.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 57 years old, married and thankful because he has been blessed with two children.  He has been a farmer for almost twenty years. He usually plants rice and raises hogs to sell.  His ambition in life is to improve the quality of living for his family.  Sometimes there are problems in his family, but through their strong determination, they survive.

Rodolfo wants to cultivate two hectares of farm land to plant more rice. But he lacks the necessary capital, thus he wants to borrow PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and corn seeds and to pay for the labour costs required to plant rice.  He believes that this loan will help him to make a growth in his business.  He is hoping that he will have a plenteous harvest to support his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and corn seeds and to pay for the labour costs required to plant rice.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has four children, the oldest of whom is 19 years old.

Elma has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for quite some time now. She sells various items like coffee, sugar, canned goods, soap and shampoo. Elma's income from the store helps buy her family's daily needs. She said that sometimes her store gets empty and she is left with no income, but she finds ways to get back on track again.

Elma has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo. She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Более 5 лет Исмоил занимается откармливанием скота. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Исмоил является владельцем бизнеса и имеет богатый опыт. Он начал свой бизнес с продажи сельхозкультур, затем постепенно перешел на продажу скота. На полученную прибыль он построил коровник, а теперь хочет добавить еще несколько голов скота, и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 4500 Сомони. Исмоил хочет закупить скот. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Ismoil has been fattening cattle for more than five years.  He is married and the responsible father of four children.  Ismoil is a business owner and has a wealth of experience. He started his business by selling crops, then gradually moved on to selling cattle.  With the profits already earned, Ismoil  has built a barn.  He would now like to acquire a few more head of cattle.  To this end, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,500 Somoni (TJS).  Ismoil wants to buy cattle.  He looks forward to your help and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Junisa

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Junisa.  He is married and has five children, ages 1, 3, 8, 12 and 15 years. 

In 1996, Junisa established his used clothing business. He was working in the mines and realized that life was becoming very difficult for him, as he was not able to get enough income to support his family. He then left the mines and settled down in Bo City with his family, where he established his used clothing business. This business helps him to get enough income to provide a livelihood for his family. 

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,700,000 every month from this business. Junisa has a very good loan repayment history. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. He requires a loan in order to purchase a bale of men’s shirts at Le 1,900,000 and two bales of men’s trousers costing Le 2,600,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 

In the future, Junisa plans to open another stall of used clothing for his wife and to educate his children to university level. The competition is low and his business is good as it is in the centre of town. His customers are mainly low income earners who cannot afford expensive clothes. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothes for his business.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 53 year-old widow with three sons and one daughter. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hanh established a grocery store in her local market thirteen years ago. She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her businessand purchase a greater variety and quantity of vegetables to sell. 

She hopes that the loan will help her earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety and quantity of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adolfo Arnoldo

texts.es:
Don Adolfo tiene 44 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mamá. Desde los 15 años de edad trabaja en la agricultura en fincas de café, cultivos frutales, entre otros, él trabaja muy fuerte para ayudar a su mamá y salir adelante.

Los abonos químicos que necesita para mantener los cultivos, los compra en la ciudad más cercana, para abordar el autobús que lo conduzca ahí, tiene que caminar a pie durante cuarenta y cinco minutos.

Don Adolfo solicita el financiamiento a Fundación Campo, para comprar 4 quintales de abono y follares para mantener el cultivo de plátanos que posee y la finca de café. 

Con la inversión aprovechara los recursos que posee, ya que cuenta con cultivos de plátanos, naranjas y finca de cafés, para abonarlas y que le produzcan una buena cosecha, para que sus ingresos sean mejores y brindarle lo necesario a su mamá ya que tiene una avanzada edad.

Don Adolfo tiene pensado construir una casa de ladrillo e instalar la energía eléctrica, además darle las mejores condiciones a su mamá.
texts.en:
Don Adolfo is 44 years old. He is single, and lives with his mom.  Since the age of 15, he has worked in agriculture in coffee plantations and with fruit crops among others.  He works very hard to support his mother and to move ahead in life.

He purchases the chemical fertilizers that he needs to maintain his crops in the nearest city.  In order to catch the bus that goes there, he has to walk 45 minutes.

Don Adolfo is requesting financing from Fundación Campo to purchase four quintales (about 400 lb total) of fertilizers and foliant insecticide to maintain his plantain crop and coffee plantation.  With the investment he will be able to take advantage of the resources that he possesses, as he has plantain and orange crops, and a coffee plantation.  He will be able to fertilize them and they will produce a good harvest, so that his income is better and he can provide his mom with what she needs as she is of an advanced age.

Don Adolfo has been thinking about building a stone house and installing electricity, and also providing better conditions for his mom.

loans.use: to purchase four quintales (about 400 lb total) of fertilizers and foliant insecticide to maintain his plantain crop and coffee plantation.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis mai 2010.Il est composé de membres qui habitent dans la même commune.Elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Khady qui est à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle âgée de 60ans,elle est mariée et mére de 02 enfants.

Elle pratique l'achat et la vente d'huile de palme,de fruits et de sucre.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter un bidon d'huile de palme pour une valeur de 50000f,03 sacs de sucre pour une valeur de 84000f et 05 bassines de fruits à 3500f la bassine.

Son objectif est d'aider ses 02 fils qui sont à l'université,augmenter son épargne et augmenter aussi son fonds de roulement.
texts.en: This group was created in May of 2010. Its members live in the same commune and are retailers. Khady, on the right of the picture and raising her arm, is the group leader. She is 60 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She buys and sells palm oil, fruit and sugar. She plans to use her loan to buy a drum of palm oil (for 50 000 francs), 3 bags of sugar (for 84 000 francs) and 5 containers of fruit (at 3 500 francs per container). Her goal is to help her 2 sons who are at university, to build her savings and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy 21 years old, supports a family of two members. She has been a small scale farmer for the last for years earning KES.10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to lease more land for farming and increase production. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity. Her future hopes are to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: To lease more land for farming and increase production.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned he can avail financial assistance for his chosen business. Elmer has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for his chosen business. Elmer wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina has had her business for 6 years now, and she started it because she had the need to help her husband with the children\\\'s education fees. She knew her husband earned a relatively low wage; however, Ernestina was presented with the opportunity to sell \\\" KITCHEN\\\" brand pans and \\\"EBEL\\\" products, and this has allowed her to offer her children an education and a better quality of life.

Today Ernestina needs a loan of $250 USD to purchase merchandise for this next Christmas season. She hopes her sales will increase as well as her income. She and her children need your help and support.

**

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina tiene 6 años con su negocio, lo inició ante la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los estudios de sus hijos, ella sabía que su esposo gana un salario relativamente bajo; sin embargo a Ernestina se le presentó la oportunidad de vender sartenes “KITCHEN” y productos “EBEL”, y esto le ha permitido ofrecer a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Hoy Ernestina necesita un préstamo de $250 USD para comprar mercancía para esta próxima temporada navideña, ella espera que sus ventas se incrementen y sus ingresos sean mayores. Ella y sus hijos necesitan de tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru runs a cosmetics shop in a busy area of Kariakoo in Dar es Salaam. She has three years in this business. She has good sales in her shop, which is favored by her business location and regular customers.

The size of the stock she keeps is small due to small capital. As a result she is usually faced with stock outs, which are not desirable in business. Nuru is in need of USD400 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mr. Chorn M., 26 years old, is single and lives in SiemReap province with his family. He works as a tuk tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motorcycle) driver and can usually earn around US$8 per day which helps his entire household - especially, in paying for his brothers' and sisters' education. Chorn is asking for loan of US$600 to purchase his own tuk tuk in order to help in financing his household's needs. In the future, Chorn hopes to save enough money to purchase another tuk tuk for his younger brother.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motor-bike) to use it for business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela E. C. is 27 and only finished third grade, but you wouldn't know it by her bearing and her business. She runs a well-furnished little school- and office-supplies store where her husband also does building design and drafting.  She started the business originally because there just wasn't an appropriate store in the town to provide things like notebooks, pencils, glue, and other school supplies.
This loan will go toward purchase of merchandise for the store. Gabriela has big dreams for her life, including providing houses for her children when they become adults. Gabriela has three children, and as you'd expect, the older ones are starting school.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Aslan H. is 51 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz with his wife and three children. He rents a small booth in the local market where he sells mostly women's clothing that he buys from wholesalers in Baku and at Azerbaijan's famous airport market. He has been in this  business for 12 years, and has taken out two loans from Normicro Khachmaz. He repaid both promptly, proving himself to be one of our best clients. Now he has come to us for a loan of $2,000 to buy seasonal goods. Of that sum, we hope that $1,200 will come from Kiva; the balance of $800 will be funded by Normicro Khachmaz.

loans.use: To buy new goods to sell

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Sita is 21 years old, married and has one daughter. She stays home to look after her elderly parents, but recently began to help her husband meet the needs of their family by opening up a small business selling shoes. This business is off to a good start, and she has come to us for a loan of $300 to buy additional inventory to sell from tables she has set up on the side of her house. With this loan, she believes that she can expand her business and fulfill her dream of helping her family live a better life.

loans.use: To resupply her shop

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.pt:
Carlos Fernando C. is 34 years old, married, and is the father of 5 children. He lives in the Albasine district near the city of Maputo. He entered the program in February of 2007 with a loan for 6.000MT and from then to now his business has grown reasonably. He has 2 stands in the Xiquelene market to sell used clothing and also refreshments and beer. He is looking for a loan of $825US for 6 months to continue to strengthen his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Carlos Fernando C. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Albasine, arredores da Cidade de Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT e de lá para cá o negócio teve um crescimento razoável.Tem duas bancas no mercado Xiquelene de venda de roupa usada, e ainda, vende refrescos e cerveja. Vai tomar um mepréstimo de 20.000MT para pagar em 6 meses para continuar a fortalecer mais o seu negócio.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Fátima Salvadora

texts.es:
Fatima Salvadora is a hardworking woman who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 12 years in the Mayoreo market in Managua. She is known as a very happy and humble woman. She started her business using her own savings of C$2000 (two thousand cordobas net) which she had been saving for a long time for.

She has two kids (a boy and a girl) who she must help to get an education as they are still young. Her greatest desire is for her kids to grow up to be professionals and not to suffer as she has, doing hard labour since she was young.

For the last three years Fatima has been supported by Ceprodel, receiving loans that she has invested directly into her business, buying products and remodelling her stall in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Fátima Salvadora es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de todo tipo en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital propio de C$ 2000 (Dos mil córdobas netos) obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros propios de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es madre de dos hijos (un niño y una niña) los cuales tiene el deber de brindarles educación ya que son menores de edad. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos se preparen para poder ser profesionales y no sufrir como ella considera que sufrió desde muy joven con trabajos muy pesados. Desde hace tres años, la señora Fátima se ha apoyado de Ceprodel, obteniendo prestamos que los ha invertido directamente en su negocio para la compra de sus productos y la remodelación de su local en el mercado.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables/Compra de las verduras y frutas

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
"Several months ago I finished the construction of a room in the patio of my house, but I was unable to continue due to the lack of money. I am only missing to plaster the walls and finish the concrete roof in order to be able to inhabit this room which we dearly need". I am requesting a loan for $1,000 to plaster the walls and finish the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


“Hace algunos meses termine la construcción de un cuarto en el patio de mi casa pero ya no pude continuar debido a que me falto dinero, ya solo me falta enjarrar las paredes y resanar la losa de concreto para poder habitar ese cuarto ya que nos hace mucha falta” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para resanar la losa de un cuarto y enjarrar las paredes.

loans.use: Plaster walls and Roof Finishing / Resanar losa y enjarre de paredes

loans.name: Ni Putu Miarni

texts.id:
Ni Putu Miarni and her family live a simple life. Their house is made of traditional dried leaves. She has 3 children. She is in the business of selling Hindu religious articles to support her family. Her husband also assists her in this business by helping her to find the material for the articles to be sold such as certain types of flowers, coconut and also coconut leaves etc). Ni Putu sells these religious articles everyday in a local market. In addition, some of her customers also come directly to her house to buy the articles.

She needs additional money to add her working capital as the prices of the material are increasing. She hopes to maintain her business as she already has regular customers and also this business is the only source of income for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan keluarga Ni Putu Miarni dan sangat sederhana karena rumah mereka terbuat dari gedeg dan tinggal dalam satu lingkungan tempat tinggal yang berdekatan dengan saudara – saudara yang lain tetapi mereka sangat rukun antara yang satu dengan lainnya. Ni Putu Miarni memiliki tiga orang anak. Dalam keserdehanaan ini Ni Putu Miarni tetap bersemangat berusaha untuk membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Hal ini dibuktikan dengan usaha menjual sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu untuk dijual dipasar setiap hari. Selain dijual kepasar ada juga pelanggan yang memesan langsung kerumahnya. Ni Putu Miarni sudah lama menggeluti usaha ini karena keuntungan yang diterima cukup besar dan bisa memenuhi kebutuhan hidup mereka setiap hari dan juga untuk biaya sekolah anaknya. Dalam menjalankan usaha ini Ni Putu Miarni tidak sendiri. Suaminya tetap setia membantu dalam mencari bahan baku untuk usahanya.Usaha ini akan terus dijalani karena hanya ketrampilan ini yang dimiliki oleh Ni Putu Miarni. Saat ini Ni Putu Miarni membutuhkan tambahan modal didalam usahanya untuk membeli bahan baku karena sekarang ini harga bahan baku sangat mahal dan Ni Putu Miarni berharap agar usahanya tetap bisa berjalan mengingat jumlah pelanggan yang dimiliki sudah banyak dan Ni Putu Miarni tidak mau kehilangan para pelangganya karena dari sinilah sumber kehidupan mereka.

loans.use: To buy materials for religious articles (Membeli bahan baku membuat sarana persembahyangan seperti aneka jenis bunga, kelapa muda, daun kelapa muda dan lain-lain)

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en: Ms. Adzo A. is a 34-year-old married woman with 2 children who are both enrolled in school.  Adzo owns a shop located in the central market Adéta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Here, Adzo sells many sizes and varieties of plates, pots and pans.  She has been in this business for several years and would like to diversify her inventory to include kitchen utensils.  With her loan, Adzo would like to buy silverware, ladles, large spoons and other kitchen utensils to increase the size of her business and attract more customers.  The profits that this growth will bring will enable Adzo to continue to send her children to school and to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy silverware, ladles, large spoons and other kitchen utensils

loans.name: Srim Ke Group

texts.en:
Mr. Srim K. is the leader of a six member group in Chro Moh Chrouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a subsistence farmer who also provides other rice farmers with his rice-processing machine; this earns him extra income to better support his family. Unfortunately, his machine needs to be repaired and so he is requesting a loan for that purpose.

Mr. Srim K. is 46 and the father of three children, all of whom are attending school. His wife, Mrs. Nan T., is a farmer and pig breeder. She usually assists her husband on the field to improve their living conditions together.

loans.use: To repair a rice machine in order to earn extra income.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells bulk fish. She is married and has three children, but her husband's income from his farming operations is insufficient to meet the needs of and to support their family.

However, there is high demand for Esi's goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such high demand by expanding her business in order to generate greater profits. As a result, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for the fish she sells by expanding her business.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Chab O., 36, sells a variety of grocery products out of her home in Prey Veng and typically makes US$2 each day. She has worked out of her home for the last four years and her husband, Phul Virak, drives a motortaxi in the city each day.  His revenue varies from week to week. They must support three children in their family and they would like to see their income increased. To increase their income they have thought about a business plan that would expand their current grocery store and increase the inventory to reach more customers. Chab O. has asked for a loan of US$300 to purchase more inventory.  She believes that this investment will help her business thrive in the future and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 48-year-old married entrepreneur and mother of five children. She runs a cereal and grocery business in Migori, Kenya, a venture she initiated in 2001. Despite stiff competition, Margaret has seen her business grow over the years. This can be attributed to hard work, years of experience and her well-established client base. She sells a wide range of cereals including beans, dry maize, rice, millet and sorghum. The profit from the sale of these staple foods helps her pay for her children's school fees and other household expenses, especially during the slow season. She plans to use three quarters of her next loan of US $700 to purchase an extra stock of beans and rice and put the remaining amount into her savings account to use in case of unforeseen circumstances.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Aurea es casada, tiene 44 años y 7 hijos, Aurea vive en la comunidad de Huascahura que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Aurea viaja a las ferias de Ceccelambras los días jueves, a Alpachaca los días domingo, en donde vende hoja de coca, que es consumido por los campesinos que tienen por costumbre ancestral masticar la hoja, para energizarse en los diferentes trabajos que realizan, la hoja de coca lo compra de la empresa nacional de coca y de las ferias compra queso, cereales, animales, luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde los animales los beneficia en su casa y lo vende de casa en casa, mientras que los cereales y los quesos lo vende a los comerciantes de los mercados.

Aurea necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, trigo, cebada, quinua. Los sueños de Aurea son mejorar su casa, brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the Arco Iris Communal Bank.

She is married, is 44 years of age and has 7 children. Aurea lives in the Huascahura community, situated 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Aurea travels to the fairs in Ceccelambras on Thursdays, and to Alpachaca on Sundays where she sells coca leaves, which are consumed by the farmers who by ancestral custom, chew it to energize themselves for the different tasks they carry out. She purchases the coca leaves from the national coca manufacturer, and at the fairs she purchases cheese, cereals, and animals. She then transports these products to the city of Ayacucho, where she butchers the animals in her home then sells them door-to-door, and she sells the cereals and cheese to the merchants in the markets.

Aurea needs a loan of 1600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of cheese, wheat, barley and quinoa. Aureas dream is to make improvements to her home and to offer her children proper nourishment and a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aurea needs a loan of 1600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of cheese, wheat, barley and quinoa.

loans.name: Mrs. Hem Chenda's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen members are part of the village bank loan in Andoung Svay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Hem C., 48 years old, is the village bank president. She is a Khmer cake maker who earns a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well with a steady stream of customers, she would like to expand it. She has asked for a loan to buy sticky rice to make more Khmer cake to meet her customers' demands. Her husband, Mr. Srey Ched, is a construction worker who earns less than $2 per day to support his family. They have four children: two sell purified water; one is a construction worker; the youngest is attending the local school.

All of these members have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy sticky rice

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en: Taleb is a 58 year old man. He lives in small village near Saida in southern Lebanon. He owns a small shop where he sells candies. Taleb wants to expand and diversify his business. Therefore, he has asked for a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua. His previous six loans have always been paid on time.

loans.use: To expand and diversify his business.

loans.name: Razia M.bota Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 52-year-old lady who resides in Kasur, Pakistan, where she has been living for the past 34 years. Her husband, M., is a milkman by profession. Razia baji has six children: five sons and one daughter. Her eldest son helps her husband in his milk business. The others are free and don’t do anything. 

Razia baji helps her husband to milk the buffalo. Her husband 25 years of experience selling buffalo milk. Razia baji has successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s milk business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Sahrish baji and Hamidan baji each want a loan to buy leather to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
En la zona Villa Adela de a ciudad de  El Alto, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “El Paraíso”. Ellas están muy contentas de pertenecer a la familia de Pro-Mujer porque además de los préstamos   reciben capacitaciones para mejorar sus negocios.
Casi todas casadas y con numerosos hijos, no cuentan con la ayuda de sus parejas por distintos motivos, teniendo que ser responsables de sus familias.
Las actividades que realiza la asociación “El paraíso” son de todo tipo alguna de ellas tiene un pequeña tienda de abarrotes, otra actividad es la elaboración de Api (mazamorra de maíz) con pasteles, también se dedican a la venta de cosméticos y otros. La mayoría de ellas tiene un puesto fijo en distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera generar mayores ganancias, que les permita cumplir con sus cuotas de crédito y obtener ingresos diarios para sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "El Paraíso" association is located in the city of El Alto, in the Villa Adela zone. The members are happy to belong to the Pro-Mujer family because apart from loans they also receive trainings in order to improve their businesses. The majority of the members are married with children; they don't rely on their husbands for varying reasons, and have taken on the mantle of providing for their families. There are various types of business within the "El Paraíso" association - some members have small grocery stores, others make Api (a sweet corn beverage) with pastries, and others sell cosmetics. The majority have a fixed location in various markets in the city of El Alto. They require major capital to expand their business and earn greater profits in order to make loan payments and generate daily income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to expand businesses

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: P. paid off her loan ahead of schedule and applied for her next loan. Her business has gone well and she decided to take expand her pig-raising business. P. is 23 years old and married to Mr. Bunthe. They have two children, all of whom are small. In order to grow her business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and use the remaining money to buy wood to keep for building her house in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and to buy wood

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 6 năm. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng sau đó chị đã đầu tư đi học nghề may Hiện tại chị đang là chủ hiệu may tại nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề hàn xì. Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Liên đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Liên mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ  một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm vải về may quần áo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua thêm một số dụng cụ phục vụ cho công việc hàn xì của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 29 years old. She has been participated in TYM Fund for 6 years. Initially she borrowed money to invest in raising livestock, but afterward she invested in learning to be a tailor. She currently is a tailor working at home, and her husband is welder. With an income of VND2,000,000 per month, the condition of living of her family has been improved.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND15,000,000. She will use part of the loan to buy textiles to make clothes to serve the needs of the local community, and the remaining part to buy additional tools for the welding work of her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textiles to make clothes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
“Be humble to others, surely you will reward in heaven” said Francisco L., a 63 year old client seeking financial support for her tailoring shop business.  Despite her retiring age, Francisco still is strong and determined to pursue her business, which is situated in Calamagui, 1st Ilagan, Isabela where her family also lives.  

Francisca is requesting the amount of PHP8,000, which will serve as additional business capital to further develop her tailoring shop.  Moreover, Francisca still has a clear sight for sewing at her age, optimistically aiming for business development. 
	
Francisca considers her sewing as a business habit since her children are already grown and have their own families, while her husband died few years ago.  Her four children are Samuel- 39 year’s old and vocational graduate, Marivic – 37 years old and a college graduate, James - 33 years old and a commerce graduate, and Jenino - 29 years old and now a trainer.

loans.use: Business capital to develop her tailoring shop

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa Aminta N. D. L., resiD. en la colonia nuestra Señora D. La Paz ubicada en el municipio D. Zaragoza, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como vigilante y sus dos hijas las cuales son estudiantes. Rosa Aminta posee una venta D. flores naturales en el mercado D. Santa Tecla en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en la compra D. más flores D. manera que más personas la busquen en el mercado y puedan comprarle sus hermosas flores, a pesar  que su negocio ha sido muy estable ella necesita percibir mayores ganancias las cuales contribuyan para solventar los gastos del hogar y los estudios D. sus pequeños hijos. Es por ello que ella solicita ayuda a través D. un préstamo, el cual le beneficie a ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Aminta N. D. L., lives in the suburb 'Our Lady of Peace' located in the municipality of Zaragoza, together with her husband who works as a security guard and her two daughters who are students. Rosa Aminta has a stall where she sells fresh flowers in the Santa Tecla market in the department of La Libertad. She is asking for a loan so that she can invest it in purchasing more flowers so that more people will seek her out in the market in order to buy her beautiful flowers. Although her business has been very stable, she needs to secure larger profits so that they contribute to covering the household expenses and the studies of her two small children. It is for this reason that she is asking for help in the shape of a loan, which will benefit her and all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more flowers

loans.name: Tiguida

texts.fr: Tiguida D. est une femme de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle veut avec ce prêt maintenir et renforcer son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide. Avec ces revenus, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne à sa famille.
texts.en:
Tiguida D. is a 43-year-old woman, married and the mother of five children. She wants to use this loan to continue and expand her business selling peanut butter. With the income, she intends to meet her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Processing and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 46-year-old widow with five children. She is a hard-working businesswoman who trades in her community in plantain, cassava, tomatoes and palm nuts. She buys her supply of foodstuffs from surrounding villages, and enjoys her work very much. However, commodity prices and transport costs have gone up due to the current fuel crisis, and this has rendered Rita's working capital most inadequate to purchase appreciable quantities to sell. She therefore needs a loan to inject additional capital into her business to enable her to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of foodstuffs. 

Rita hopes to increase her savings in order to pay her children's education fees. She is a member of the community group Shining Star, a trust group in which members guarantee for one another as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase plantain, cassava, tomatoes and palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Shiltu

texts.en: Shiltu sells charcoal and foodstuffs. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Shiltu hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Amistad” va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y buena administración D. los fondos, se encuentra representado por la señora Graciela y conformado por 14 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como comida, abarrotes, ropa y a la prestación D. servicios como el transporte público y la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Elvira y su mama la señora Graciela, pero ambas cuentan con ingreso independientes una D. la otra. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia en el mercado D. oferta y demanda D. productos pero gracias a los D. experiencia con la que cuentan saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. capital y la adquisición D. mercadería que amplié sus negocios y genere una mayor ganancia para mejorara la calida D. vida D. sus familias
texts.en:
The Friendship Communal Bank is receiving its second Kiva loan and has demonstrated responsibilty and excellent monetary stewardship. The group is represented by Graciela and is comprised of 14 members, the majority of whom operate businesses selling products such as food, groceries, and clothes, as well as offering services such as public transportation and tailoring. The members of the group share family ties to Elvira and her mother Graciela, but the women generate income independent of each other. The members accept that there is great competition in the market with supply and demand, but thanks to their experience, they know how to rise above this. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise and expand the members' businesses to generate better income and proviD. for a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou C. est parent beneficiaire dans la zone de camberene.elle est vendeuse detissus depuis plus de dix ans.voulant diversifier les produits de son activite elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille frs afin de pouvoir parallelement accroitre ses benefices et ameliorer ses conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou C. is a client parent in the Camberene area. She has been a seller of cloth for over ten years. Wanting to diversify the products in her business, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to grow her profits and at the same time to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal K. is 29-years old. He is married and has two children. Over the years he has tried various types of activities. Finally, ten years ago, he started his business selling cell phones. Khayal finds this business to be profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family.

However, Khayal thinks that it is overly expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it would cut expenses considerably if the goods were purchased in China. With this in mind, Khayal is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. This is his first loan and Khayal is grateful to everyone for supporting him. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a member of the Amani East borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 25-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two children. Her children are aged 7 and 2 years.

Mwajuma started her own food business selling bananas and tomatoes three years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Mwajuma’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 TSH in order to buy more bananas and tomatoes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Mwajuma hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, bananas and fruits

loans.name: Vanesa Rosalía

texts.es:
La señora VANESA ROSALÍA ARTEADA H., tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Jerusalén.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 1 hija de 5 años de edad,  quien depende económicamente de ella.
VANESA  se dedica a la venta a la venta de ropa y utensilios de cocina en la sierra liberteña. Viaja quincenalmente a vender sus productos.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra ropa para niños, damas y caballeros.
Este crédito de 1300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra ropa que traerá de Lima, accesorios como: relojes, pulseras, aretes, peines, etc.
 VANESA sueña con alquilar un stand en el centro de Trujillo, donde pueda vender ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
texts.en:
Sra. Vanesa Rosalia Arteada H. is 23 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Jerusalén”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has a 5 year old daughter who is financially dependent on her.

Vanesa sells clothing and kitchen utensils in the mountains of Liberteña. She travels every 2 weeks to sell her products. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy clothing for children, women, and men.

Her current loan of 1300 soles will be used to purchase clothing that will be shipped from Lima, as well as accessories such as watches, bracelets, earrings, combs, etc. Vanesa dreams of renting a booth in central Trujillo where she can sell clothing for children, teenagers, and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & accessories

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi is 27 years old and married. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Yemi sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and married to Raymundo, a company driver. They live in the village of Parog-Parog in the Solana municipality within Cagayan, the northernmost region of the Philippines. They are blessed with an eight-year-old daughter named Richelle Ayessa who is now in elementary school. Marites dreams that someday her daughter will finish her studies in college.

Marites owns a general store, and she is glad that it is doing well (she is saving some of her income to complete construction on their house). She has many customers and has always believed that good customer service and patience are important factors in developing a stable and successful business.

For the welfare of her family, Marites is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to expand her business into a grocery store. The loan will be a big help in buying more goods to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy additional goods with which to stock her store

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay P., 39, is a cake seller. She sells her produce to buyers who are villagers or passer-by and is typically earning an average of $3 a day. As another source of family income is from her husband working as a policeman. This couple has given birth to four children who are going to school. Chhay P. conducts her business more smoothly and there are many customers who recognize the delicious cake she made. To fulfill more her customer's needs, Chhay P. is borrowing a loan to enlarge her investment.

loans.use: To enlarge her investment

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence M. is 33 years old, married with four children aged 7 through 15 years, and takes care of three persons aged 16, 17 and 19 years.

Laurence lives in Nyarugenge district where she has sold cooking oil and shoes since 1994, employing five people from her community. Her business is open everyday from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m.

Laurence is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more cooking oil to sell so that she earns more profit.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen, a single 46-year-old, runs a restaurant out of her home. She has three children. Her oldest child is married and lives on his own and the two younger children live with her. The younger children are studying at the university and, when they have free time, they help their mother with the restaurant. Carmen has been in this business for over 30 years now. The restaurant is located in a village called Villa Coromilla in the Cochabamba department of Bolivia.

With her loan, Carmen will purchase more food for her restaurant. Recently, the demand for her restaurant has been increasing and she wants to make sure that she can meet the demand. She is excited and hopeful that her earnings will increase after she invests the loan in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food for a restaurant

loans.name: Sonia Gladis

texts.es:
Sonia Gladis tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil es casada, madre de 03 hijos solteros, estudió hasta 5to. de secundaria, vive en el  Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 03 años integra el Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles aumentó a su capital y compró 01 ganado vacuno negocio al que se dedica  desde hace 09 años.  Ella compra ganado en la feria de Ilave, Huacullani, López y vende en Pilcuyo y también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes desde hace 03 años.

Para seguir incrementando capital a su negocio solicitará nuevamente un crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles para comprar 01  ganado vacuno.

Su sueño es aperturar una tienda de abarrotes en la  Ciudad de Pilcuyo.
texts.en:
Sonia Gladis, 43, is married and the mother of 3 unmarried sons. She finished 11th grade and lives in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She has been a member of the "Ciudad Nueva" (New City) communal bank for the past three years. With her first, 300 new sol loan, she bought a head of cattle to raise, an occupation she has had for the past 9 years. She buys cattle at the Llave, Huacullani, and López fairs and sells in Pilcuyo. She has also raised guinea pigs for the last 3 years. To increase her working capital, she will ask for a new loan of 1,000 new soles which will be used to buy another head of cattle. Her dream is to open a grocery store in the city of Pilcuyo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hairdresser and she also sells hair materials like shampoo, hair-extensions and cream. She makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She hopes to own a fashion home in the future.

Regina is 53 years old and is married with 7 children. She lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria.

Regina hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more hair materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair materials to sell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a 30-year-old lady. She is married with two kids in school. She trades in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skim milk, body pomade, etc. in her community. Her experience has made her one of the most successful traders in her neighborhood. She considers this loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She believes your support will enable her to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Yaye Fatou

texts.fr: Yaye Fatou N. est âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce divers produits. Elle compte, avec les revenus générés, augmenter son épargne et prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Yaye Fatou N., 55, is married and the mother of 4 children. She has a little business selling various products. With the income she generates, she intends to put aside more money and support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling various products

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita O. is from the village of Bato in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Morita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Morita owns and operates a clothing business where she sells new clothing to local community members. Morita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Morita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Morita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Morita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use working capital. This will be Morita's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn S. lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province.  She is 61 years old and married with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory.  Her other child is a duck breeder.

Mrs. Khorn S. and her husband, Mr. Tuy Soun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field where they cultivate rice. In addition to farming, Mrs. Khorn S. also breeds ducks, which earns her a small income to support the family. Her business is going well and she wants to expand it. She is seeking a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. As a result of the loan, she expects an increased income and improvement in the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Blanca Liliam

texts.es:
La señora Blanca inicia a ofertar sus productos desde tempranas horas de la mañana en su tramo ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito es para la compra de plátanos, la cual estaban a un buen precio y como tiene bastante demanda por parte de sus clientes. 

Algo relevante de la señora blanca que los créditos que ha obtenido con Ceprodel le ha permitido que su negocio crezca más y así obtener mejores ganancia la cual le permite mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca begins selling her products in the early hours of the morning at her stand located in the Fourth Street market. La señora Blanca inicia a ofertar sus productos desde tempranas horas de la mañana en su tramo ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal. This loan will be used to purchase plantains, which are available for a good price, and are in high demand by her clients. The loans that Blanca has received from Ceprodel have allowed her business to grow giving her more profits and thus giving her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantains

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna tiene la edad de 39 años, mujer trabajadora desde su juventud ayudaba a sus padres a trabajar ya que dependían de familia de poco recurso económico, procreo dos hijos, estudiantes, su negocio es la venta de tortilla y cuajada, cerdo y los fines de semana hace sopa, para lograr mejores ingresos, cuando inicio lo hizo de forma ambulante por la capital de Managua, y así hizo mucha clientela el cual hasta ahora le compran sus ricas tortillas. Para ella no ha sido fácil ya que es madre soltera, y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener a sus dos hijos el cual desea que estudien para que tengan mejores oportunidad de trabajo en la vida. Su casa es bloque y tablas aun falta el repello de pared, hacer embaldosado ya que es de tierra, hacer la cocina y otras mejoras que poco a poco ha logrado hacer con los financiamiento que Afodenic a dado pero por su condición de disponibilidad de ingreso le prestan poco,  el cual va haciendo las mejores para el bienestar de su familia en fases.
texts.en:
Doña Reyna is 39 years old and a hardworking woman. Since her youth, she has had to help her parents by working because her family had few financial resources. Reyna has two children who are in school. Her business involves selling tortillas, curds, and pork. On the weekends, she prepares soup in order to earn extra income. When she first started, Reyna was a traveling merchant through the capital of Managua. She attracted many customers who now buy her flavorful tortillas.

Being a single mother is not easy for Reyna, but with great effort she has been able to support her two children. She wants them to study so that they can have better working opportunities in life. Her house is made of blocks and boards, but it lacks plaster on the walls and tiles on the floor because at the moment there is only dirt. Reyna will build the kitchen and make other improvements gradually using the loans from AFODENIC. Her financial condition provides little available income, so she is making improvements for her family’s welfare in phases.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to install a tile floor

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe L. E. de 57 años de edad, reside en San Diego, una de las playas más famosa del país, la cual es muy visitada por miles de turistas en todo el año y que se encuentra ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad, aquí vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 10 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan como pescadores, y el menor se dedica a estudiar. María posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada frente a la playa, en donde cuenta con la ventaja de ser la única que se encuentra en ese lugar, por lo que poseen muchos clientes entre ellos turistas. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda, comprando mayor cantidad de productos como: agua embotellada, sodas, jugos y otros más los cuales se venden en grandes cantidades, así mismo María desea contar con más productos, ya que se acerca la semana Santa, una de las épocas del año en que más personas vistan las playas, ya que es una tradición  muy propia de este país, es por esto que María desea contar con todo lo necesario para aprovechar la temporada y así obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual le permita seguir invirtiendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe L. E. is 57 years old and resides in San Diego, which has one of the most famous beaches in the country. It is visited by thousands of tourists throughout the year and is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and their three children (ages 22, 20, and 10). The two older children are adults and work as fishermen, while the youngest is a student. María has a store that is located across from the beach. She has the advantage of being the only establishment there, so she has many customers who are mostly tourists.

María is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to invest in her store. She will buy a large quantity of products such as bottle water, sodas, juices, and other items that are sold in bulk. At the same time, María wants to have more products because Holy Week is approaching and more people visit the beaches around this time of year. It is a tradition of its own in this part of the country. For this reason, María wants to have everything necessary to take advantage of the season so that she can generate more revenue that will allow her to continue investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottle water, sodas, and juices

location.town: San Diego, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improving her garden

loans.name: Mariano Nieves

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestro socio es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Mariano,  Nuestro socio tiene 56 años de edad es casado y tiene 4 hijos independientes todos, Nuestro socio se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra papa, maíz, avena, habas, alverjas, quinua y tarwi, Nuestro socio nos comenta que la producción de sus sembríos está sufriendo una plaga que está matando todo lo que sembró, por lo que está preocupado por su futura cosecha, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abono, en esta época que está más barato y así no le costará tanto para el tiempo de nueva cosecha.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sacro Communal Bank. He is a native of the Cruz Pata community, in the town of Chinchero, Urubamba province, department of Cuzco. Mariano is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom live independently. He is a farmer, growing potatoes, corn, oats, beans, peas, quinoa, and tarwi. He tells us that his crops are suffering from a disease that is killing everything he sowed, and that he is worried about the harvest. He asks for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer, which are cheaper right now, and thus won’t cost so much at harvest time. Mariano is grateful for and appreciates the support offered to him by this means, and commits to paying off his debt per the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for sowing his land

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
E. Madina is 26 years old. She is selling dishes and plates in the oriental style and also kid’s toys in a central local shop. Madina has been in this business for four years already. During these years, the business turned to a successful one, allowing Madina to support herself and her family. Now Madina is planning to increase the stock and to purchase the dishes and plates at wholesale. With this purpose, she requests $1,000 US Dollars. Madina thanks everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan timely. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dishes and plates at wholesale.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Perlita V. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita raises crops. She earns from planting and harvesting rice. Aside from farming, she also loves sewing and now earns from it. It is one of her hobbies that turned out to be an income-generating project. In February 2010, Perlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, crude oil for the tractor and cloth for sewing. This will be the second loan taken out by Perlita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it. About CEVI Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, crude oil for the tractor and cloth for sewing

loans.name: Nghiep

texts.en: Nghiep T. D. was born in 1952. She grows rice and breeds pigs. She has three children who are married. Her husband is a moto and bicycle repair worker. He has a daily income. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2003 and has repaid punctually. She wants to participate in SEDA forever because she can save money per week. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Eusebio Julio

texts.pt:
Eusébio Júlio M. vive no Distrito de Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No passado empréstimo conseguiu comprar todo o material que esteve previsto no seu pedido e também foi suficiente para o que pretendia. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido e houve muita melhoria na sua vida e conseguiu avançar bastante a sua obra.
O projecto de construção da sua casa está na sua ultima fase. Na sua vida o que melhorou é de ver a sua obra na sua fase conclusiva. O presente empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, tinta e outros) para concluir a sua residência.
Esta muito satisfeito com o empréstimo, esta conseguindo alcançar o seu sonho. No futuro pretende solicitar mais crédito para mobilar a sua casa e confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Eusébio Júlio M. lives in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. With his previous loan he bought all the material that was listed in his application, and the loan was also enough for what he wanted to do. He managed to pay off his loan on time, and there was much improvement in his life, and he managed to advance his construction project greatly. His home construction project is in its final phase. What has improved in his life is seeing the project in its final phase. With the current loan of 12,000 meticais, he intends to buy construction materials (sand, cement, paint and other items) to finish his home. Eusébio is very satisfied with the loan; he is achieving his dream. In the future, he intends to request more loans to furnish his house and make his family comfortable.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (sand, cement, paint, etc.)

loans.name: Kulsada

texts.en:
Kulsada C. is 46 years old and lives in Amanbaevo village in the north-west of Kyrgyzstan. She has three children – two sons, one of whom is a student, and a school-aged daughter. Kulsada has a higher pedagogical education, and during the last 20 years she has been working as a teacher of Kyrgyz language and literature in a local school. She is known as a purposeful, positive and sociable person. She likes to work with children and help them to be educated people, which is crucial in the formation of their personalities. Kulsada’s husband is engaged in farming.
Unfortunately, a teacher's salary in rural areas is very low. That is why in 1995, Kulsada began to engage in stock-breeding using the 10,000 Kyrgyz Soms that she had put aside for a rainy day. At that time, she had only two calves. Gaining experience in cattle breeding, Kulsada broadened her business and today owns three milk cows, three horses and 27 sheep. She also began to cultivate a plot of land. 
Kulsada is a really hardworking woman. Her striving to provide her children with a better life motivated her to apply for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms for cattle breeding last year. Using the revenues from this loan, Kulsada was able to buy a car for the family. Now, she has decided to apply for a second loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms. She will use it to buy 28 sheep.
In the future, Kulsada plans to build a house for her older son and to pay for a good education for the younger one. 

Kiva's field partner Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Kiva borrowers benefit from a five per cent discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas. This leads to increased employment and meets the interests of both clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la ciudad de Sicuani de la provincia de Canchis del departamento del Cusco. Antiguamente la ciudad del Cusco fue la capital del Imperio inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. 

Al cumplir mayoría de edad, Martha decidió estudiar para ser profesora y estudio en el prestigioso instituto superior pedagógico “Santa Rosa” del Cusco. Actualmente, Martha trabaja como profesora del nivel inicial en el colegio "283 de Ccatcapampa" en la comunidad de Ccatca, donde ella también vive.     

Con  su próximo préstamo, Martha espera recibir $500 USD. Utilizará el dinero del préstamo para hacer sus trámites de su diploma de bachillerato y también para apoyar a su tía que vende tamales de forma ambulatoria. 

Sus anhelos de Martha es terminar la maestría que está estudiando y abrir un jardín en la ciudad del Cusco y también abrir una tienda de venta de juguetes para bebes.
texts.en:
Martha was born in the city of Sicuani, Canchis province, Cusco department. In the past, Cusco was the capital of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the Perú Viceregency. When Martha became of age, she decided she wanted to be a teacher. She studied at Cusco’s prestigious “Santa Rosa” superior pedagogical institute. She is currently teaching elementary school at “283 de Ccatcapampa” school in Ccata, which is where she also lives. Martha expects to receive $500 USD in her next loan. She will use the funds to pay expenses related to her getting her diploma and also to help her aunt who is an itinerant tamale vendor. Martha’s dream is to finish the Master’s degree she’s currently working on and open a kindergarten in Cusco. She also wants to open a toy store for babies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For diploma expenses.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive en el caserío Cruceta Centro, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario que muchas veces no tienen al alcance de la mano. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido al trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece, con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo, quien trabaja en el sur del País, con el sostenimiento familiar.

Liliana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda incrementar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solictar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener a su esposo trabajando cerca para mantener a su familia reunida.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 28-year-old mother living in Cruceta Centro, a rural area of the agricultural district of Tambogrande, known for growing fruit for export located in Piura province, Piura region, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.
