She has a general store in her home where she stocks basic needs items. She offers her neighbors and customers all kinds of daily use products that they sometimes don’t have near at hand. The store is well received thanks to the customer service and quality of products she provides. Income from this activity helps her husband, who works in the south of the country, to support the family. Liliana hopes to increase her store’s stock with more products so that her sales level will rise and thus earn higher profits. To reach this goal she found herself needing to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 new soles. She is quite a hard working woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have her husband working near in order to maintain her family united.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en: Liezl B. is from the village of Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She is 39 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Liezl owns and operates a beauty salon. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Liezl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mrs. Nai Nann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In the Sdau Aem village in Takeo province there is a ten person group loan.  Nai N., 49, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for various pirposes.

Nai is a basket maker who sells baskets to her customers.  Her husband is a rice farmer. They work hard but earn a low income.  So, to improve her family Nai wants a loan to buy a cow. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is a student.

loans.use: Buy a cow.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a member of the Vigilant Group in Faulu Kenya. She sells charcoal in the Fuata Nyayo slums. She has been engaged in the business for three years, with most of her customers being low-income earners.  

She has benefited from the training offered by Faulu Kenya and she has learned how to manage her business. She wants to add stock of charcoal with the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal

loans.name: Oscar René

texts.es:
El  Sr. F.  es originario del municipio de El Sauce se desempeña como un pequeño comerciante donde tienes dos molinos ubicados en diferentes lugares: comarca San Ramón y  San José a 3 km del Municipio.
En cuanto a este financiamiento lo utilizara para compra de una planta eléctrica.
Lo que le permitirá al  cliente no dejar de funcionar en tiempo de falta de energía y asimismo seguir obteniendo su ingreso para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Mr. F. is originally from the town of El Sauce.  He is a small businessman who owns two mills in different locations, the San Ramón and San José settlements, 3km from town.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a generator, which will allow his customers to continue to operate when the power goes out, as well as allow him to continue to earn an income with which to support his family.

loans.use: Generator

loans.name: Joseph Ryane

texts.en:
Joseph Ryane T. is from the village of Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 21 years old. Joseph Ryane is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Joseph Ryane provides motorcycle transportation services. He has been engaged in his business for more than one year and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joseph Ryane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Joseph Ryane is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joseph Ryane from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for better service

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old and married. She has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 16. Gemalyn earns her living through farming. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. She works hard to sustain her children's education, especially now that the youngest is about to enter college. She said she and her husband hope for bright futures for their children. 

Gemalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao tiene 42 años de edad, reside en Yoloaiquin departamento de Morazán, vende productos lácteos, él vive con su familia su esposa María Andrea y una nieta de 9 años de edad.
Este negocio consiste en la venta de productos lácteos como cuajada, crema, leche, para la preparación de estos productos el compra la leche por mayor a los ganaderos de la zona y realiza el proceso para la obtención de los productos finales, tiene ya tres años de dedicarse al negocio.
Actualmente enfrenta un  problema de liquidez por lo que ha visto difícil la compra de leche por los que solicita un préstamo para poder solventar esta situación y volver nuevamente a procesar sus productos e incrementar su cantidad.
Él sueña con algún día tener los suficientes ahorros para construir su propia casa y llevar a su familia para tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
42-year old Estanislao lives in Yoloaiquin in Morazán Department. He sells milk products. He lives with his wife María Andrea and a 9-year old granddaughter.

He sells milk products such as cuajada (cheese curd), cream, and milk.  To make these products he buys milk wholesale from local dairy farmers. He’s been running this business for the past three years.

At the moment his biggest problem is lack of liquidity to buy milk. For this reason he is seeking a loan to address the situation, return once again to making the products, and increase the amount he produces.

Estanislao’s dream is to have enough money to build a house of his own and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Teriya de l’association Balimaya sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Heremakono-Centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. Elles excellent dans le commerce d’articles divers, savons liquides, Sounbala, graines d’arachide, beurre de karité etc.
Pour satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles  en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce  prêt MASSABA C., compte acheter, 500Kg de graine d’arachide, 300kg de beurre de karité et quelques paquets de divers autres condiments alimentaires auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, dans le marché de Bougouni, aux consommateurs et revendeurs. 
Avec ce prêt MASSABA C. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Teriya group within the Balimaya association are all married and, on average, are 34 years old and have 3 children. They live in extended traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Heremakono-Centre district of the town of BOUGOUNI, (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women met each other through business, family and neighborhood ties. They excel in the sale of various items: liquid soaps, Sounbala (a traditional condiment), peanut seeds, shea butter etc.

In order to meet sharply increasing customer demand, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan. 
With this loan, MASSABA C., intends to purchase 500 kilograms of peanut seeds, 300 kilograms of shea butter and a few packages of other various food condiments from suppliers in surrounding villages. She sells retail or wholesale, for cash or credit, door-to-door or at the market in Bougouni, to consumers and retailers. 
With this loan, MASSABA C. hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA Francs that will be used to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: Tu purchase food condiments

loans.name: Carlos Tulio De Jesus

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: CARLOS TULIO G.


Carlos Tulio G. agricultor de nacimiento trabaja la tierra desde que era muy niño, actualmente le prestas sus servicios a sus vecinos para así poder tener diariamente su jornal de trabajo.

Este agricultor tiene además un cultivo de lulo que le permite tener mayores ingresos, por esto el requiere de un crédito para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo y así podrá tener una cosecha sana y productiva.

Su familia conformada por su esposa y 5 hijos se benefician y mejora su calidad de vida gracia a los cultivo de Carlos Tulio y a su trabajo como agricultor.
texts.en: Carlos Tulio G., a farmer by birth, has worked the land from his childhood. He currently lends his services to his neighbours in order to work every day. This farmer has a Quito orange crop which allows him to make better earnings. He needs a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers for his crop in order to have a healthy and productive harvest. His family consists of his wife and five children. Their quality of life improves and they benefit from Carlos' crops and his work as a farmer.

loans.use: the purchase of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Urania Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. Urania Guadalupe González, trabaja como secretaria para el centro de insumos para la salud, es madre de tres hijos, pero solo uno depende de ella y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
Ha trabajado tres préstamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
Ella acude nuevamente a ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materiales  de construcción para hacer un cuarto para su hijo menor.
Ella se siente muy agradecida con ceprodel ya que ahora su vivienda cuenta con mejores condiciones gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel.
texts.en:
Urania Guadalupe Gonzalez works as a secretary in a health supply centre. She is mother of three children, but only one is still dependent on her as he is still school aged.

He has had previous loans through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and they were invested to improve her home. She requests a new loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials to build a bedroom for her youngest son. 

She is very grateful to Ceprodel because her home is in a better state now, thanks to the loans they granted her.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap V. is a woman who is married to Mr. Saroeun Un and both of them live in Prey Phni village in Takeo province. She is a weaver who is able to earn some money to support her family while her husband is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. In addition to farming, he is also a palm juice collector.

In the dry season, she wants to grow rice two times a year, so she needs some money to support this. To improve their farming, Mrs. Sopheap V. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, pesticide and to plow the rice field. Through this activity, they support three children who are enrolled in a local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: Jose tiene 46 años de edad es separado tiene dos hijas de 20 y 12 años el vive con su hija la mayor en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Urb La Palma Jose se dedica aproximadamente dos años al transporte labora de forma independiente en su propio vehiculo realizando el servicio de colectivo, el financiamiento sera destinado para el mantenimiento de su auto se le otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old, separated, and has two daughters (ages 20 and 12). He lives with his eldest daughter at his parents' house in Urb La Palma. Jose has been providing transportation services for approximately two years. He works independently, using his own vehicle that he acquired from the taxi cooperative.

This loan will be used for automobile maintenance. Jose is being granted this loan because he presents good references as well as the willingness and capacity to pay.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthan O., 53, is a widow with five children – four sons and one daughter. Her four sons work for a publishing shop and her daughter is a cleaner at a hotel in Phnom Penh City. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.   Chanthan is a weaver. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for children to ride to work

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Халимова Мамлакат проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 71 год. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Ее дети уже взрослые и живут отдельно. Она сама занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В этом ей помогает её муж. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности Мамлакат занимается 28 лет. Она берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mamlakat H. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 71 years old. She is married and has five children. Her children have already grown up and live separately. She is doing animal husbandry and breeds large horned cattle at home. Her husband is helping her. She is breeding the cattle for resale in the future. Mamlakat has been in this business for 28 years. She is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 55 years old and married with eight children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Anita has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 37 years.

Anita aspires to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock to sell

loans.name: Mwanamwaka

texts.en:
Mwanamwaka is a single woman with four children; three still attend school while one graduated from school. They own a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Mwanamwaka has operated a food vending business for the past seven years, cooking chapati (flat bread), beans and rice for sale. Mwanamwaka has been selling her food from door to door and from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.
With her loan of 30,000 KES, Mwanamwaka wants to purchase blocks to build her food stall, a bundle of wheat flour and potatoes. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase blocks to build her food stall, a bundle of wheat flour and potatoes

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Aurelia R. P. que tiene 57 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de primaria y esta casada con el señor silvstre el cual trabaja de jornalero, Doña Aurelia tiene dos hijos pero actualmento solo estudia la mas chica, tiene 16 años asiste al bachillerato.

Doña Aurelia nos platica que hace mas de 12 años tiene un pequeño molino de maiz con el cual muele el maiz a sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad,ella se levanta todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para iniciar su trabajo, ademas de trabajar en su molino ella vende maiz y masa por kilos.

ella nos platica que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con el pasar de los años las necesidades del hogar fueron mas grandes "y no hay de otra mas que trabajar  para ganarse la papa(comida)".

ella nesesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz y darle mantenimiento a su molino.

Doña Aurelia nos dice que desea comprar un molino nueo y mas grande asi que piensa ahorrar un poco de sus ganancias para poder lograr  su objetivo.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, in this community lives Aurelia R. P., who is 57 years old, went to 2nd grade and is married to Silvestre, a farm worker, Aurelia has two children but currently only the 16th year old goes to high-school. 

Aurelia says that she's had a corn mill for 12 years that she uses to grind corn for her friends and neighbors, she gets up at 5 a.m. every morning to begin her work, in addition of working at her mill she sells corn and mix by the kilogram.

She tells us that she decided to work on her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the family expenses and as time went by the home needs were larger "and there is no other choice but to work to have a bite to eat".  

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of corn and give maintenance to her mill.

Aurelia wishes to buy a newer and bigger mill so she will save some of her profits to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy corn and pieces to repair her corn mill

loans.name: Katerera Farmers Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
Vasta M. is the leader of Katerera farmers group in Bushenyi. He is 45 years old and married with seven children. Five of them are still in school. 

Vasta deals in the trading of produce like coffee, cotton, beans and maize from Nyamirima. He has done this work for over 12 years and he is able to generate 550,000 UGX monthly. 

He is very hard working and knowledgeable and he is happy that he was trained by a friend and his parents. 

He is a credit-worthy person and his dream is to educate his children and increase his loan amount to ensure sustainable growth. He needs a loan to be able to increase stock, especially coffee and cotton.

loans.use: To increase stock, especially coffee and cotton.

loans.name: Maetham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married and has two children. In 2009, Maetham opened a food market where he sells all kind of food and soft drinks. He has a good experience in this field, has a good reputation, and is well known in his area.
He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy a generator for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator for his shop.

loans.name: Sarita Katerine

texts.es:
Sarita es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad. Ella vive con su novio e hijo en su propia casa ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. La comunidad donde vive es rural y solo cuenta con servicios de energía eléctrica.

Sarita se dedica a la crianza aves de corral, cuenta con  pavos y gallinas que cría en su propio domicilio. Sarita comercializa sus aves en el mercado de la localidad y en los caseríos cercanos a los de su comunidad. Lleva más de 2 años desarrollando esta actividad y se siente contenta con los resultados obtenidos, es por ello que desea invertir en esta labor.

Sarita solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus aves. Esto le permitirá una mejor crianza y por lo tanto un mayor número de ventas. Esta inversión hará que Sarita  siga creciendo en su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sarita is a young, 23-year-old, entrepreneur.  She lives with her boyfriend and son in her own house located in Tambogrande-Piura District.  The community she lives in is rural and the only utility it has is electricity.

Sarita raises barnyard fowl; she has turkeys and chickens that she raises at home.  Sarita sells the birds in the local market and in settlements that are nearby her community.  She’s been in this line of work for over two years and she is happy with the results obtained and this is why she wants to invest in this work.

Sarita is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy balanced feed for her fowl.  This will make it possible for her to improve their care and thus increase sales.  This investment will cause Sarita to continue to grow in business to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin  is a single mother of six and only four of her children go to school. She has a business selling fish. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days a week. 

Kevin works at the market. She wants this loan to buy more baskets of  fish to sell retails.  Her business challenges include defaulters, the rainy season and thieves.  Kevin aspires to see her business grow big so that she could go to the family to bring the fish herself and to sell wholesale only. Kevin resides in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Benito es socio hace más D. 3 años  D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” donD. está conformado por 09 personas.
Benito tiene 36 años D. edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos (1 y D. 9 años). Benito trabaja en construcción civil donD. lleva  7 años laborando en dicho rubro, para salir adelante Benito a tenido que trabajar mucho ya que tiene dos menores que dependen D. él, es por ello que su conviviente toma L. decisión D.  apoyarlo  con los gastos del  hogar, es así que en L.  actualidad Benito ayuda a su conviviente en su negocio que tiene D. venta D. ropa y D. cosméticos generando utilidades para su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado Benito va invertir en el negocio D. su pareja comprando ropas adecuada a L. temporada como chompas, chalinas, buzos, entre otros. El deseo D. Benito es terminar D. construir su vivienda ya que falta techar el primer piso, y seguir apoyando a su pareja con su negocio. L. Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” es un grupo responsable ya que no ha tenido problemas con su pago, ellos agradecen al Programa por apoyarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Benito has been a member of the communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” for more than 3 years.  The bank is maD. up of 9 people.
Benito is 36 years old, lives with his partner and has 2 children (1 and 9 years old). Benito works in civil construction, and has done so for 7 years.  To get ahead, Benito has had to work a lot, as he has two dependent children to support.  That is why his partner maD. the decision to help him with the household expenses.  Currently, Benito helps his partner in her business selling clothing and cosmetics, which generates profits for their family.  With the requested loan, Benito is going to invest in his partner's business by purchasing seasonal clothing, like sweaters, track suits and scarves, among other items.  Benito's wishes are to finish construction on his home, since the first floor still needs to be roofed, and to continue supporting his partner in her business.  The communal bank “Santa Rosa D. Yanacoto” is a group of responsible people who have had no problems with their repayments.  They are grateful to the Program for supporting them in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, track suits and scarves.

loans.name: 58 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai operates a food stall, selling pork pies and fermented pork rolls. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork pies and fermented pork rolls to resell.

Hai is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Hai is the group leader of the 58 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Hai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hai has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hai hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase pork pies and fermented pork rolls to resell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, 43 years old, is a hard-working business woman. She is married and was blessed with four children; two of her children go to school and the other two children are already working and have their own families.

For almost 10 years, Rosana has been running her community-based sari-sari (variety) store and she is able to earn about P 3,000 monthly. Aside from her general store she is also engaged to vending viands and in transportation services. She earns about P 3,000 in vending her viands. 

Rosana uses her profit for her children allowances, school fees, payments on her new acquired motorcycle, and some of the amount is used in buying feed supplies for her pigs. She dreams of expanding her sari-sari store into a mini grocery. Rosana also hopes that she can send her children to higher levels of education. 

Rosana is asking for additional capital in the amount of P 35,000 which will be used in buying groceries such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods, instant noodles, assorted biscuits, raw vegetables, meat and 15 cases of soft drinks. She would be thankful if her loan request is granted.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, sugar, assorted biscuits, and raw vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 27 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and her husband is a school teacher. They have one child aged four years old. 

For the past five years now, she has been operating a provisions shop where she sells soda, soap, and rice amongst others. She makes a lot of profit and she uses it to help with the upkeep of her household. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her shop. She hopes to send her child to quality schools in the near future

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Myna

texts.en:
Myna is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 3 children. 
Myna makes & sells snacks like rice cakes, suman & ice candies. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Myna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Espíritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros del grupo, la cual contactó con una de las asesoras de la Fundación, la cual le explico e instruyó acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, luego de esto ella organizó a un grupo de amigas y vecinas de Ciudad del Este. Actualmente está integrado por 14 mujeres, donde todas ellas trabajan muy a gusto ya en el sexto ciclo del programa dentro de un ambiente de respeto, ayuda y mutua cooperación.
La señora María tiene un salón de belleza, por medio de este negocio que ella explota puede mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Dice que todos los días atiende a muchos clientes y gracias a su buena atención y dedicación puede atraer aun más. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y poder abrir más locales, con los cuales podrá seguir aumentando sus ingresos y además ayudar a otras personas dándoles trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, sprays, juego de tijeras, peinas y demás insumos necesaR. para la peluquería.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members who contacted one of the counselors of the Fundación. She explained and taught about the enterprising women program. Afterwards, she organized a group of friends and neighbors in the Ciudad del Este. At present, it is made up of 14 women and all of them are contentedly in the sixth cycle of the program in an ambience of respect, help and mutual cooperation. 

María has a beauty salon, With this business she is able to support herself and her family. She says that she serves many customers and thanks to her good service and dedication she can attract even more. One of her dreams is to keep growing and be bale to open more locales with which she will be able to increase her income and help other people by giving them work.  

She is asking for the loan to buy dyes, sprays, sets of scissors, combs and other materials necessary for a hair salon.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissor sets, combs and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efrain de 31 años de edad trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 5 años, desempeñandose como policia municipal. Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa y brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  Cabe señalar que todos sus creditos los ha utilizado para mejorar su vivienda, y que esta es la segunda vez que solicita el apoyo de kiva, pues con el credito anterior logro mejorar el techo de su casa.
texts.en: 31-year-old Efrain has been working for the Mayor's Office in Juigalpa for 5 years, serving in the municipal police. He has applied for his fourth loan with the goal of building a room in his house to improve his family's quality of life. All of Efrain's loans have been used to make improvements to his home. This is the second time he is seeking the support of Kiva, as with the previous loan he was able to improve the roof of his house.

loans.use: to construct a new room in his house

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Anesia's husband works as a driver.

Anesia has been in the business of raising hogs for a year. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed and cement for piggery construction. Each month, Anesia earns 4000 PHP by doing the hog raising business.

Anesia hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and cement for piggery construction.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 43 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 20 and 17. Janeth's husband works as a farmer.

Janeth provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community. She also sells dried fish. Janeth works hard to help her husband provide for their family's needs. She requested a loan to buy mani-pedi materials and more dried fish to sell. Janeth hopes to have a stable income that will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy manicure and pedicure materials and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Jessenia, tiene 30 años  de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de 8  años que estudian en escuela.  Ella está estudiando en una universidad a distancia para sacar el titulo de licenciada. Vive en casa de sus padres. 

La Señora Jessenia para ganar el sustento diario y para que a su hijo no le falte nada desde hace varios años se desempeña como maestra en una escuela privada de la localidad, pero además de esto ella también tiene una pequeña  papelería en su casa, en la cual tiene bastante clientela ya que además de vender artículos de papelería también da el servicio de copias. Ella trabaja todos los días y su mamá le ayuda cuando ella está en la escuela trabajando. Lleva 8 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para compara mas cuadernos, lápices, hojas de papel y otras artículos de papelería  que vende en su local. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para mejorar su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener su titulo de licenciada y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the Damas al Poder communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we met Jessenia.  She is 30 years old and separated, with an 8-year-old son in school from this relationship.  Jessenia is studying for her degree in a university via distance learning.  She lives in her parents' house.

Jessenia has worked for several years as a teacher in a private school in the area to pay for her daily expenses and to ensure that her son is never lacking anything.  Besides this she also has a small stationery store in her house.  She has lots of customers since in addition to selling stationery she also has a copying service.  She works every day and her mother helps out when she is in school or working.  She has had her business for eight years and it's going very well for her.

This loan is to buy more notebooks, pencils, paper, and other stationery that she sells in her place.

She has completed two loan cycles with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they offer to improve her business.  Her dreams are to get her degree and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, and other stationery.

loans.name: Ayité

texts.fr:
Ayité est un homme âgé de 25 ans. Il est célibataire.  
Ayité travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il achète et revend des habits prêt à porter à toutes personnes dans sa boutique à Lomé.  Il achète les habits au grand marché de Lomé, chez les grossistes qui viennent de la Chine et des Etats Unis et travaille seul à la boutique. 
Ayité a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de nouvel arrivage d’habits prêt à porter destinées à la vente. Il pense agrandir sa boutique avec ces profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayité voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de vente à l’intérieur du pays. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit s’assurer une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Ayité is a single 25-year-old man.

Ayité has been working as a retail merchant since 2006. He buys and sells ready-to-wear clothes to all-comers in his Lome shop. He buys clothes at Lome's general market, from wholesalers coming from China and the United States. He works alone in his shop.

Ayité requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a newly-arrived shipment of ready-to-wear clothes, for retail sales. He is thinking about expanding his shop with these additional profits.

In coming years, Ayité would like to open more outlets inside the country. He stated that the foreseen profits will ensure his financial autonomy.

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 51 years old and engaged in wax manufacturing. She has been in this business for 20 years. Through her livelihood, her family can pass the day with full stomachs. Because of her hardworking character, they never miss a single meal.

With her 20 years of experience, Charito can say that her product leads the competition. Because of its high quality, her floor wax captivates more customers. To meet her target market demand, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional raw materials to make floor wax. She hopes that her business will grow progressively in order to meet the needs of her family and lift them from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to make floor wax.

loans.name: Sameeh

texts.en: Sameeh is a 25-year-old man, he is married with three daughters.  He owns a grocery store, which is the only source of income to the family. Sameeh wants to purchase more groceries to better his collection of sale items including rice, sugar and soft drinks but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this so he needs to borrow a loan of $1,000 from FATEN.  When Sameeh gets the loan, he will purchase more groceries and increase his selection.  This will increase his sales and so increase his income, which will allow his family to improve their living conditions.  Sameeh is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Melianus

texts.en:
Melianus is a 34-year-old man, married to Orance, a 31-year-old lady. They have two children, namely: Irfan, 6, in the 1st grade of elementary school and Aurel, 9 months. Melianus and family are living in a rented house.

Melianus is a fishmonger; he sells fish from one house to another by using the motorbike that he bought after saving his money for 5 years. 

In order to improve his business,  Melianus is seeking a loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on more fish as demanded by his customers, fish such as: mottled, sardines, tuna, etc. He is hoping that TLM is willing to help him with the capital. He is expecting that the loan from TLM would bring a better life for his family to enable him to cover his family needs and the children's educational fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, e.g.: mottled, sardines, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Afiwa est une femme âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 1 enfant.
Afiwa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle vend des céréales, des tubercules d’igname et du charbon de bois pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Atakpame, Anié et Notse. Une personne l'aide dans l'exercice de ses activités. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficulté.
Afiwa a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, des tubercules d’igname et du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to a driver and has one child.

Afiwa has been working as a retail merchant since 1995. She sells cereals, yam tubers and charcoal to all-comers from her home. She resupplies in Atakpame, Anié and Notse. She has one person to help her with her business. At this time, she is experiencing no difficulties..

Afiwa requested her second Wages credit loan to purchase cereals, yam tubers and charcoal, as she wants to reinvest in the business.

In coming years, Afiwa wants to increase the size of her business. She said that with the profits she plans to ensure her child's education.

loans.use: Buy grain, yams and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, 41, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband helps her run this business. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business of selling groceries and sell a large amount, renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives with her four children and husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a shop in front of their house for the past nine years. They sell insecticides and fertilizer. 

Hoa would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of products to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of fertilizer and insecticides to sell

loans.name: Javan's Group

texts.en:
Javan, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 50 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 9 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 50 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Javan likes to think of himself as a very hard-working individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Javan plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Javan’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 40 years old, married and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She operates a livestock dispersal business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives her monthly income of approximately PHP 15,000.00 that sufficiently provides the needs of her family. Recently, she avails another loan to purchase more livestock for dispersal.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for dispersal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would use the loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials and of a machine that would improve the appearance of wood and thus raise the quality of her products.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en: Samandar M. rents a small booth in the Beylagan city bazaar and engages in the selling of fruits. He is married and he has 3 children. He is 60 years old. He established his business in 1998. He is a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch. His first loan from Normicro was in the amount of $300 in 2005. He borrowed $500 in 2006 and increased his daily sales. In 2007 his loan was in the amount of $800. He used this loan to buy more kinds of goods.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia C. O., 40, is married and has no less than 13 children. Her husband works in the corn fields in this beautiful area of the highlands of Guatemala, but the family struggles to feed all the children. Lidia has just started a little neighborhood store and is in the first month of operation.

The roof of her 7x7 foot store is just old tiles resting on branches, and it leaks a lot in the six months of the rainy season (right now). With this loan she'll buy more juices, chips, soap and rice to sell in the store. As the business grows she'll improve the roof with sheeting to solve that problem.

Women's group: "De la Cruz" in Paxixil, San Francisco El Alto, Totonicapán

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Inventory purchase for store

loans.name: Apriandi

texts.id:
Apriandi is an energic young man. He works hard. Apriandi is still single so he does not have any additional burden yet. Since he lives in a rented room, and did not cook himself, his daily living expense is Rp35,000 (about $3.80). So far Apriandi sells Kebaya (local fashion) shirts in the New Market, Kebo Iwa street in Denpasar, Bali. His motor cycle is essential to run his business, distributing his sales goods. With a capital of $10,000,000.00 (about US$1100), he could profit about Rp50,000-100,000 ($5.50-$11)/night. Capital from DINARI will be used to increase the number of his sales items. Apriandi also got an opportunity to open a place in a new location, Darmasaba market. Distance between Darmasaba market and Kebo Iwa New Market is 10km (about 6.5 miles). He sells in Darmasaba market in the morning, and at night at Kebo Iwa new market. He started work at 6:00 AM till 6:00 PM. The rest of time he used to find items for sales, and opportunities at other promising markets. His hope by adding new sales area is to increase daily profit to Rp100,000.00-Rp200,000.00 (about $11-$22).

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Apriandi anak muda yang enerjik. Dia sangat rajin bekerja. Apriandi belum berkeluarga, jadi dia masih belum memiliki tanggungan. Karena dia tinggal di kos – kosan dan tidak masak makanannya sendiri, biaya hidup per harinya mencapai Rp 35.000,00. Apriandi selama ini berjualan baju kebaya di pasar baru Jl. Kebo Iwa, Denpasar, Bali. Sepeda motor miliknya adalah sarana yang sangat dia butuhkan untuk kelangsungan usahanya ini dalam mendistribusikan barang – barang dagangannya. Dengan modal Rp 10.000.000,00 keuntungan yang diperoleh mencapai Rp 50.000,00 – Rp 100.000,00/malam. Modal dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah jumlah barang – barang dagangan. Sekarang Apriandi mendapat peluang usaha yang sama di tempat yang baru, yaitu di pasar Darmasaba. Jarak antara Pasar Darmasaba dengan Pasar Baru Kebo Iwa adalah 10 km. Dia berjualan pada pagi hari di pasar Darmasaba dan berjualan pada malam harinya di Pasar Baru Kebo Iwa. Waktunya di pasar mulai dari pukul 6 pagi sampai dengan 6 sore. Waktu sisanya digunakan untuk mencari barang – barang dagangan yang dia jual dan juga mencari kemungkinan pasar lain yang peluangnya menjanjikan baginya. Harapannya - dengan menambah tempat usaha berdagang - dia memperoleh keuntungan per hari ± Rp 100.000,00 – Rp 200.000,00.

loans.use:
To add number of sales items

Menambah jumlah barang – barang dagangan

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha B. is originally from Bluefields. Martha is 50 years old and her life long mate, Mr. Benacio Quintero, is 51 years old. The two of them have five children, three of which still live at home. Mrs. Balladeres owns a grocery store, which she has had for more than 15 years. Her clients range from children to men and women of all ages and they appreciate that she sells a wide variety of products (basic necessities, canned goods, school supplies, and personal hygiene).Mrs. B. wants to purchase 2 glass display cases so that she can better exhibit her pastries, sweet breads, and cosmetics. This will allow her to increase the variety of the products she offers. Each window costs $139.00.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Martha B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 50 años de edad, su pareja de vida es el Sr. Benacio Quintero de 51 años,ambos tiene 5 hijos, 3 viven con la pareja. La Sra. B. es la propietaria de una abarroteria , teniendo más de 15 años de experiencia, siendo sus clientes niños, hombre y mujeres de todas las edades prefiriendola por ofrecer variedades de productos (productos basicos, productos enlatados, productos escolares, productos de cuido personal). La Sra. B. quiere comprar 2 vitrinas de vidrio para poder exhibir productos de reposteria o de pan dulce y de cosmesticos de esta manera poder aumentar la variedad de productos que oferta, cada vitrina cuesta $139.00 dolares.

loans.use: Purchase of two glass display cases.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en: Abdurashid T. lives in B.Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. He has been a very active client of MicroInvest since 2004.  He has recommended himself as a serious and strongly motivated client. He engages in commercial services and trade. He has a business that sells bedding units and towels. Abdurashid  works in the Kistakuz bazaar. Now he wants to purchase child wear to expand the existing business. He has many permanent clients because he has a wide bedding and towel assortment. Now Abdurashid requests a loan  for  business support, to continue to increase the variety of bedding and towels he sells and to expand his inventory to include children's clothes.

loans.use: For business support

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
Mahkam is 66 years old. He and his wife have raised three children who are already married and have their own kids. They adore their grandparents. 

Mahkam works hard, despite his age. For more than 40 years, he has worked the land. He keeps a garden. Now Mahkam grows grapes on his plot of land, as well. He stores the grapes during the winter in a storehouse. After he processes them, Mahkam sells them in the local market. His wife, his youngest son and his daughter-in-law help him in the business. 

Mahkam has already received a loan from IMON. He has a positive credit history; he repaid his loan without violation or delinquency. This winter has been very cold in Tajikistan. Therefore, Mahkam requests 700.00 Somoni ($225.00 USD) in order to buy glass wool to warm the storehouse and save his grapes. Mahkam promises to repay the loan in 12 months and he thanks all for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of glass wool in order to warm the storehouse with grasps

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepcion is a resident of the village El Obraje in the city of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She is married, a mother and a housewife. Her husband works in agriculture on a small scale.

The problem that Mrs. Concepcion faces is that her village does not have electricity due to the fact that it is so far removed. This is the reason Mrs. Concepcion is requesting the installation of a solar panel in her home to improve her living conditions. To cover the costs she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel which will enable her to pay for the panel that she so needs. Having lights in her house will enable her to better carry out the work and duties in her home. In spite of her difficult financial situation, she affirms that with the support from Ceprodel she will improve her home conditions and will be able to get ahead together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Concepción B. es una dama habitante del pueblo El Obrage de la ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Es madre casada y se dedica al trabajo de ama de casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño.

La problemática que atraviesa la dama Concepción es que en su pueblo no cuentan con energía eléctrica por estar muy retirado de la ciudad. Por este motivo, la señora Concepción solicita la implementación de un panel solar para mejorar su situación de vida. Para cubrir esta deuda, muy inteligentemente acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan pagar el panel que le es de mucha utilidad por el hecho de que necesitan la luz eléctrica para realizar sus trabajos y quehaceres del hogar.

A pesar de su difícil situación económica, afirma que con el apoyo que le brinde CEPRODEL mejorara las condiciones de su hogar de habitación y además logrará salir adelante junto con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a solar panel

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mr. Pen C., 54, is a widower with 3 children who works in construction in Siem Reap Province. He  normally earns about $4 a day. To save on commuting expenses, he is requesting a loan of $300 from Kiva to purchase a motorbike. In the future when he has enough capital, he will open a small business for his children selling grocery products. He thanks you for your consideration.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Confort

texts.en: Ms. Confort A. is a friendly woman of 44 who lives and works in Adéta, Togo, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from the capital, Lomé.  Confort is married and the mother of 4 children who all go to school nearby.  To pay for her childrens’ education, Confort sells refreshing drinks and snacks in the central market in Adéta.  She has strategically placed her stand at the entrance to the market, to catch thirsty shoppers on their way in and out.  Confort specializes in Akpan Glacé, a traditional refreshing snack of soaked maize, which becomes soft and puffy, mixed with ice and sugar.  She also sells Citron Glacé, iced lemonade, which helps to quench shoppers’ thirsts on a hot Togolese afternoon.  Confort hopes to use her loan to buy more maize, sugar, ice, and lemons so that she can continue to run her refreshment stand, which allows her to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, ice, and lemons

loans.name: Muryati

texts.id:
Muryati has been making bags for the past 5 years. She usually sells her product to an art shop in Kuta. She makes her own bags, or subcontract it to her friends. Currently, Muryati takes bulk order. In the past, the Art Shop provides the raw materials, however, recently Muryati has to obtain her own materials. Because of limited fund availability, Muryati has to rely on loan to continue this business. She will lose her income if she cannot fulfill future orders.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Pekerjaan sebagai pengepul tas sudah ditekuni oleh Muryati sejak 5 tahun yang lalu. Biasanya dia mengambil pesanan dari Art Shop di daerah Kuta, setekah itu dijahit sendiri atau diberikan kepada temannya yang lain. Saat ini, Muryati mendapat pesanan tas dalam jumlah yang banyak. Tidak seperti biasanya bahan sudah disediakan oleh Art Shop, kali ini Muryati harus menyiapkan sendiri bahan untuk membuat tas. Karena terkendala modal, Muryati sangat berharap diberi pinjaman untuk meneruskan usaha ini karena usaha ini sebenarnya sangat menjanjikan. Kalau pesanan kali ini tidak bisa diselesaikan, maka tentu saja Muryati tidak memiliki penghasilan.

loans.use: Increase Working Capital

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila S., 42, is married and has three children. The family lives in the small refugee village of Varkhankend which situated in the Saatli region.

She owns dairy cows and has been selling milk and yogurt to the local people for more than twenty years. Nazila also works as a school teacher in the local school, but her salary is very low and is not enough to feed her family. To improve their living conditions, she is requesting a loan to purchase two dairy cows and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Alieta

texts.en: Alieta P., 43, is married with five children. She has four years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells her wares in the village four days each week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). This is her first loan through SPBD; these loans are Alieta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan entirely for the purchase of handicrafts to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more handicrafts for resale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L. (Shakya) opened her gift shop one year ago in the village of Khogana Dobata, intending to raise the living standard of her family. She sells various types of gift and decorative items in her shop. In Nepal the demand for gift items is increasing constantly because Nepal is very rich in its festivals. So to meet the demand of the customers, Mrs. Anita L. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy various types of gift items for her shop.

Anita L. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her husband's name is Rajesh Shakya. He went to Dubai few months ago for work. Her older son is studying in class 4 and her younger son is just 9 months old.

loans.use: To buy gift items for re-sale

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem Y., 41, sells dried fish at the local food market and typically makes $5 per day in net income. Her husband, Chim Doeun, is a fisherman who catches shrimp and other fish, making $6 per day. They live in Kampong Chhnang province with their six children and two of their children help their parents with the fishing business. It is a large family to support and the education needs of the four children are costly. Hem Y. has asked for a loan of $1000 to help her husband improve his fishing business through the purchase of a new, faster boat. Her husband frequently has to travel a long distance to reach the fishing area where he can catch the shrimp. This purchase can really help his business out and the family hopes that it can improve their standard of living and increase their income. Hem Y. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Chim Doeun, and his boat are pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann T. is a 47 year old widow with five children in the Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Two of her children hold a junior position in a company, while two others are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Vann T. owns a rice mill and earns a small income to support her family. Even though her family is involved in different businesses, they continue live in an old house that is in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Vann T. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Mashrab

texts.ru:
Хайиткулова Машраб 1967 года рождения, она замужем и у них 4 детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она  начала в 1998 году, с продажи тканей.  Она торгует на рынке Стадион города Турсунзаде. Машраб хорошо разбирается в тканях, при покупке ее товаров она рекомендует своим клиентам при выборе. У нее много клиентов, как обычные покупатели, так и швейные цеха. В его ассортименте имеются  такие ткани как  шифон, шелк, штапель  и т.д.
Свой товар Машраб закупает в оптовом рынке Корвон. В момент осеннего сезона ей необходимы дополнительные средства для покупки осенних тканей. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Mashrab H. was born in 1967, is married, and has four children. She began her business in 1998 selling fabrics. She sells in the Stadium market in Tursun-Zade. Mashrab know fabrics well, and she makes recommendations to her customers. She has many customers, both from the general public as well as from professional sewing shops. Her inventory includes chiffon, silk, rayon, etc. Mashrab buys her goods in the wholesale market Korvon. It is now autumn, and she needs additional funds to purchase seasonal fabrics. Because of this, she would like to take out a loan for 4,000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seasonal fabric

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahra is an 18 year-old woman, married with one child and living in Jeb Jenin in the Bekaa valley. Zahra works as a beautician. Since she has started to work in this field almost 2 years, Zahra was able to acquire a big number of clients. Today as she wishes to propose more services to her clientele, she is requesting $700 in order to buy a wax machine and beauty products.

loans.use: Buy equipment and beauty products

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo L. est âgée de 47 ans, marié et père de 7 enfants. Il réside à Lavie, un village à environ 135 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Cultivateur de profession, il espère par ce crédit accroître la surface cultivable en utilisant les métayers et aussi acheter de l’engrais pour enrichir le sol. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’accroître son rendement ce qui aura pour conséquences une augmentation des recettes et par conséquent une amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo L. is 47 years old, married and the father of 7 children. He lives in Lavie, a village about 135 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. A farmer by profession, he hopes this loan will help him increase his farm land by using sharecroppers and also buy fertilizer to enrich the soil. This opportunity will allow him to increase his yield, and consequently his revenue, which will improve conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for farming help and fertilizer

loans.name: Soin

texts.en:
Mr. Soin C. was born in 1962 and he now lives in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Cham province. He is employed in a cigarette company and he makes very little money to support the family. In his position, he needs his own motorbike to transport the cigarettes to re-sell but he does not have enough money to buy one. Thus, he decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for his work.

His wife, Mrs. Morn Sareth, is a housewife. Mr. Soin C. is the father of five children, one of whom is employed in the cigarette company while another is working in a garment factory. Two others are enrolled in the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. His wife is with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his current work

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином мужчина 40 лет , отец четверых детей, жена домохозяйка.Сам Ином пастух собственных 40 голов коз.Он пасёт их далеко от своего дома на отдалённом пастбище.Козы целыми днями питаются там разными целебными травами. При помощи купли продажи скота Ином находит прибыль на проживание.Жена занимается продажей козьей шерсти,и пряжи. Ином хочет увеличить численность своих коз.Для чего и хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Inom is 40 years old and the father of four children. His wife is a homemaker. Inom has his own herd of forty goats, which he grazes in a distant pasture far from home. The goats spend their days eating various beneficial grasses. Inom has been able to make enough profit trading in livestock to earn a living. His wife sells the wool and yarn. Inom would like to increase the size of his herd, and would like to take out a loan for that purpose.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: S. has been growing vegetables for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 a day. She can plant twice a year, growing her crops through different seasons, a skill she learned from her grandparents. S. is married and the mother of six children, two of whom are students while the others are employed. Her husband, Poeun, age 26, earns money by selling marbles. S. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo that will be used to plow her fields. (S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Mikocheni A Group

texts.en:
Balbina Victory, age 43, is single with three children ages 23, 17 and 14. She sells newspapers in Sukari House, right in the city centre of Stannic Bank, and after that she sells food. She works from 5am to 6pm daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $231.

This will be Balbina’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the two loans to increase stock by buying more newspapers and food and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase capital by increasing both businesses.

Balbina will share this loan with Subgroup A of the Mikocheni A group. The subgroup has eight members, who run cafes, general stores, clothing sales, snacks, tie and dye. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Balbina is 3rd from right, back row in green.

loans.use: Buy more newspapers and food stock.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy A. is already a widower. His wife died eight years ago because of heart failure. He has five children: the twins Raymart and Raymond - 16 years old; Richard - 14 years old, a high school freshman student; Arcee - 9 years old, in grade school, and their youngest, Clifford - 7 years old, also in grade school. With the help of his older twin boys in managing their livelihood, Roy hopes to continue to send his three younger children to school. They live in the peaceful village of Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela.

Roy has managed a tricycle transport and welding business for about 20 years. The business has become their sole source of income supporting the needs of his family. He now wants to borrow PHP 5,000 that he can use as additional capital for his welding shop business. He believes that the loan would be of great help to his business and especially to the education of his children. He further said that “a man only lives once and should do what is right”.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for his welding business

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia C. R., habita en las Pilas Orientales, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene  a su cargo dos hijos, una niña de 6 años y un niño de dos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y en un futuro poder comprar mas terreno e invertir en mas producción. Ella desde hace ocho años trabaja como agricultora, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, ella inicio como agricultora con el apoyo de sus suegros, con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar la producción y poder vender la producción a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Patricia C. R. lives with her husband in Pilas Orientales. He helps her with her agricultural work. They have a 6 year old daughter and a two year old son. The family plans are to improve their living conditions and, in the future, buy more land to increase production. She has been working in agriculture for eight years. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. She started her work with the support of her in laws. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and supplies to improve production and be able to sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Midieal

texts.en: Midieal sells bean cakes, popularly known as akara, and fried fish. She forty-nine years old and married with nine children. She is hoping to get a loan to purchase more beans and fish. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and fish

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores
Maria es casada tiene 43 años , dos hijos de 18 y 22 años que están estudiando 
Maria,   estudio corte y confección, hace 13 años  empezó de curiosidad  haciendo cortinas para su casa y después para familiares y amistades, poco a poco le fueron pidiendo y recomendando, actualmente  tiene su pequeño taller  de confección su casa, ha podido comprar maquinas y herramientas para la confección de cortinas. 
Desde que esta en Finca , su negocio ha mejorado, aprendió a invertir. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de telas de cortinas y forros de muebles. 
El sueño de Maria es tener un taller de confecciones y una casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Maria is married, is 43 years old and has two children who are 18 and 22 years old and who are students. Maria studied tailoring 13 years ago. Out of curiosity, she began making curtains for her house and later, for familiy members and friends. Gradually, they went to her with requests and recommendations. Currently, she has a small tailor's shop in her home. She has been able to buy machines and tools for curtain-making. Since joining FINCA, her business has improved and she has learned to invest. Maria needs a loan of 2,600 soles in order to purchase curtain fabric and furniture lining. Maria's dream is to have a shop and her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 2,600 soles in order to purchase curtain fabric and furniture lining.

loans.name: Azimchon

texts.ru: Азимчон – молодой человек 1983 года рождения. Холост. Занимается продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Азимчон привозят товар оптовые кондитерские фирмы. Ему привозят товар 3 раза в месяц. Азимчон планирует расширить бизнес и закупить партию импортных конфет и печений. Поэтому он просит кредит для осуществления своих планов.
texts.en:
Azimchon is 26 years old, unmarried, and sells confectionary products at the "Panshabe" market in Khujand. He receives wholesale goods from confectionary companies three times a month. Azimchon plans to expand his business and begin purchasing imported chocolates and cookies. He is asking for a loan in order to realize these plans.

Translated from Russian by Pavle Milekic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of chocholates and other sweets for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Koeurn Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-eight people who live in the  Ta Reap Doun Sor village in Kandal province make up this village bank. They will use the loan they obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Koeurn S. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables, specifically cucumbers, for her income. In the field, she now faces a small problem because infertile soil has affected her crop. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. She hopes she can produce productive cucumbers for sale. Her husband, Mr. Eang Auk, helps her with the vegetable planting. Mrs. Koeurn S. has two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is attending the local school. 

Eight members in this village bank loan are end-of-term borrowers and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The end-of-term borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida P. is a rice grower. Though its really tough work, she continues doing it because this their only source of livelihood. Until CEVI came, she wasn't able to get started on her additional business which is pigs.

To purchase certified rice seed, and three sacks of complete fertilizer are the purpose why she would like to apply for a loan from CEVI. Part of the loan will also be used to support her little piggery.

While its true that its expensive to start a business now, it is not too difficult because of the micro-financing efforts of CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds and three sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
El caballero Santos P. se ha dedicado desde hace 8 años a su negocio de venta de calzados ubicandose en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. El señor Santos ha logrado desarrollar su negocio ya que inició vendiendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha venido mejorando su situación en el negocio.

Ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los calzados y de esta manera exhibirlos en sus estantes para su venta. Espera que el crédito le sea de mucho beneficio para continuar mejorando su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos P. has spent 8 years working at his business, which sells footwear and is located in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. Mr. Santos has succeeded in growing his business; he started selling a few products, but over time, he has begun improving the circumstances of his business. He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel so that he can buy footwear and then exhibit his products in his stands for sale. He hopes that the loan will be beneficial to him, so that he can continue improving his business in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Doélé Emeline

texts.fr: Emeline a appris le métier de coiffure ; elle a débuté ce métier depuis 2005 dans le quartier d’Avédji à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 02 enfants. Son atelier est très visité de beaucoup de clientes pour leurs différents soins. Grâce à son expérience, elle satisfait à la demande de toute sa clientèle. Cette dame sollicite à présent un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits de beauté pour les soins de cheveux, des mèches de différentes gammes et des déodorants de toutes sortes. Elle a besoin de ce prêt car son stock est presque épuisé.
texts.en:
Emeline learned the trade of hairdressing; she started in 2005 in the Avédji district in Lomé. This business enables her to bring financial help to her husband for educating their two children. Her salon is patronized by many customers with different concerns. Thanks to her experience, she’s satisfying the demands of all her customers. This lady is presently requesting a WAGES loan to buy beauty products for hair care, some hair extensions in various ranges, and all sorts of deodorants. She needs this loan because her inventory is almost exhausted.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Charie

texts.en:
Charie is a balot vendor in the village of Cebu San Isidro, Isabela. (Balot is a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten from the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.) She is 44 years old and married to Cesar Sr., who is a house carpenter. The couple strives hard to provide for the needs of their family. To be able to buy more balot to sell, she is asking for additional business capital from Kiva lenders amounting PHP5,000. This loan will serve as a big help to the development of her business. 

The couple is blessed with six children: Cesar D. Jr.- 25 years old and a high school graduate; Richard - 24 years old; Michelle - 23 years old; Mary Jane - 21 years old and a high school graduate; Ramon - 17 years old and studying at the high school level; and Michael - 14 years old, who is in grade school. Through developing the business, Charie could be able to help her husband improve their way of living.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice J. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase used shoes to sell.  Alice is 42 years old and is Married with a husband that is a mechanic. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a super market BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase used shoes to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 52-year-old widow who has been working as a home-based tailor since 1979. While she has for years been able to meet her needs through her business, Fatmeh is now seeking to borrow $900 USD to purchase additional textiles to be able to produce a broader range of products to satisfy the requirements of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como taxi, es el único que solventa sus gastos ya que esta solo en la ciudad de La Paz, porque su familia se encuentra en la República de Argentina
Vive en la zona Pampahasi de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus suegros.
El crédito será destinado para compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su responsabilidad y la necesidad que tiene le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Jorge has a vehicle that he uses as a taxi. It is the only thing he has to pay his expenses. He is alone in the city of La Paz because his family is in the Republic of Argentina. He lives with his in-laws in the Pampahasi region of the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy tires and for maintenance of his vehicle. This is the fifth time he has asked Impro for a loan. His responsibility and the need that he has give him the opportunity to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and pay for maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Maria Rosa Marina

texts.es:
El banco comunal 3 de Noviembre se encuentra en la parroquia Cumbe al suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca,  éste lugar se caracteriza por sus artesanías en tejido, también se han identificado sitios arqueológicos como  Cauzhin y Tambo de Mariviña atractivos que atraen a turista nacional y extranjero.


La señora María Rosa A. es otra socia activa  de éste  banco comunal, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 47 años de edad está felizmente casada y concibió  siete  hijos de 26, 24, 23, 21, 14, 12, 10 años de edad, su hija mayor  se encuentra casada y vive independientemente, los tres siguientes trabajan y  ayudan económicamente en casa, mientras que sus tres últimos hijos aun son estudiantes de secundaria y primaria respectivamente.  Su esposo se dedica a la carpintería y con el esfuerzo familiar lograron construir su casa propia.
