María Rosa se dedica a la  cría gallinas criollas tanto para  el consumo de su hogar  como para la venta, divide su tiempo entre el cuidado de sus aves y los quehaceres de su hogar.  Lleva ocho  años trabajando con su banco comunal, con el crédito solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  va  comprar cría de pollos y comida  para iniciar su criadero.

Su sueño es de ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
The Third of November Community Bank is found in the parish of Cumbe, southwest of the city of Cuenca, Ecuador. This place is known for its craftwork in weaving and also for archeological sites like Cauzhin and Tambo de Mariviña, which attract national and foreign tourists alike. María Rosa A. is a member of the community bank and lives in Cumbe. She is 47 years old, happily married and has seven children, ages 26, 24, 23, 21, 13, 12 and 10. Her eldest daughter is married and out on her own, while the other three adults work and help the household economically. The youngest three are still in school. Her husband makes a living as a carpenter, and with the family's collective effort they were able to build their own home. María Rosa makes a living raising chickens, as much for her family to eat as to sell. She divides her time between caring for her birds and household chores. She has worked with her community bank for eight years, and with the loan she is requesting from Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir she plans to purchase a group of chickens and feed to start their rearing. Her dream is to expand her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and feed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. is a 32-year-old man married to Mary O.. Together they have two children ages six and three. 

Joseph operates a vehicle repair business. He has been repairing and spraying vehicles in a garage situated in Naivasha town. This is Joseph’s first loan from KADET and he has never borrowed from any micro finance institution before. He learned about KADET through his friends who are already clients.

With his loan, Joseph intends to buy a battery charging system. By introducing this new service, he will be in a position to serve his potential clientele better and more efficiently. He expects to receive more clients and therefore be able to improve his family’s living standards. 

He aspires to start a vehicle spare parts business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a battery charging system for his vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old married man, living with his wife in Chakra, Southern Lebanon. Ali has been working in furniture and house decorations since 1994, with seventeen years of experience. Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy iron pillars, which are necessary to his work. Ali’s customers are the people who live in his region; he hopes to expand to the neighboring villages in the future.

loans.use: To buy iron pillars

loans.name: Vicenta Isabel

texts.es:
Vicenta S. de 25 años, tiene una casa mixta de caña y cemento con agua y luz como servicios básicos esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja de guardia de seguridad en una empresa tiene 2 hijos uno de 5 años y otro de 11 años los dos estudiando en una escuela fiscal.

Vicenta hace ya 5 años atrás comenzó en su casa con la venta de bolos y banano empastados, fue así creciendo poco a poco su clientela por lo que pusieron una cancha de futbol frente a su casa  ahora ella vende también colas y hielo trabaja de lunes a domingos, una de las mayores complicaciones son las lluvias porque suele inundarse su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar leche, azúcar, fundas para poder incrementar su negocio y adecuarlo mejor. En el futuro quiere poner su propia tienda con productos bien surtidos.
texts.en:
Vincenta S. is 25 years old, and has a house built of reeds mixed with cement that has the basic services of light and water. It is located in the Paraíso neighborhood of Guayaquil. Her husband works as a security guard for a company. She has 2 children, aged 5 and 11, who are studying in public school. Vincenta started her business selling bolos (similar to a popsicle, but the frozen product comes inside a plastic tube) and chocolate covered bananas 5 years ago, and her customer base has grown little by little because they put a soccer field in front of her house. Now she also sells soft drinks and ice, and she works every day. One of her biggest problems has been the rain, because it tends to flood in her area. With the loan she wants to buy milk, sugar, and to have the funds to increase her business and supply it better. In the future she wants to have her own store that is well stocked with merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Maria Chuchi

texts.en:
Maria Chuchi T. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Maria Chuchi owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns an average of approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Maria Chuchi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Maria Chuchi is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family and to support the education of her children.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika C. is currently in the business of selling eggs at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more trays of eggs to sell.  Monika is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es: Digna esperanza P. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y  a sus seis hijos de 19, 18, 16, 8, 4 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales los dos menores no se dedican a estudiar. Digna se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, tostadas de yuca, plátano y pasteles de carne, este ultimo esta hecho a base de masa de maíz, la cual se rellena de verduras y luego se fríe, es un platillo típico del país el cual se acostumbra a comer por las tardes. El negocio esta ubicado en las cercanías de la iglesia católica del lugar. Esto le trae muchos beneficios ya que es un lugar muy transitado, en el cual las personas salen a comprar cada tarde algún tipo de platillo típico para disfrutar con sus familias. Digna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar: papas, aceite, ejotes, zanahorias, ya que son estos los ingredientes principales de su venta. Digna posee una familia muy extensa, por la cual debe trabajar muy duro junto a su esposo, e por esto que con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias, ella ha solicita un préstamo a Integral.
texts.en:
Digna Esperanza P. is 39 years old and lives in the department of San Miguel, where she lives together with her husband (who works as a salesman) and their six children (19, 18, 16, 8, 4, and 3 years old), the two youngest of which are not in school. Digna works selling french fries, fried yucca and bananas, and meat pies. The meat pies are made from a corn base and are filled with vegetables and then fried. It is a typical dish of El Salvador, which is usually eaten in the afternoons. Her business is located in the vicinity of the Catholic Church in the area. This brings her many benefits, as it is a busy area where people go shopping each afternoon to buy a typical dish to enjoy with their families. Digna is requesting a loan so she can have the necessary money to purchase potatoes, oil, green beans, and carrots, as these are the main ingredients for her sales. Digna have a very large family, so she must work very hard together with her husband. This is why she has requested a loan from Integral; because she has the hope of being able to improve her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, vegetables, and fried yucca and bananas

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillerma, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo, Julio (44), que es panadero y de sus 2 menores hijos que aún están en edad escolar.

Desde hace dos años, esta empeñosa mujer, se dedica a la preparación de queques, desde que era muy joven aprendió cómo hacerlos y además le gusta mezclar los ingredientes exactos para obtener una excelente preparación. Con el transcurrir del tiempo compró todos los utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus famosos postres. En la actualidad, los vende durante las mañanas a sus diferentes compradores (amigos y conocidos), quienes le compran toda su producción ni bien está terminada, sobretodo por los buenos precios y por el dulce sabor de cada uno. Guillerma está muy satisfecha con el negocio porque le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro planea ampliar el negocio y su producción para obtener mayores ganancias.

Es el 14ava vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando, además dice estar muy satisfecha con su grupo de trabajo, porque son muy puntuales y responsables en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.

Guillerma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, para abastecerse y continuar elaborando sus queques, pero en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 41 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband, Julio (44) who is a baker, and her two school-aged children. For the past two years, this enterprising woman has been making cakes. She learned how to make them when she was very young and she enjoys mixing the ingredients together to create excellent results. Over time she has bought all of the utensils she needs to prepare her famous desserts. She sells them to her customers (friends and acquaintances) who buy her entire batch before it’s completed, because of the good price and sweet flavor of each. Guillerma is satisfied with her business because it generates a good income which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Because she is such an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her business in the future in order to increase her income. This will be her 14th loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible, which has allowed her to continue running her business. She tells us that she is happy with her workgroup because its members are very responsible with each of their payments. Guillerma will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients in bulk, in order to continue making her cakes in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase teak and eucalyptus wood

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d'AKPAN qui est une nourriture très appréciée dans la cuisine togolaise et faite à base de céréales, une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour l’achat de 5 sacs de maïs, des sacs de mil, des sacs de sorgho et autres.
Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle contribue avec son revenu aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en:
Ms Kokoe G., a married woman and mother of five children, is involved in the activity of selling AKPAN, which is a food made from a variety of grains/cereals that is very appreciated in Togolese culture. As part of her stock is now depleted, she is soliciting a loan to use in re-stocking her ingredients. She would like to purchase five bags of corn, bags of millet, bags of sorghum and others. She uses the profits from her business to support the family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing grains

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana C. tienen 27 años  es soltera y vive con sus padres  en una casita pequeña de su propiedad, ellos se dedican a la agricultura y ella a la venta de almuerzos y meriendas gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le otorgaron un lugar de la casa y su madre le enseñó su rica sazón para preparar sus platos, lleva cuatro años en ésta labor.

 Es socia del Bankito Progresista hace tres ciclos, con los créditos obtenidos ha ido incrementando poco a poco su negocio y el dinero que recibirá del nuevo préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas, vajillas y algo de menaje de cocina.

Este banco comunal está ubicado en la ciudad  de Cuenca considera  la ciudad más bella del país por su paisaje natural andino que se divisa cuando se ingresa a la ciudad marcado por la linea del  horizonte que forman  las cúpulas radiantes de sus iglesias. Sus calles empedradas, sus ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro, y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica. 

Su meta es seguir estudiando y alcanzar su título en Contabilidad y Auditoria
texts.en:
Diana C. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in a small house on their own property. While her parents engage in agriculture, Diana sells lunches and snacks. Her parents helped her by providing a place in their house for her to work. Diana’s mother taught her how to prepare flavorful dishes. She has been in this business for four years.

Diana has been a member of the “Progresita” (Progressive) Communal Bank for three loan cycles. The loans she has obtained have helped increase her business gradually. Using the proceeds from her new loan, she will purchase tables, chairs, dishes, and a few kitchen utensils.

This Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which is considered to be the most beautiful city in the country because of its natural Andean landscapes. Upon entering the city, the site of church domes line the horizon. This historic city is made up of cobblestone streets, meandering rivers, charming wrought iron balconies, and beautiful gardens that contribute to the friendly atmosphere.

Diana’s goal is to continue her studies and obtain her degree in accounting and auditing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, dishes, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 25 year old man who owns a bakery. Ahmad specializes in croissants: flaky crescent-shaped bread roll made of a yeast dough similar to puff pastry, which can be either plain or sweet, such as a chocolate croissant. In Lebanon people also eat savoury croissants with zaatar (thyme) and jebneh (cheese). One can eat these croissant varieties anytime of the day, but somehow they taste better in the morning. The best time to eat a croissant is when it just went out of the oven when it is still hot, then it simply tastes great. Ahmad is a croissant specialist because he is known for his good and tasty croissants. He started his business a year ago when he realized that there is great demand for a baker in his region, especially since there is a school next to his bakery. Because he is well located, he has a broad customer base including friends, neighbors, passer bys and school children. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an oven and also a motorcycle for his bakery. The motorcycle will allow him to do home deliveries and increase his customers base. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Ahmad decided on this business because he always wanted to open a bakery on his own, after working in the same field and gaining some experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase an oven and also a motorcycle for his bakery.

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Moel Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people make up this village bank loA. located in SampA. Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Thy M. is village bank president, selected by the others members who will each use a piece of the loA. for different purposes. She was born in 1958. She and her husband, Mr. Sung Ley Kuy, are farmers who own a small piece of land and grow crops to sell to support their family's living. Now her problem is that her crop field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. To improve production, Mrs. Thy M. is asking for a loA. to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With this activity, the couple supports four children, one of whom is a healer, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Combine Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Combine Sisters” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sallay Papa K. who is pictured on the right. Sallay is approximately 48 year old and was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. She is married with six children. Her husband is a businessman and two of her children attend school: one is in primary school and the other in college.  Sallay Papa sells dried fish and has been running this business for many years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy baskets full of dried fish. Sallay’s ambition is to make enough profit to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old and she sells dried fish and operates a fish cage business. She started her businesses since joining ASHI in 1995, as an additional source of income but they already are bringing in profit as a main source. Nenita`s weekly profit is 3,000 Php and she is going to increase it. For this reason she applied for a loan in the amount of 45,000 PHP. She says that selling dried fish and fresh fish in an open-air stall is not easy as it is very hot, therefore Nenita wishes to save enough money to construct her own booth.

As a loving mother, Nenita’s biggest dreams are always for her children and family. She wants to bring her family to a decent life. In 1995, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a Kiva partner in the Philippines. She hoped to have access to capital to establish her businesses. Her previous loans from ASHI were carefully utilized as additional and rolling working capital for her fish cage and for selling dried fish products. The businesses are a big help for the family in covering their expenses and to set aside savings for the future.

To save for her family’s future and for supplementary income, Nenita wants to build new businesses: RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) and food preparation. Nenita wants to thank Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. That is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her dreams.

loans.use: To support her fish cage business and dried fish sales

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan operates bangles selling business to support her family. She visits different jewelry shops in Borewala city to get orders and supplies in the given time to make an income. Her husband and son make handmade curtains (which is used for windows and doors to avoid the sun’s heat). It provides them with a reasonable income. Their business grows especially in the summer season, and they now face the problem of insufficient stock.
  
So, Rafiqan has applied for a loan for the second time from Asasah to support her husband’s business. He will buy raw materials (cloth, thread and beads) needed to make more curtains. 

Rafiqan has five children, but only one is able to get an education. She wants him to complete his education and also wants to send her remaining children to school, especially her son who has started working at a young age. Rafiqan is hopeful that she will be able to fulfill her dreams of sending her children to school with the help of increased income as a result of investment.

This is a group loan.

Note: Rafiqan is showing her bangles in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making curtains.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang T. P. is the leader of a 5-member loan group from SEDA. She was born in 1987. She lives in Duong Nhan village, where she grows rice and raises pigs. She has two children who are still young. Her husband is a mechanic, and together they have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Hang T. P. would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to help her breed her pigs. This is her first loan from SEDA.

About other borrowers in her group:

Hien T. N. was born in 1981. She raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to buy food for her pigs.

Huynh D. N. was born in 1960. He breeds pigs. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in livestock.

Son V. D. was born in 1984. He raises chickens, and wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

Thien D. N. was born in 1980. He has three children. He breeds poultry, and would like to borrow  5,014,000 VND in order to buy food for his animals.

loans.use: to breed her pigs

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia comes from a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. She lives in a four-room brick house with her family in the area called Yadgar. She moved here after her marriage with S. M. two years ago. She is 31 years old, a very enthusiastic lady who has an infant child, a baby girl named Rosemary. As a housewife she is doing a great job and is playing her part as a mother and a wife very well.

Her husband is a blacksmith. He runs a shop in the market where he makes iron rods and iron-made items such as doors and windows for his customers. He has been doing this work since his youth. He learned this art from his father who was a famous blacksmith of his time.  

Nazia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount her husband will buy iron in larger quantity because he has got a large order to fill. Nazia is confident that her husband will be able to fill the order with the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy better living conditions. She is a new loan applicant. She is hopeful that it will be a good experience for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchase iron to fill a large order on time

loans.name: Kageni Enole

texts.en:
Kageni Enole G. is 61 years old and she supports three members of her family. Her spouse is Miringan G. ,who is a farmer. They both do farming on their own piece of land.

She has been rearing cattle for the last four years. Her aim is to buy young rams during the dry season when they are not very costly, then place them in her farm which she has fenced for grazing. After the rainy season, when they have fattened, she sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

She learned about KADET LTD. from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy three young bulls for fattening to sell later at a profit.

Her future dream is that she will become a large-scale farmer in cattle rearing. 

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her set target.

loans.use: To spend 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) to buy three heifers at Ksh10,000 each

loans.name: Gulfa

texts.en:
Gulfa A. lives in Kyrgyzstan, in Tashkomur city. She is 41. Her spouse works as chief of a building site called “Habitat” in Bishkek city. In this way, he makes 20,000 soms per month. Together the couple has two children who are school pupils. In the course of five years after Gulfa’s husband suggestion, they have started their own business concerning computer services (Xerox, computer games). Because Gulfa earns additional money (her salary is 8,000 soms per month) by working as an engineer at TSP Company, her children help to run this business after their studies. Out of the profits, the family has managed to purchase a lot in Bishkek and have almost built a house. In order to finish building the house and make some repairs, the family needs a loan. In the future Gulfa wants to finish the building, equip it with necessary facilities and obtain a car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married with three children.  He has been operating Mama Safi shop (a general store) to earn a living.  His business is located in the Kwa Reuben slums, so most of his customers are low-income earners.  His wife assists him in running the business because he is otherwise employed.  In fact, he was not available for the photo so we took his wife’s photo at the business premises.  

Peter has asked for his first loan of 20,000 KES to enlarge his business premises.  He says that he is expecting that the loan will help him to improve his status.

loans.use: To enlarge his business premises

loans.name: Yron Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Yron A. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación secundaria en el colegio José de la Cruz Mena del mismo municipio donde tiene tres años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel para la compra de un equipo de sonido con el objetivo de amueblar su hogar.
texts.en: Yron A. is originally from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and currently works as a junior high school teacher at the José de la Cruz Mena school in town.  He has worked there for three years.  This will be his first loan through Ceprodel and he will use the money to buy sound equipment in order to provide a better surrounding in his home.

loans.use: Sound equipment

loans.name: Melesa

texts.en:
Melesa B. is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old. Melesa is separated from spouse and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Melesa owns & operates a retail store, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junkfoods & instant noodles in the local community. She buys and sells fruit like watermelon, sweet bananas She also buys and sells firewood. Melesa has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Melesa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Melesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital for the business.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$ 3 in profit per day, while her husband is a taxi driver. On average, he earns US$ 5 per day. This couple has five children; four are in school and one is too young to attend school. 

Sun S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to replace an old and unreliable car for her husband to continue his transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi for her husband

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es: Manuela Del Socorro, es casada con 2 hijos mayores de edad que viven de manera independiente. Ella tiene su negocio que es una pulpería en su casa de habitación, no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, por lo que ha sido muy reconfortante. Inicio con este negocio desde hace 32 años, ya que en ese tiempo ella laboraba en Plastinic una empresa de fabricación de plástico con el tiempo fue decide realizar su propio negocio. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde.  El financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Manuela Del Socorro is a married woman with 2 grown children. She runs a general store from home. This is not the first time that she requests a loan, which is comforting. She started this business 32 years ago when she used to work at Plastinic, a plastic factory. As time progressed, she decided to start her own business. She has always liked to work and earn a living in a humble manner. This loan will be used to purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and staple grains.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elva Sebastiana

texts.es:
la señora Elva P. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nuevos Colorados y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y de esposo que la respalda en todo sus compromisos.
Elva les vende a muchas personas que trabajan en las plantaciones de ocra y esto hace que sus ventas sean buenas, Elva es honrada, responsable y cuenta con buenos principios tanto morales como religiosos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Elva P. is 43 years old, lives in the Nuevos Colorados neighborhood, and runs a general store from her home, where she sells popular consumable items.  She has the support of her son and husband, who backs her up in all her commitments.

Elva sells to many people who work on the okra plantations, and her sales are good.  She is honest, responsible, and has good moral and religious principles.

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to supply her store.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio su negocio hace varios años con la venta de ropa nueva y usada, comprando las pacas en donde viene una variedad de ropa. Iniciando con ahorros de su trabajo en lavado y planchado a domicilio.
Pues ha tenido que trabajar mucho ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus dos hijas.
Este es su segundo préstamo en Afodenic en donde seguirá invirtiendo en ropa nueva y usada, ya que se vende más por su bajo costo. Ventas que hace en los departamentos del norte de Jinotega, Somoto ya que ha captado clientela así como mejores ganancias ya que la venta es buena.
texts.en:
María is a small businesswoman who began her business years ago selling new and used clothing, buying a variety of clothing by the bundle, beginning with savings from her work washing and ironing clothing as a home laundry service.

She has had to work a lot as she does not have the support of her two daughter’s father.

This is her second loan with Afodenic, which she will invest in new and used clothing, as she sells a lot due to her low prices. She sells in the northern states of Jinotega and Simoto as she has gained customers there resulting in the best earning as the sales are good.

loans.use: Buy a variety of new and used clothing

loans.name: Elvis Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Elvis R. J. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la colonia Abrahan Zuniga en la ciudad de Nacaome.
Elvis se dedica a prestar el servicio de cambio de aceite a motocicletas, tiene poco tiempo de haber iniciado con su negocio en el cual le esta llendo muy bien.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cajas de aceite ya que asi es mas barato el aceite y puede obtener mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
dice sentirse feliz ya que tiene negocio propio y siente que cada dia lo visitan mas personas para que les haga el cambio de aceite a sus motocicletas, en un futuro si tiene muchos clientes piensa contratar a alguien para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Señor Elvis R. J. is 25 years old and lives in the Abrahan Zuniga district in the city of Nacaome. Elvis dedicates himself to providing a service, changing oil in motorcycles. He started his business not so long ago, and it is going well. The loan will be used to buy large cans of oil, because it is cheaper to buy it in bulk and he can make a greater profit, which he needs to cover his household expenses. He says he is happy, because he has his own business and feels that every day more customers come to have the oil changed in their motorcycles. In future, if he has enough customers, he hopes to hire someone else to work with him, so that he can meet all the customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy cans of motor oil

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and dressmaking. Her 52-year-old husband, Feliciano, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have five children who are between 11 and 29 years old. Tessie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tessie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for the pigs. She wants to continue to save up for the future education of her children. Tessie is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase feeds, medicines and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.en:
The women's committee "Juan Pablo II" was formed on August 13th, 2010.  With a lot of joint effort they are now on their 2nd loan cycle.  Besides the independent activity of each member of the group, they also have activities in which they work together, helping each other to reach the ultimate goal: to help their families.

Ms. Amelia L.'s story is touching. She sells milk and she says that through the loan given by the Foundation she was able to improve her business, living conditions and income.

She tells us that her business helped the economy of her family due to the fact that she is the only economic supporter of her household.  Ms. Amelia mentions that the activities that the Foundation helps them with are very important because this helps to develop their work capabilities and self-esteem.

loans.use: buying more milk for resale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. Lucia planted bananas on her land and now grows and sells banana cue (caramelized fried bananas) in her neighborhood. She also makes other delicacies like rice cakes. Aside from selling food, she also grows pigs in her backyard. She and her husband also decided to invest in a billiard hall. Lucia works hard and hopes to have a stable business.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP  to invest in expanding her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is a twenty four year old, enterprising single mother living in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda.

Tausi's dream is to build a permanent house, as she is currently in a semi-permanent accommodation. For three years Tausi has been operating her own beauty salon. She started as an employee but now has her own business and her ambition is to turn it into a beauty parlour of great renown.

One of the challenges she faces is that she has a limited number of driers to serve her increasing number of customers. Tausi intends to use this loan to buy hair driers and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase hair driers and cosmetics

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 54 years old.

Helen has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and ingredients for food for her eatery.

Helen has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Helen would like to expand the business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and ingredients to make food for her eatery

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en:
Ilkin V. is a hard-working, persistent entrepreneur from Agsu in the northern part of Azerbaijan. He is married and has three children, and his wife actively helps him.

Eight years ago Ilkin decided to open his own small grocery business. Today, his business is successful, and he is looking to expand it further. Ilkin has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN so that he can purchase additional foodstuffs for his grocery. He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers to use in making ever-popular delicacies.

One of Ilkin’s goals for his business is to help his children as he can. We are happy for this opportunity to assist this responsible, dedicated business owner as he works to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Deysi Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi; es conviviente; la socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos, de 23 y 21 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista y también ella tiene un restaurante, la socia a su vez tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende en su restaurante, desayunos, almuerzos, ella compra al por mayor arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros; la socia desea el crédito para poder invertir  en la compra de insumos para cocinar en el restaurante, la socia también implementara su tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio.


La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Deysi is part of “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” communal bank, located in the Urubamba province of Cusco department.  She is 43 years old and has a live in partner and two children who are 23 and 21 years old.  

Deysi alternates household activities with retail business.  She has a restaurant and in turn, a grocery store.  In her restaurant, she sells breakfast and lunch and purchases rice, sugar, noodles, oil and other things in bulk.  Deysi wants this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to cook in the restaurant.  She also wants to set up her store.  

Deysi wants the loan to invest in the purchase of products for her business.  She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to completing her loan payments with discipline.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of products for her business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita G. is from the village of Pakatan Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Julita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Julita owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business is selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Julita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients for her food business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branch offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the food she cooks for sale.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza, 44, is one of the community partners in CCT* with a heart to help others. Even as she makes her microbusiness grow, it is in her heart to extend the blessings to others. Feliza graduated from high school and now heads a family with Carlito, a mechanic. Feliza and Carlito raise eight children: one is in college, three are in high school, two study in elementary school and the other two stay home.
A vulcanizing shop is Feliza's business. She manages this hand in hand with Carlito, with no need yet for hiring employees. Everyday, they cater to clients in the vicinity with vehicles that need repairing. Feliza has been in this business for ten years and earns 10,600 PHP per month. She believes that her shop is going well but that it can be improved a lot more.
To capitalize on this opportunity to improve and level up, Feliza is seeking financial help by means of a 10,000 PHP loan. She intends to use this primarily to buy a machine needed for her vulcanizing shop. This added facility will definitely improve performance and, consequently, profits. The loan is a beacon of hope for her towards a growth in profits, and it serves as an encouragement to her to save more with the help of CCT. Feliza says that with the loan, she is more enabled to help others.
Feliza struggles with sickness at present, which hinders her from performing at her best and maximizing the opportunity to help others. Still, she believes in the Lord to strengthen her and bless her business as she remains faithful to her work with discipline and integrity. Feliza desires to lead a successful and peaceful life. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Leidy

texts.es: Leidy, tiene la edad de 34 años, está casada y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. Ella cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y lo que quiere es asistirla para mejorar su calidad y cantidad de cosecha este año. Ella quiere generar las ganancias para seguir produciendo en su cafetal y también quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Leidy, 34, is married and lives with her 4 children and her husband, who are her first priority. With this loan she plans to purchase inputs to help her coffee plantation. She has the land already planted and she wants help improving the quality and quantity of this year's harvest. She wants to generate income so that she can keep producing coffee and also for her family's future well-being. 

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has had loans before from the state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve her coffee harvest.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan, esta casado con la Sra. Nancy con quien tiene dos Hijos, ya en edad universitaria. El Sr. manifiesta que por medio de su duro trabajo pudo hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria.
Uno de sus hijos, la mujer esta terminando su carrera Universitaria, Lic. en Enfermería,  y el varon se esta por recibir de Policia Nacional, todas estas carrera tiene un costo muy elevado y el Sr. las costeo gracias al sacrificado trabajo en la Olería.
Ellos tienen casa propia Titulada y un terreno. En la actualidad cuenta con dos caballos y una yegua preñada, también cuenta con un carrito para el traslado de su materiales.
Solicita crédito para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de los ladrillos de Ceramicas, su Sueño es de que alguna vez puedan tener una camioneta para su transporte de mayor capacidad.
texts.en:
Juan is married to Nancy with whom he has 2 children, now at university age.  He says that by means of his hard work, he was able to make possible his children's university education. One of his children, the woman, is finishing her university career with a Licenciate in Nursing, and the male is qualifying for the National Police. Both of these career tracks have an elevated cost and Juan paid for them by arduous  work at the brick ovens.

The couple holds title to their house and land.  They now have 2 horses and a yoke of oxen. They can also count on a small car for transporting materials.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy primary materials for making ceramic bricks. His dream is that some day he may get a truck for transport with a larger capacity.

loans.use: buy prime materials for making ceramic bricks.

loans.name: Kevin's Group

texts.en:
Kevin‘s group is comprised of two hard working women. Kevin is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who is not currently in school. Kevin has a business of selling food, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Kevin has requested a loan of 250,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kevin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Kevin hopes to own a plot of land. Kevin is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital and her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: 63 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chien has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Chien is 48 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.
Chien is the group leader of the 63 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Chien's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Chien has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Chien faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chien hopes to remodel her house, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 10 children, Mercedes works hard to support her family. She has a jewelry and personal products sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Mercedes is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of jewelry and personal products to sell.

Mercedes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of jewelry and personal products

loans.name: Foo-Foo Group

texts.en:
Salamatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salamatu was born in Masimra village 36 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 4 children who attend primary and secondary school. Salamatu sells palm-oil and foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots). Salamatu has been doing this business for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Salamatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve on their living conditions. Salamatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy palm-oil and foo-foo in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and foo-foo in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and father to three girls.

Mohamad is an owner of a food market, selling sweets, soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products; he inherited his market from his father. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $1,500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his market

loans.name: Delmira Del Carmen

texts.es: Delmira trabaja para la educación desde hace 24 años, desempeñandose como  Docente. Esta solicitando  su 4to  credito con el objetivo de poner el piso a su casa y brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. Cabe señalar que sus creditos los ha utilizado para mejorar poco a poco su casa, sin embargo hasta ahora espera ser beneficiada con kiva.
texts.en:
Delmira has been worked as a teacher for 24 years.  She is requesting her fourth loan so that she can install a floor in her house, thus providing more comfortable conditions for her family.  

It should be noted that the loans have been used to make gradual improvements to her house.  For now, she hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva.

loans.use: to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 21 years, Jocelyn has been making and selling ice cream in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 45-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 20 and 18. She owns an eatery located at the front of her house. She cooks food that she sells to the people in her community. She also sells soft drinks. Carmelita has requested this loan to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices. Carmelita hopes for her business to grow. She also wants to see her children finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three sheep and grazing.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
el sr. Nicolas tiene 58 años de edad, está casado y es padre de 3 hijos, que dependen de él. Nicolas se dedica a la Caficultura,  casi toda una vida de dedicarse a dicha actividad, posee un amplio conocimiento en el trabajo de la tierra.
Don Nicolás utilizara el credito para comprarse su propio panel de energia solar, en su comunidad no gozan del servicio de energía eléctrica y el piensa que este será de gran beneficio para su familia por que podrán ver  T.V y cargar celulares para tener comunicación y sobre todo pasar iluminados por la noche y ya no en oscuras como han vivido todo el tiempo.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicolás is 58 years old, married and the father of three dependent children. Nicolás devotes himself to coffee farming. After almost an entire lifetime of working in said business, he possesses ample knowledge of how to work the earth. 

Don Nicolás will use the loan to purchase his own solar energy panel. His community has no electrical service and he thinks it will be of great benefit to his family because they will be able to watch tv and charge cell phones for their communication. Above all, it will enable them to move about at night lit up, and not remain in the dark as they always have lived.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is a college student. She has four children between the ages of 15 to 30 years old, three who are currently in school and live at home, while the younger one helps with the business. Her husband works at the airport.

For the past four years, Martha has been selling medicine in her community to sustain her and her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase paracetimol, ibuprofen, and cough syrup for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase paracetimol, ibuprofen, and cough syrup for her business

loans.name: Munkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Munkhsaikhan is 32 years old and married.  The entrepreneur lives with his spouse in a small apartment located in the local district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Previously, he worked in Korea for four years. Today he operates a grocery store retail business with his wife Tsoomoo. 

They own a grocery store, which needs some capital to increase its working capital, so Munkhsaikhan is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase a variety of products for their small store. 

Munkhsaikhan is experienced in business and a very ambitious man who desires to expand his own business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Marilyn has a rice field that  provides unhulled rice to sell  during harvest time. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loans.name: Njiriri

texts.en:
Njiriri is 50 years old and married to Esther.

He been growing seedlings in his nurseries for sell for four years and earns a monthly income of 7,000.  A credit officer introduced him to KADET LTD and he is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES.

He hopes to use this loan to expand his tree nurseries and seedling selling business.

loans.use: To buy seeds for growing in his nurseries

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 31, is single and resides with her mother and a brother in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her mother is a flat basket maker. Due to not having enough income, Phally is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to run a new business by purchasing clothes to sell in order to generate more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business of selling clothes by renting a store to sell at the market. The woman shown in the photo is her mother.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is 51 years old and married.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two sons. 

Her husband works as a seasonal worker.  Khanh earns money by running a general store in front of her house.  She sells many types of goods including confectionery, fast food and basic necessities to people in the local community.  She has run the shop for six years. 

Khanh intends to take a loan in order to purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers.  She hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate additional income to pay for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of general goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Valyeryi

texts.en:
Valyeryi is single. He lives with his parents. His father works at a factory and gets minimum salary, his mother is a housewife. The money they both earn is not enough to meet their needs. Valyeryi willingly contributes to the expenses of his family. His primary goal has always been to give his family a better standard of living. After Valyeryi got back from the military, he worked in a firm selling flower seeds and fertilizers. The experience he gained in this work gave him the confidence he needed to start his own small business and master his commercial activities efficiently. Valyeryi is very hard-working and enterprising. He works in his greenhouses day and night. He always says his work is something that gives him enthusiasm and inspiration, for it brings beauty into the world. In summer, Valyeryi sets up stalls in the open markets of the city selling the flowers and plants he has grown. Usually it provides a seasonal job and a decent salary for one or two free lancers. Valyeryi has succeeded in managing his previous loans in “Nadiya Ukraine” and repaid all of them without any delinquencies. Valyeryi is eager to access the above amount to buy more flower seeds and bulbs. He is planning to expand the surface he cultivates for greater production. Valyeryi is going to grow potted and cultivated flowers in the greenhouses and sell them in summer. This loan will help him get a wider variety of flowers and a larger quantity of plants. Moreover, the loan will give Valyeryi a chance to improve his greenhouses to protect them against ups and downs of the climate, particularly drops in temperature. Valyeryi will benefit from more consistent financial support because it will strengthen his trade and provide the important profit margin he needs to improve his business.

Валерій неодружений. Він живе з батьками. Батько працює на заводі, отримує мінімальну зарплатню. Мати – домогосподарка. Грошей, які вони заробляють вдвох, усе одно не вистачає на основні потреби. Валерій охоче допомагає родині фінансово. Для нього завжди головним було забезпечити рідних. Після повернення з армії Валерій працював на фірмі, яка продавала насіння квітів та добрива. Досвід, який він отримав, дав йому впевненість у власних силах для того, щоб почати свій бізнес та ефективно ним керувати. Валерій – дуже працьовитий та заповзятливий. Він працює в своїх теплицях вдень і вночі. Валерій завжди повторює, що робота – це те, що надихає його та сповнює ентузіазму, бо квіти дарують світові красу. Влітку Валерій торгує на ринку, він продає квіти, які виростив взимку. Зазвичай це забезпечує місце роботи та гідну зарплатню для ще одного або двох реалізаторів. Валерій виплатив усі попередні позики в „Надії України” без жодного прострочення. Валерій хотів би отримати вищевказану суму для того, щоб закупити більше насіння квітів. До того ж він планує розширити розміри теплиць та збільшити обсяги виробництва. Валерій хотів би вирощувати кімнатні та садові рослини, а потім продавати їх влітку. Позика допоможе йому виростити інші різновиди квітів та рослин. Окрім цього, завдяки позиці Валерій зможе покращити стан теплиць та захистити їх від кліматичних коливань, особливо низьких температур. Позика сприятиме розвитку бізнесу Валерія, бо фінансова підтримка зміцнить торгівлю та принесе йому прибуток необхідний для подальшого росту бізнесу.

loans.use: To purchase flower bulbs and seeds

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Mr. C. has been making and selling ice cream for 25 years. He and his wife sell the ice cream using two tricycles and traveling the city's main thoroughfares. "Thankfully, we are never short of work but we would like to improve and excel. With the loan money we want to create more jobs and, to do so, I would like to buy work equipment. I'm asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to begin my plans."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor C. tiene una experiencia de 25 años en la elaboración y venta de nieve, entre él y su esposa realizan las labores de venta, su medio de transporte son dos triciclos que con ellos recorren las principales arterias de la ciudad. "Gracias a dios nunca estamos escasos de trabajo pero si deseamos mejorar y sobresalir, con el apoyo que estamos solicitando pretendemos generar empleos, quisiera comprar mas equipo de trabajo para cumplir con mi objetivo. Les pido un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para comenzar con mis planes".

loans.use: To buy work equipment for two more people.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 28 years old, has 7 children, and her husband works in the fields cultivating corn. Melinda has a small store in her house. She sells food products and also sweets for children. With the loan she wants to expand the size of the store buy more merchandise, and in this way increase the family income. She is part of the “Clouds Group 8”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

MELINDA TIENE 28 AÑOS , TIENE 7 HIJOS,SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA SIEMBRA DEL MAIZ. ELLA TIENE, UNA TIENDA MUY PEQUEÑA EN SU CASA AHI VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES Y GOLOSINAS PARA NIÑOS . CON EL CREDITO QUIERE AMPLIAR EL LOCAL Y COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA DE ESTA FORMA INCREMENTAR EL INGRESO FAMILIAR .ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 8

loans.use: To expand the size of her store and to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia Orihuel, 53, is the wife of Cristino P., 47. Ignacia is retired and works around the house. Cristino works as an electrician, bus driver, and builder. The couple has a 3-year-old daughter.

The couple own more than 10 cows in a farm close to their house. For over 15 years, they have been selling their cows' milk. They have someone that lives on the farm and watches over the cows. Unfortunately, this year they are not selling as much milk as other years because, due to the cold weather, the cows are producing less milk. As a result, this season most of the milk is being used for personal consumption rather than selling it to other people.

Ignacia is asking for a loan to construct a better farm area for their cows.

loans.use: To construct a farm area for their cows.

loans.name: Fezahir

texts.en:
Fezahir is 49 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He lives in Aghsu Town with his family and four childen. He works as a taxi driver using his own car in Aghsu Town.

Fazahir's car is an old model and breaks down when he goes longer distances. He wants to repair his car. As he has little money of his own for that purpose, he has applied to Normicro's Aghsu branch for a loan of US$ 800 to reassemble the engine of his car.

loans.use: To repair the private car he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Emi

texts.en: Emi is 60 years old and married. She lives with her son's family, which includes three grandchildren. She has a small shop stocked with rice, snacks, and vegetables, where she earns about $3 per day. Emi would like a loan of $75 (IDR 500,000) to expand her shop. She is a member of MBK and can repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan B. has been selling  rice for 10 years at the central market of Istaravshan region,Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. His wife has her own business. She sells tea by boxes and sacks.Together they  try to earn money for family needs.They want their children to not need for anything. From the beginning Hasan started to buy products for retail sale, as his assets were limited.His partnership in Microinvest helped him to increase his working capital and to buy rice by lots (by the ton). Today Hasan has a good turnover of his goods and he makes purchases himself. From the KIVA program he is requesting a loan to make his next purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of rice in lots.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Sáng, 40 years old, is one of the first members of the TYM Fund, branch 7 of Mê Linh province. Her first loan was 30USD to invest in poultry and farming. After a year her family change to butcher shop and luncheon meat. The shop is popular and income is very steady at 200-230USD a month. She has a nice furnished 2 story house mean for her children’s education. She lives with her husband and 3 children at Tam Đồng village of Mê Linh. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to buy pork to make luncheon meat.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáng, 40 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ ngay từ những ngày đầu thành lập chi nhánh 7 Mê Linh. Số vốn vay ban đầu là 30USD được chị đầu tư chăn nuôi, làm ruộng. Sau một năm vay vốn gia đình chị mạnh dạn chuyển S. buôn bán thịt lợn, quay giò, làm chả. Quán của chị rất có uy tín với mọi người nên lúc nào cũng rất đông khách đặt và mua hàng, thu nhập rất ổn định. Qua nhiều năm tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị đã xây được ngôi nhà hai tầng khang trang, mua sắm các tiện nghi sinh hoạt đắt tiền và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Thu nhập từ cửa hàng là 200-230USD/tháng. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con đang trong độ tuổi ăn học tại xã Tam Đồng, Mê Linh. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm thịt lợn về làm giò, chả bán.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Lindsay

texts.en:
Lindsay is 26 years old. She is a single mother with a seven-year-old son. She joined the community “Imasumac” bank three years ago after being encouraged by a friend. In the bank she has received support and learned how to run her businesses more efficiently.

Lindsay has three businesses. She sells “caña”, an alcohol made from sugar cane, she sells food staples such as flour, rice and sugar, and in addition she travels nine hours once every two weeks to buy clothing in Lima that she then sells in Ayacucho. Lindsay has been selling food staples and clothing for two years, but only recently started selling caña. She now has three stores where she distributes the alcohol.

Lindsay needs a loan of 2500, soles which she will use to expand her caña business.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Lindsay plans to use her savings to buy a car. Her dream is to eventually have a large grocery distribution center, and to start buying caña directly from the producers in northern Peru.

loans.use: Lindsay needs a loan of 2500, soles which she will use to expand her caña business.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar was born in 1961. He is married and has 3 children. He has run a general store for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of  $950 to buy  goods for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.es:
Miriam, Mery y Rosario have belonged to the 30 de junio Banco Comunal for 6 years, 8 months and 2 years.

Miriam is married, is 30 years old and has 3 children. She sells meat house-to-house in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells blankets at different fairs throughout the region.

Mery lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 children. She sells breakfast walking through the Nery García market. Mery used to sell potatoes but stopped doing so because her son is young.

Rosario is separated, is 40 years old and has three children. She sells emoliente (a hot drink with healing properties) walking through the Nery García market.

Miriam, Mery and Rosario need loans of 600, 1000 and 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of meat, blankets, sugars, herbs and, in Mery's case, to pay for part of the land that she is going to buy.

Miriam, Mery and Rosario's dreams to have money in the future, their own homes and improves their businesses and for their children to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Miriam, Mery y Rosario pertenecen al Banco Comunal 30 de junio hace 6 años, 8 meses, 2 años.

Miriam es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Miriam vende carne de casa en casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Miriam vende mantas en las diferentes ferias de la región.

Por otro lado Mery es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Mery vende desayuno en el mercado Nery García de manera ambulatoria. Anteriormente Mery vendía tubérculos actividad que dejo de realizar porque su hijo es pequeño.

Mientras que Rosario es separada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Rosario vende emoliente (bebida caliente con propiedades curativas) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.

Miriam, Mery y Rosario necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, mantas, azúcar, hierbas y en el caso de Mery es para pagar una parte del terreno que comprará.

Los sueños de Miriam, Mery y Rosario son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener dinero en el futuro, casa propia y mejorar sus negocios.

loans.use: Miriam, Mery y Rosario need loans of 600, 1000 and 300 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of meat, blankets, sugar, herbs and,  in Mery's case to pay for part of the land that she is going to buy.

loans.name: Sunarya

texts.id:
Sunarya has started her business which is bags production since 6 years a go. She receives orders from area around Tuban almost everyday. The orders she receives keep her busy and do not allow her to do nothing. Now she receives quite big number of orders from an art shop that is her loyal customers, that require her to increase her capital that enable her to purchase raw materials. She hopes so much that DINARI will entrust her the loan.

The price of a bag she sells is around Rp.40.000 – Rp.60.000, depends on the style and difficulty during the making process. The income she earns from the business is enough to fulfill her daily needs and to pay her monthly house rent fee, Rp 275,000. She lives healthy together with her husband and children in a nice environment in Jl.Hyang Nyang Sari Tuban Bali.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sebagai pengrajin dan penjahit tas sudah ditekuni sejak 6 tahun yang lalu..Pesanan untuk membuat tas didapat dari sekitar Tuban. Setiap hari selalu saja ada pesanan, sehingga Sunarya tidak pernah mengangur. Saat ini, karena terlalu banyaknya pesanan dari art shop langganannya, Sunarya butuh modal untuk membeli bahan baku. Dia sangat berharap melalui DINARI dia dapat menerima pinjaman itu. Harga tas yang sudah jadi berkisar antara Rp.40.000 – Rp.60.000, tergantung model dan tingkat kesulitan dalam membuatnya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh cukup untuk keperluan sehari-hari dan membayar kos per bulan sebesar Rp. 275.000. Keadaan tempat tinggalnya baik, lingkungannya juga sehat. Bersama suami dan anaknya yang berusia 3 tahun, saat ini Sunarya tinggal di Jl.Hyang Nyang Sari Tuban Bali.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: María Hercilda

texts.es:
Hercilda R. is a merchant at a small market in the Sandino City neighborhood of Managua, where she dedicates herself to selling fruits and vegetables at her post. She has been dedicated to selling perishable goods for seven years, and it is her only source of income to provide for her two small children. It's important to mention that Hercilda is known for being a very hard-working woman, which has helped be able to supply her business with different types of fruits and vegetables. Today, she looks for the support of Kiva partner Ceprodel to obtain a loan so she can purchase her goods. She is confident that her request will be granted and she will thus be able to keep making headway with her business that is in dire needs of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hercilda R. es una comerciante del mercadito de Ciudad Sandino el cual se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en su establecimiento. Desde hace siete años se dedica a esta labor de venta de perecederos y es este su único ingreso con el cual sustenta su hogar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos.

Es menester mencionar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora el cual ha logrado surtir su negocio de diferentes tipos de frutas y verduras. Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de sus perecederos. Ella confía en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables / Compra de las frutas y verduras

loans.name: Sab

texts.en: Sab S., 35, and her husband, Kuy Koeun, live in Siem Reap and have been working in the farm fields for the last eighteen years. They work the land together and they typically make US$5 a day combined after they sell their crops in the local food market. They have three children who all still live in the household. Inflation has made it a very difficult year economically for most Cambodians and the rural areas seem to be affected the most. Sab S. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase some cows to help her plow the farmland. The land must be plowed each year and this purchase will allow her to increase the quality and quantity of the crops she is able to grow. It is an investment that gives her an opportunity to better support her family. Sab looks forward to seeing the results of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase cows to help plow

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S., 44, is married and lives with eight of her children in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Since 1998 S. has had a business making many kinds of baskets. Her husband, Pich Bunphoeun (pictured from his house) owns a motorbike with a trailer and travels around the province selling S.'s baskets. S. employs two of her children as security and waitress. The other children help their mother making baskets.

S. would like a loan of $500 to purchase more bamboo. This will allow her to make more baskets to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to make more basket.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mr. Muth V., 39, lives in the Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker who can earn $3.50 a day to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Saom Lun, works as a mat maker to help support the family. Her business is going well, so Mrs. Saom Lun wants to expand it. Her husband, Mr. Muth V., is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials to make the mats. He hopes to increase the number of customers his wife has and improve his living conditions with this loan. He and his wife are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make mats.

loans.name: Dilbar
